job_description:
Manager, Data House

Group: Mercedes-Benz Group AG

Description
Manager, Data House: Mercedes-Benz Canada needs fans like you
What it means to be a fan
Everything starts with fans. Mercedes-Benz Canada is the number one luxury automotive company in Canada, eight years in a row. We’re looking for someone who is enthusiastically devoted to Mercedes-Benz. You love our brand and have the drive to learn about the automotive industry. You’re impressed with the Mercedes-Benz legacy and can easily identify with what the star represents. And you’re eager to live Mercedes-Benz values and are ready to add to the story.
How your role will add to the story:
As part of MB Canada’s journey towards a data-driven organization, a dedicated Data House will be established. This Data House will be an agile swarm organization with the goal to enable and drive all relevant data and analytics topics. For this setup we need self-motivated and curious thinkers to bring data at MB Canada to the next level. The Data House Lead is responsible for conceptualization, communication, steering, and quality management of the overall data setup at MB Canada under the Data House. This position supports and enables the different business lead product teams as well as aligns with the named business Data Representative to collect and structure requirements and conceptually drive the overall Data journey at MB Canada.

A day in the life:
Leading the Data House as an agile swarm organization within the Digital House: Setup aligned working model and enable all stakeholders in executing accordingly. Coordinate the establishment and operation of the different product teams, based on specific use case requirements. Develop the strategic data target picture for MB Canada and plan concrete measures along a roadmap
Ensure comprehensive alignment between business units and Data House through close alignment with named Business Unit Data Representatives
Supporting the BI specialist role in maintaining and further developing existing BI capabilities provided through the Data House within MB Canada which also includes the enablement of business units, particular the data analysts
Enable business units to drive use case ideation along a planned data strategy and maturity roadmap for MB Canada
Provide an operation model to bring use cases, developed by business lead product teams, to production and be run as end-to-end services
Ensuring technical and legal data & privacy compliance in close cooperation with Legal and IT. Continuous monitoring of legal/policy & governance development. Provide update to relevant stakeholder.

M-B Canada requires all new employees to present proof they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 when they start work. Currently, an individual is considered “fully vaccinated” two weeks after receiving the second dose of a Health Canada approved two-dose vaccine, or two weeks after receiving one dose of a Health Canada approved single-dose vaccine. Individuals with medical exemptions preventing them from receiving the vaccine may request an accommodation.

Mercedes-Benz Canada Inc. is an equal opportunity employer that welcomes all applicants including persons with disabilities, visible minorities, women and aboriginals. We thank you for your interest, however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

Qualifications
Mercedes-Benz Fan skills, requirements & traits:
Bachelor's degree in computer science, statistics, data management
5 years of experience in data driven environment
Experience with data analytics core concepts, methods, and tools incl. cloud platforms and components (Microsoft Azure, Databricks etc.) as well as advanced analytics trend (particular in the sales domain)
Strong Project Management skills and experience working with agile methodologies and have product mindset
Minimum 5 years of Leadership and Management Skills
Proficiency with BI tools such as PowerBI and Tableau as well as cloud platforms
Conceptual understanding of the usage and architecture of Enterprise Application Platforms and how to leverage data analytics within these environments
Ability to work under pressure on multiple projects with cross functional teams while being accountable for completing work assignments with a high degree of accuracy and timeliness
General understanding of advanced analytics use cases in the automotive industry, particular regarding sales, after sales and customer experience management
Bold, innovative and enjoy challenging yourself
Honest and professional, a strong team player
Big picture thinker, go-getter, self-starter
Being a Mercedes-Benz Fan has its perks:

Organization Mercedes-Benz Canada Inc.

Primary Location Canada-Ontario-Mississauga

Work Locations 2680 Matheson Blvd East, Suite 500 2680 Matheson Blvd East, Suite 500 Mississauga

Caring for the world, one person at a time has inspired and united the people of Johnson & Johnson for over 130 years. We embrace research and science - bringing innovative ideas, products and services to advance the health and well-being of people.
With $82.6 billion in 2020 sales, Johnson & Johnson is the world's most comprehensive and broadly-based manufacturer of health care products, as well as a provider of related services, for the consumer, pharmaceutical, and medical devices markets. There are more than 260 Johnson & Johnson operating companies employing over 135,000 people and with products touching the lives of over a billion people every day, throughout the world. If you have the talent and desire to touch the world, Johnson & Johnson has the career opportunities to help make it happen.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Provides data science and analytics project/program development, leadership, and delivery using advanced analytics and innovative visualization techniques
Understands business needs via voice of customer analyses with stakeholders and customers, translates key findings to viable analytical projects that can be scaled and deployed worldwide, develops solution strategies that can be followed to meet customer needs
Derives valuable strategic insights by mining and integrating internal and external data sources, exploring data relationships, solving problems and resolving data anomalies, building and deploying rules-based and statistical models
Collaborates with and leads internal data, reporting and analytics colleagues as well as external suppliers and consultants in the delivery of strategic analytics projects
Deploys business intelligence tools for business customers through training and end user validation, enabling them to intuitively derive insights and actions from complex underlying information and models
Supplies to the overall improvement of the data science and analytics service offering by sharing skills and techniques with colleagues, learning from colleagues and taking steps to reduce inefficiencies. Builds connections between services and solutions, and generally improve our brand in the eyes of our customers
Provides onboarding and training to new team members whenever needed
Partners with procurement and business leaders in the regions to develop analyses enabling strategic decisions

Qualifications

A bachelor’s degree is required with majors in Statistics, Economics, Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Engineering or similar fields preferred
A minimum of 5 years of related experience
Experience as a Data Solutions Architect, crafting automated dataflow, building data pipelines using programming (Python, R, Scala) or ETL software (Alteryx, KNIME or similar)
Experience in data integration and quality evaluation activities
Strong analytical skills and hands-on professional experience with quantitative analytics is required
Experience in the use of visualization tools, open-source or commercial (Shiny, Dash, Streamlit, Tableau, Qlik, Cognos)
Experience in programming with one of the open-source programming languages used for data analytics/engineering (R, Python, Scala) and querying (SQL)
Proven attention to detail and accuracy, including the ability to quickly merge and summarize data/information from various sources, including experience in data management, cleaning, data analysis and report writing
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and computer skill is required. Advanced use of Microsoft Excel (including pivot tables, lookup procedures and sophisticated formulas with nested logic)
Independent self-starter, able to work with limited supervision and lead others without accountability
Strong project/account leadership skills with an ability to lead and prioritize multiple initiatives in a multifaceted environment with tight timelines is required. Shown success in working with an outsource analytics partner and leading projects timely and on budget is preferred.
Excellent English communication/presentation skills (written, spoken) in order to provide succinct, concise and insightful analysis/concepts and practical recommendations to a non-quantitative senior partner audience
Previous exposure or experience in a procurement function preferred
Previous experience as an Application Infrastructure architect and technical point of contact preferred
Experience and exposure to Global and Matrix organizations preferred
Customer focused and experience working in a shared service environment preferred
PMI, FPX, or other project management certification preferred
Six Sigma Green Belt and/or Design Excellence certification preferred
At Johnson & Johnson, we’re on a mission to change the trajectory of health for humanity. That starts by creating the world’s healthiest workforce. Through cutting-edge programs and policies, we empower the physical, mental, emotional, and financial health of our employees and the ones they love. As such, candidates offered employment must show proof of COVID-19 vaccination or secure an approved accommodation prior to the commencement of employment to support the well-being of our employees, their families and the communities in which we live and work.
For more information on how we support the whole health of our employees throughout their wellness, career and life journey, please visit www.careers.jnj.com.
Thriving on a diverse company culture and celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, we are committed to inclusion. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.
Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
Working with Johnson & Johnson can change everything. Including YOU.
#JNJDataScience

job_title: Manager of Data Science and Analytics

job_description:
We're transforming the grocery industry

At Instacart, we invite the world to share love through food because we believe everyone should have access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together. Where others see a simple need for grocery delivery, we see exciting complexity and endless opportunity to serve the varied needs of our community. We work to deliver an essential service that customers rely on to get their groceries and household goods, while also offering safe and flexible earnings opportunities to Instacart Personal Shoppers.

Instacart has become a lifeline for millions of people, and we're building the team to help push our shopping cart forward. If you're ready to do the best work of your life, come join our table.

Introducing Our Hybrid Working Model

As the future of work evolves, so do we. We have a hybrid model where our roles are open to in-office, flex, or remote work. Learn more about our flexible approach to where we work.
OVERVIEW

Instacart is seeking a Data Science Manager with experience leading world-class teams at a high-growth company. In this position you will partner with senior product and engineering leadership to grow and drive Instacart's Marketplace team. Marketplace sits at the core of Instacart. Our systems support millions of shoppers on the Instacart platform by offering immediate and flexible earnings opportunities, and they must remain highly reliable at all times to ensure that Instacart's customers receive on-time and high-quality deliveries. A major aspect of the team's success is finding the efficient frontier between service availability and fulfillment cost, all the while providing the best customer experience.

You will manage a growing Marketplace data science team and will tackle some of the most challenging and impactful problems that are transforming how people buy groceries every day. We build industry leading technology to power a balanced, sustainable and resilient marketplace that drives growth through efficiently meeting customer demand, incentivizing shoppers, and offering a widening range of high quality services.

You will hire and lead a team of data scientists responsible for generating insights to inform product and algorithm improvements that drive angle-changing growth. You will be a trusted partner to colleagues in product and engineering, helping to provide vision and direction to a data-driven product team. We're looking for an experienced leader who can hit the ground running and influence decision-making across the entire organization.

ABOUT THE JOB

You will lead a team of high-performing data scientists
You and your team will have a high impact on your stakeholder teams, product, and operations; you will hold yourself accountable to measurable improvements in business outcomes
You and your team will use expertise in causal inference, operations research, machine learning, complex systems modeling, economics, etc. to influence Instacart's product and algorithms
You and your team will design rigorous experiments and interpret results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
You and your team will develop statistical models to extract trends, measure results, and predict future performance of our product
You will be responsible for the health of your team's data - its completeness and quality
You and your team will enable objective decision making across the company by democratizing data through dashboards and other analytical tools
You and your team will present findings in a compelling way to influence Instacart's leadership

ABOUT YOU

5+ years experience working in a quantitative role at a product or ecommerce company
2+ years experience managing a team of data scientists
Graduate degree in Operations Research, Machine Learning, Economics, Statistics or a related technical field
Experience working on gig economy issues, multi-sided marketplaces, logistics, pricing or e-commerce
Ability to run rigorous experiments and come up with scientifically sound recommendations
Strong track record in forming effective cross-functional partnerships with stakeholders
Ability to create and improve team processes and articulate a technical vision and strategy
Experience driving quarterly or half-yearly planning processes
Ability to translate business needs into analytical frameworks
Eagerness to learn, flexibility to pivot when needed, savviness to navigate and thrive in a dynamic environment, and a growth mindset needed to build a successful team and company

#LI-Remote
Accommodations & Accessibility

At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.
job_title: Manager, Data Science - Logistics & Shopper Pay

job_description:
The Role:

At CB Insights, we're on a mission to connect the tech companies building the future with the world's leading investors and corporations. Our products ingest, manipulate, and share massive amounts of structured and unstructured data, tracking the movements of tech markets and companies around the world.


As Product Manager for our Data Pipelines mission, you're a key player in enabling our next phase of growth.

You're building high-performing, stable, scalable pipelines to feed existing and new products.

You're collaborating across technical teams to find the needs of our data stack.

And you're supercharging a formidable engineering team, with ownership and passion to help our clients and colleagues succeed.


Responsibilities:


Serve as product owner for our Data Pipelines mission: manage the roadmap, support agile ceremonies, and align goals with our overall strategy.
Work with engineering teams to discover new opportunities to improve the speed, stability, and scalability of our data infrastructure.
Evaluate and prioritize initiatives based on customer and commercial impact.
Drive new initiatives from ideation through development, testing, and implementation.
Define and monitor success criteria. Report and be held accountable to goals.
Translate the impact of technical results to non-technical stakeholders.
Serve as a key partner to other product teams, data science, and data operations, and enable them to achieve their goals.


Key Competencies:


At least 3 years of product management experience, ideally with complex data products
Deep understanding of data stack and infrastructure
Deep user empathy; uncovers real needs to build products people will actually use. Conducts continuous discovery.
Rigorous decision quality. Ruthlessly prioritizes opportunities for commercial value. Structured, deductive, and quantitative thinker even in ambiguity.
Experience defining and realizing developer and user engagement product strategies with clear metrics
Entrepreneurial. Has shipped products from ideation through delivery while in rapid growth mode. Strong bias to execution.
Effective and compelling communicator, proven with customers and executives
Sought after cross-functional partner
Experience or understanding of business intelligence tools like Looker, Tableau, etc…
Ability to read and write SQL queries
Experience with Atlassian products for ticket management, ticket tracking and documentation
Understanding of the ETL process

We’re a highly skilled team of product people who are building an awesome product and moving fast. We value people who take initiative, lead by example, and empower everyone at Klue to participate in delivering greatness.
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to work with our Automated Insights team to deliver high quality insights from a high volume of competitive intelligence.
 FAQ
Q: Klue who?
A: Klue is a Series A funded, Vancouver based, start-up with an amazing story. We’re poised for exceptional things, and are looking for highly motivated people to help us take this rocketship to the next level.
Q: What level of experience are we looking for?
A: This is a senior role. We’re looking for someone with depth of experience in both product management and data science. This unique blend, while hard to find, is what will catapult our data team to the next level. We will be building out our team to take on more emerging talent over the next year, but are starting by building up a roster of experienced talent which will enable us to set the rest of the team up for success.
Q: What problem(s) is our team tackling?
A: Our Automated Insights team is responsible for ingesting a massive amount of information about our client’s competitors every day, reducing this down to a manageable volume, and ultimately turning that intel into actionable insights that helps our users win more deals.
Q: Are you remote friendly?
A: YES! Our hub is in Vancouver, BC but we currently have team members across Canada and other countries. This particular role involves working with an engineering team that spans Amsterdam, Vancouver, and Brazil so you would need to be able to accommodate all three time zones from wherever you are.
Q: What are the skills I would ideally bring?
Applied experience product managing Machine Learning, NLP and / or data science initiatives you know the difference between precision and recall, understand the challenges of generating high quality training data, and are a wizard at driving roadmaps for data initiatives
Demonstrated experience driving business outcomes
A love of complex customer problems, deep empathy, and discovery skills for days
High EQ. You’re a connector, able to motivate people around a common goal, and facilitate thoughtful and constructive conversations between disparate groups
Strong critical thinking skills and a strategic mindset
Q: What would I be doing? -> This is a product management role, just like any other… only different! Working with data teams presents its own set of requirements, but functionally, you will be:
Identifying opportunities to leverage data to solve customer problems
Translating our company vision and strategy into a compelling vision and roadmap for your product
Conducting both quantitative and qualitative research to inform product decisions and prioritization
Prioritizing product scope that balances building strong foundations for future development, solving the most meaningful customer use cases, and getting these solutions into users' hands as quickly as possible
Defining what success looks like for your area, how it will be measured, and how it will impact company-wide goals
Working closely with the Design and Engineering teams to ship high-quality solutions that drive business outcomes and customer value
Collaborating with other product managers, engineers, and designers to imagine the future and create innovative solutions
Setting and maintaining a high bar of quality for your team's deliverables
Q: What motivates our current team right now?
Challenging, stimulating and meaningful work
The inspiration from skilled and proven leaders
Having their entrepreneurial fingerprints on what will be a future billion dollar company anchored in Canada
Culture, team, and work environment
A high degree of autonomy and accountability
Radical transparency and high quality communication
Q: What are the people of Klue like?
Builders
Intellectually curious
Transparent
Elevated
Supportive
Check us out!
Q: What about total compensation & benefits?
We gather compensation benchmarking data across BC, Canada, & EU's Tech Industry, and use that data to build a range for our current team and future talent based on skill, capabilities and potential.
This position can range from $110,000-$150,000 CDN based on level of experience, skill, and capabilities. There is ongoing conversation around compensation.
Vacation. Unlimited Vacation. We want the team to prioritize wellness and avoid burnout. We want to also give individuals autonomy to choose how and when they take vacation. We understand and respect that everyone’s needs for time off are different, just like our team. Vacation usually falls into 3 categories: recharging, life-event, keeping a work-life balance. just ensure the required work gets done and clear it with your team in advance. In practice we usually see our teams take anywhere from 2-4 weeks a year, and Klue always takes a reasonable approach so we can all continue to benefit from flexibility.
Work-life integration: Hybrid work model, flexible working schedules, and a global team.
 ️ ️ ️
If you’re hooked and feeling more curious about us, or the role - reach out. Let’s see if there is a great home here with you, now or in the future.

We’re an award winning company, recently named one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, included on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 list, and winning Tech Culture of the Year at the Technology Impact Awards. We think there is something pretty special going on here. Don’t miss your chance to have a seat on the rocketship before it takes off.
As #kluecrew grows, we’ve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. While we’ll admit we haven’t figured it all out and realize this is a long journey for us all. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.
All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We will continue, while safe to work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We are excited to work together again in a space, but just as excited to have great people across timezones help us strive for that high quality asynchronous team communication.

Clearco is the world's largest e-commerce investor. Our equity-free capital products intend to help businesses scale while maintaining 100% ownership and control. Clearco is growing and we've already been able to fund 5500+ businesses in 7 countries. Clearco has funded 25x more female founders than traditional Venture Capital and is removing barriers to access capital for underserved groups. The Clearco vision is simple: remove the obstacles between brilliant ideas and brilliant businesses.

We're looking for an Engineering Manager, Data Engineering, who will be responsible for managing a high-performing team of developers focused on the areas of (but not limited to) data products, data pipelines, machine learning and data science in order to build an engaging ecosystem that helps founders grow their business.

If you believe in empowering founders and are curious, collaborative, and organized, we want to talk to you. We want your help to build an economy for founders!

Application deadline: ongoing

Compensation + Benefits:

Competitive Salary + Stock Options + Flexible PTO + Mental Health Support (Inkblot & EAP) + Medical + Dental/Vision + Work From Home Stipend + Digital Nomad Program + Remote-first work environment + Toronto office available (but not necessary) + External Learning & Professional Development!

Responsibilities:

You will be deep into the details of both new product initiatives as well as iterations on our core platform within the data products division
As an Engineering Manager, you will be overseeing projects of varying scope and complexity with a deep focus on our data platform and data governance
You'll organize and manage a team of data engineers, while also being required to roll up your sleeves to write and review code as needed
Be responsible for identifying opportunities for growth within your pod, as ownership opportunities (e.g. spec, technical design, rollout, etc.) are shared amongst all Engineers
Continuously push the boundaries of our tech stack while coaching all levels of Data Engineers on best practices, both internal and industry standard
Work in an agile environment with biweekly sprint plans while owning product direction in the near term.

You will thrive if you:

Possess a strong sense of accountability for the success of one's team
Take ownership of personal growth and instill a habit of continuous self-development among team members
Prioritize organization in order to manage and scale a team of high-performing developers with multiple parallel workstreams
Have a passion for effective collaboration within and between cross-functional teams, with a history of building influence with Product, Finance, Data Science & ML Ops.
Display independent leadership, with a proven track record of the ability to identify and solve problems without much guidance
Are not afraid to stand up for both your team and the organization if you feel decisions are not in the best interests of either
Are interested in Cleaco's core domain - finance, technology, eCommerce and entrepreneurship - and want to help founders win (experience as an entrepreneur is a big plus)
Are excited to help identify new technologies and approaches to solving problems

Technical Requirements:

Have a Bachelor's degree in engineering or similar field, or equivalent experience
Have 3+ years managing Software Engineering teams, with a focus on building high-quality and scalable products
Have 5+ years of experience building data-intensive applications with technologies like (but not limited to): Python, SQL, Postgresql or Snowflake
Have a proven track record of scaling data-intensive applications on top of large, distributed systems in the Cloud (GCP Preferred, but AWS and Azure are relevant)

Clearco is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate our inclusive work environment and welcome members of all backgrounds and perspectives to apply. We create a space where every voice, perspective, and idea is heard and acknowledged. We embrace differences, and know that our diverse team is our strength and what drives our innovation.

Clearco is committed to developing a barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. If you require any accommodation, please let us know and we'll work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
About the Position:

The Data Visualization team is part of Global Data Strategy and Intelligence at Salesforce, taking a centralized approach to the Tableau platform, increasing adoption, and developing a governance model. We provide the framework for trusted, certified data sources, and dashboards based on a best-in-class security model. We enable technical and functional knowledge through best practices, guidelines, processes, and enablement .


We are looking for a Data Visualization Manager to establish Tableau data visualization methodologies, administer content and user operations, lead platform governance, deliver enablement & training, and lead a team of analysts to deliver the vision for data visualization.


A successful candidate will be someone who is passionate about data, visualization, content governance, data governance. A candidate must collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to provide global solution & enablement for Tableau adoption. The best fitting candidate has superior analytical skills, a strong knowledge of the business intelligence domain, and an automation & architectural mindset.


Responsibilities:
Solution: Develop, improve, and maintain standardized solutions that support the Tableau data visualization community to deliver solutions faster. A focus will be on implementing a common Row Level Security (RLS) model for Tableau.
Leadership : Leading two Data Visualization analysts to successfully onboard, setup governance, and provide enablement for Tableau teams.
Govern : Lead Tableau governance of creator licenses, certified content (data source and workbook) publishing, and content design. Deliver centralized operation to the Tableau development community, focusing on user management, content lifecycle management, publishing content, onboarding new teams, and auditing.
Automate Operations: Identify manual processes in governance and onboarding in order to design automated solution.
Enablement: Development of enablement material, starter tools or templates for process and drive adoption of best practices.
Product Management: Connecting with customers to understand user stories and personas. Run products/projects through their lifecycle. Understand the typical features and steps for presentation, enablement, knowledge article, process, etc. to coach the team on how to break down the work.
Risk Management : Create strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning; Oversee deliverables where necessary; Efficiently identify and resolve program issues; Design and maintain product and project documentation.
Community: Build strong working relationships with internal teams, including data engineering, operations, product management, and business stakeholders to support analytical product development, measuring impact, and adoption. Develop and communicate the program vision, roadmap, present enablement/knowledge base to stakeholders.
Grow: Regularly assess and improve performance of Team in such areas as job knowledge, technical skills, productivity, accountability, quality, initiative, innovation, drive, working relationships, communications, leadership, and alignment with the Salesforce core values.
Agile : Manage and develop using an Agile methodology to efficiently deliver solutions to sales and customer success groups.
Required Skills/Experience:
Education/Experience
BA/BS degree in computer science, business analytics, or equivalent technical or quantitative degree required, advanced degree preferred.
Minimum 2+ years experience of Customer Management role collaborating to derive requirements, roadmap, and releases through all stages.
Minimum 4+ years experience in analytics, engineer, product management, and/or operations role.
Minimum 1+ years of people management experience.
Technical Skills
Experience working with Tableau or similar data visualization tool; Tableau certifications are a plus.
Exposure to scripting language like PowerShell, automation experience, and writing database queries in SQL.
Experience with data management, data governance, and/or business process architecture.
Experience working with Row Level Security (RLS) and entitlements is a plus.
Experience with salesforce.com is a plus.
Product Owner/Management Skills
Work with Solution Architects to understand technology and underlying enablers
Understand customer needs to develop a backlog and ensure product completeness
Experience in writing technical knowledge base articles is a plus
Business Skills
Meet business goals by developing value and creating feasible and sustainable products and solutions
Work with customers, stakeholders, and suppliers to establish high-level solution intent, and the solution intent information models, and documentation requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate and communicate complex technical analysis to a broad variety of audiences including business executives
AGILE/SCRUM MASTER SKILLS
Working knowledge of Agile model to elaborate user stories, backlog grooming, and sprint planning.
Ready to lead and participate in Agile ceremonies.

Job Category
Sales
Job Details
The Team

The team reports into Sales Operations and with the primary goal to make Sales more efficient. More specifically, we ensure our customer data is accurate and organized in a useful way. In addition, as the centralized custodian of customer data, our work affects other critical areas across the company. The team works cross-functionally and always looks to automate processes to keep up with Salesforce’s growth.


The Role

Reporting to the Director of Data Strategy and Operations, this role entails both operational and strategic work. It requires a mix of skills including partner management, requirements gathering, meticulous documentation, program and project management, and Salesforce platform knowledge.


Primary responsibilities include:
Own the maintenance of our customer object in our own Salesforce instance ( 20% ): this object defines who is our customer and supports several cross-functional business processes. This responsibility makes the role high visibility- partners will know your name and come to you for help.
Drive strategic re-design and implementation of our customer definition ( 60% ): you will understand and detail how ~20 groups inside of Salesforce use our customer definition. You will then translate these requirements into a solution by working with an automation team.
Represent your team in a company-wide initiative to redesign our internal data architecture platform (20%): Salesforce has launched a multi-year, company-wide, strategic project to support our future growth. You will support

Required skills and experience
Analytical, problem-solving, and interpersonal skills to influence collaborators and to partner across functions and teams
8+ years of total work experience. Experience in management consulting, operations management, or similar position at a fast-growing technology company preferred.
5+ years of professional experience crafting and leading cross-functional and strategic projects, including business requirement generation and process analysis/ design
Understanding of Salesforce object model and basic Admin concepts
Ability to handle and prioritize competing priorities and projects

Description
Join our team

The TELUS Data & Trust Office provides world-class, innovative privacy solutions to TELUS. We partner with teams across the organization to advance our corporate priorities, support innovation and ultimately deliver on our promise to safeguard our customer’s privacy and to earn, and maintain their trust.

The impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together.

As a Data Privacy Manager, supported by the Senior Manager, Privacy & Innovation, in the Data & Trust Office you will materially influence the ongoing development of TELUS’ business innovation.

You will ensure that data-driven initiatives meet our rigorous privacy, security and ethical standards. You will collaborate with, advise and guide businesses in addressing privacy and data considerations in a manner that demonstrates TELUS’ commitment to putting customers and their privacy first.

Here’s how:
Support the deployment of a data program that meets or exceeds the expectations of our customers while simultaneously ensuring TELUS’ ability to respectfully leverage data to deliver value to our stakeholders.
Add value and support to business units to deploy or leverage technology responsibly and ethically by providing expert advice and counsel to execute on TELUS’ data handling frameworks.
Educate and advise the business team on existing or new data, privacy, and ethical uses, and provide strategies to address privacy and data governance considerations.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure adherence to the TELUS’ Trust Model.
Escalate privacy risks promptly, and with a sense of urgency, and ensure that mitigating controls are effective to protect the privacy of our customers and team members.
Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle:
Strong understanding of data analytics, data management principles and familiar with implementing new emerging technologies in a responsible manner that respects the privacy of our customers and team members.
Valued for your knowledge and expertise in applying privacy laws, guidance and best practices, and an understanding of data ethics, operational data governance and data protection.
Recognized for your ability to enable business areas to navigate complex initiatives by solving problems while protecting the privacy of customers and team members to drive remarkable outcomes for privacy, the business and the organization.
Valued for understanding risk management principles and supporting businesses in finding innovative solutions to complex business issues with a focus on win-win solutions.
Sought out for excellent communication skills, verbal & written, with the ability to present information at all levels of the organization.
Post-secondary education.
3 to 5 years of experience in applying privacy law and principles.
International Association of Privacy Professionals (IAPP) certification or willingness and ability to become certified within 6 months.

Great-to-haves:
Bilingual in French & English, verbal and/or written.
Legal background/experience.
Experience working in a large, matrixed organization.

We’re a highly skilled team of product people who are building an awesome product and moving fast. We value people who take initiative, lead by example, and empower everyone at Klue to participate in delivering greatness.
We are looking for a Senior Product Manager to work with our Automated Insights team to deliver high quality insights from a high volume of competitive intelligence.
 FAQ
Q: Klue who?
A: Klue is a Series A funded, Vancouver based, start-up with an amazing story. We’re poised for exceptional things, and are looking for highly motivated people to help us take this rocketship to the next level.
Q: What level of experience are we looking for?
A: This is a senior role. We’re looking for someone with depth of experience in both product management and data science. This unique blend, while hard to find, is what will catapult our data team to the next level. We will be building out our team to take on more emerging talent over the next year, but are starting by building up a roster of experienced talent which will enable us to set the rest of the team up for success.
Q: What problem(s) is our team tackling?
A: Our Automated Insights team is responsible for ingesting a massive amount of information about our client’s competitors every day, reducing this down to a manageable volume, and ultimately turning that intel into actionable insights that helps our users win more deals.
Q: Are you remote friendly?
A: YES! Our hub is in Vancouver, BC but we currently have team members across Canada and other countries. This particular role involves working with an engineering team that spans Amsterdam, Vancouver, and Brazil so you would need to be able to accommodate all three time zones from wherever you are.
Q: What are the skills I would ideally bring?
Applied experience product managing Machine Learning, NLP and / or data science initiatives you know the difference between precision and recall, understand the challenges of generating high quality training data, and are a wizard at driving roadmaps for data initiatives
Demonstrated experience driving business outcomes
A love of complex customer problems, deep empathy, and discovery skills for days
High EQ. You’re a connector, able to motivate people around a common goal, and facilitate thoughtful and constructive conversations between disparate groups
Strong critical thinking skills and a strategic mindset
Q: What would I be doing? -> This is a product management role, just like any other… only different! Working with data teams presents its own set of requirements, but functionally, you will be:
Identifying opportunities to leverage data to solve customer problems
Translating our company vision and strategy into a compelling vision and roadmap for your product
Conducting both quantitative and qualitative research to inform product decisions and prioritization
Prioritizing product scope that balances building strong foundations for future development, solving the most meaningful customer use cases, and getting these solutions into users' hands as quickly as possible
Defining what success looks like for your area, how it will be measured, and how it will impact company-wide goals
Working closely with the Design and Engineering teams to ship high-quality solutions that drive business outcomes and customer value
Collaborating with other product managers, engineers, and designers to imagine the future and create innovative solutions
Setting and maintaining a high bar of quality for your team's deliverables
Q: What motivates our current team right now?
Challenging, stimulating and meaningful work
The inspiration from skilled and proven leaders
Having their entrepreneurial fingerprints on what will be a future billion dollar company anchored in Canada
Culture, team, and work environment
A high degree of autonomy and accountability
Radical transparency and high quality communication
Q: What are the people of Klue like?
Builders
Intellectually curious
Transparent
Elevated
Supportive
Check us out!
Q: What about total compensation & benefits?
We gather compensation benchmarking data across BC, Canada, & EU's Tech Industry, and use that data to build a range for our current team and future talent based on skill, capabilities and potential.
This position can range from $110,000-$150,000 CDN based on level of experience, skill, and capabilities. There is ongoing conversation around compensation.
Vacation. Unlimited Vacation. We want the team to prioritize wellness and avoid burnout. We want to also give individuals autonomy to choose how and when they take vacation. We understand and respect that everyone’s needs for time off are different, just like our team. Vacation usually falls into 3 categories: recharging, life-event, keeping a work-life balance. just ensure the required work gets done and clear it with your team in advance. In practice we usually see our teams take anywhere from 2-4 weeks a year, and Klue always takes a reasonable approach so we can all continue to benefit from flexibility.
Work-life integration: Hybrid work model, flexible working schedules, and a global team.
 ️ ️ ️
If you’re hooked and feeling more curious about us, or the role - reach out. Let’s see if there is a great home here with you, now or in the future.

We’re an award winning company, recently named one of Canada’s Most Admired Corporate Cultures by Waterstone HC, included on Deloitte’s Technology Fast 50 list, and winning Tech Culture of the Year at the Technology Impact Awards. We think there is something pretty special going on here. Don’t miss your chance to have a seat on the rocketship before it takes off.
As #kluecrew grows, we’ve made a commitment to support and contribute to a diverse environment; on our teams and in our community. While we’ll admit we haven’t figured it all out and realize this is a long journey for us all. We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have dedicated that commitment to our current and future #kluecrew. During the interview process, please let us know if there is anything we need to make more accessible or accommodate to support you to be successful.
All interviews will be conducted via video calls. We will continue, while safe to work in a hybrid model of WFH (remote) and in-office. We are excited to work together again in a space, but just as excited to have great people across timezones help us strive for that high quality asynchronous team communication.

Clearco is the world's largest e-commerce investor. Our equity-free capital products intend to help businesses scale while maintaining 100% ownership and control. Clearco is growing and we've already been able to fund 5500+ businesses in 7 countries. Clearco has funded 25x more female founders than traditional Venture Capital and is removing barriers to access capital for underserved groups. The Clearco vision is simple: remove the obstacles between brilliant ideas and brilliant businesses.

We're looking for an Engineering Manager, Data Engineering, who will be responsible for managing a high-performing team of developers focused on the areas of (but not limited to) data products, data pipelines, machine learning and data science in order to build an engaging ecosystem that helps founders grow their business.

If you believe in empowering founders and are curious, collaborative, and organized, we want to talk to you. We want your help to build an economy for founders!

Application deadline: ongoing

Compensation + Benefits:

Competitive Salary + Stock Options + Flexible PTO + Mental Health Support (Inkblot & EAP) + Medical + Dental/Vision + Work From Home Stipend + Digital Nomad Program + Remote-first work environment + Toronto office available (but not necessary) + External Learning & Professional Development!

Responsibilities:

You will be deep into the details of both new product initiatives as well as iterations on our core platform within the data products division
As an Engineering Manager, you will be overseeing projects of varying scope and complexity with a deep focus on our data platform and data governance
You'll organize and manage a team of data engineers, while also being required to roll up your sleeves to write and review code as needed
Be responsible for identifying opportunities for growth within your pod, as ownership opportunities (e.g. spec, technical design, rollout, etc.) are shared amongst all Engineers
Continuously push the boundaries of our tech stack while coaching all levels of Data Engineers on best practices, both internal and industry standard
Work in an agile environment with biweekly sprint plans while owning product direction in the near term.

You will thrive if you:

Possess a strong sense of accountability for the success of one's team
Take ownership of personal growth and instill a habit of continuous self-development among team members
Prioritize organization in order to manage and scale a team of high-performing developers with multiple parallel workstreams
Have a passion for effective collaboration within and between cross-functional teams, with a history of building influence with Product, Finance, Data Science & ML Ops.
Display independent leadership, with a proven track record of the ability to identify and solve problems without much guidance
Are not afraid to stand up for both your team and the organization if you feel decisions are not in the best interests of either
Are interested in Cleaco's core domain - finance, technology, eCommerce and entrepreneurship - and want to help founders win (experience as an entrepreneur is a big plus)
Are excited to help identify new technologies and approaches to solving problems

Technical Requirements:

Have a Bachelor's degree in engineering or similar field, or equivalent experience
Have 3+ years managing Software Engineering teams, with a focus on building high-quality and scalable products
Have 5+ years of experience building data-intensive applications with technologies like (but not limited to): Python, SQL, Postgresql or Snowflake
Have a proven track record of scaling data-intensive applications on top of large, distributed systems in the Cloud (GCP Preferred, but AWS and Azure are relevant)

Job Category
Products and Technology
Job Details
About the Position:

The Data Visualization team is part of Global Data Strategy and Intelligence at Salesforce, taking a centralized approach to the Tableau platform, increasing adoption, and developing a governance model. We provide the framework for trusted, certified data sources, and dashboards based on a best-in-class security model. We enable technical and functional knowledge through best practices, guidelines, processes, and enablement .


We are looking for a Data Visualization Manager to establish Tableau data visualization methodologies, administer content and user operations, lead platform governance, deliver enablement & training, and lead a team of analysts to deliver the vision for data visualization.


A successful candidate will be someone who is passionate about data, visualization, content governance, data governance. A candidate must collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to provide global solution & enablement for Tableau adoption. The best fitting candidate has superior analytical skills, a strong knowledge of the business intelligence domain, and an automation & architectural mindset.


Responsibilities:
Solution: Develop, improve, and maintain standardized solutions that support the Tableau data visualization community to deliver solutions faster. A focus will be on implementing a common Row Level Security (RLS) model for Tableau.
Leadership : Leading two Data Visualization analysts to successfully onboard, setup governance, and provide enablement for Tableau teams.
Govern : Lead Tableau governance of creator licenses, certified content (data source and workbook) publishing, and content design. Deliver centralized operation to the Tableau development community, focusing on user management, content lifecycle management, publishing content, onboarding new teams, and auditing.
Automate Operations: Identify manual processes in governance and onboarding in order to design automated solution.
Enablement: Development of enablement material, starter tools or templates for process and drive adoption of best practices.
Product Management: Connecting with customers to understand user stories and personas. Run products/projects through their lifecycle. Understand the typical features and steps for presentation, enablement, knowledge article, process, etc. to coach the team on how to break down the work.
Risk Management : Create strategies for risk mitigation and contingency planning; Oversee deliverables where necessary; Efficiently identify and resolve program issues; Design and maintain product and project documentation.
Community: Build strong working relationships with internal teams, including data engineering, operations, product management, and business stakeholders to support analytical product development, measuring impact, and adoption. Develop and communicate the program vision, roadmap, present enablement/knowledge base to stakeholders.
Grow: Regularly assess and improve performance of Team in such areas as job knowledge, technical skills, productivity, accountability, quality, initiative, innovation, drive, working relationships, communications, leadership, and alignment with the Salesforce core values.
Agile : Manage and develop using an Agile methodology to efficiently deliver solutions to sales and customer success groups.
Required Skills/Experience:
Education/Experience
BA/BS degree in computer science, business analytics, or equivalent technical or quantitative degree required, advanced degree preferred.
Minimum 2+ years experience of Customer Management role collaborating to derive requirements, roadmap, and releases through all stages.
Minimum 4+ years experience in analytics, engineer, product management, and/or operations role.
Minimum 1+ years of people management experience.
Technical Skills
Experience working with Tableau or similar data visualization tool; Tableau certifications are a plus.
Exposure to scripting language like PowerShell, automation experience, and writing database queries in SQL.
Experience with data management, data governance, and/or business process architecture.
Experience working with Row Level Security (RLS) and entitlements is a plus.
Experience with salesforce.com is a plus.
Product Owner/Management Skills
Work with Solution Architects to understand technology and underlying enablers
Understand customer needs to develop a backlog and ensure product completeness
Experience in writing technical knowledge base articles is a plus
Business Skills
Meet business goals by developing value and creating feasible and sustainable products and solutions
Work with customers, stakeholders, and suppliers to establish high-level solution intent, and the solution intent information models, and documentation requirements
Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Demonstrated ability to collaborate and communicate complex technical analysis to a broad variety of audiences including business executives
AGILE/SCRUM MASTER SKILLS
Working knowledge of Agile model to elaborate user stories, backlog grooming, and sprint planning.
Ready to lead and participate in Agile ceremonies.

Manager of Data Science

Job description.

Huge is looking for a Manager of Data Science to join our team! As a Manager of Data Science, you will be responsible for scaling our data science capability, helping team members to adopt & leverage machine learning solutions. On a regular basis, you will collaborate across disciplinary user experience teams at Huge and serve as a guide to answer questions, offer insights and bring structure to data so that it serves to inform decisions that will impact clients' business.
What you'll be doing.

Most importantly, as a Manager of Data Science, you will continuously be asked to set a positive example and champion the data science capability. In order to succeed in this role, you will need to be hands-on, comfortable starting from zero and quickly ramping up when faced with specific business challenges, feel comfortable presenting data science capabilities that can easily be understood and leveraged across disciplinary teams at Huge and by clients. Collaboration with internal and external teams is fundamental to ensure the delivery of specific client solutions. You will also be hands-on building solutions in Python, establishing data models for machine learning and looking for opportunities to continue to push the envelope.

What we'd like to see.

A minimum of 5 years of experience in a relevant industry that uses data science capabilities.
An undergraduate degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math.
Proficient in Python and associated data science packages.
R Programming
Experience having led client engagements and across distributed team's end-to-end, from development to implementation of data science solutions.
Ability to take disparate sources of data (structured & unstructured) and develop methods that produce models and algorithms that handle tasks, parameters or optimizations to generate an evaluation output.
Proven ability to deliver solutions such as regression analysis for prediction, classification for sentiment analysis, clustering and retrieval of content, matrix factorization & dimensionality reduction for recommendations, and utilization of deep learning.
Deep knowledge of the AWS or GCP CLI.

About Huge.

Huge is a global experience agency made up of creatives, designers, technologists, strategists, and data scientists. We help companies elevate the human experience by creating unified brand experiences that people love. We work with clients such as Google, McDonald's, FCA, Brooks Running, P&G, and others, who are as committed to shaping culture and defining the future as we are. Headquartered in Brooklyn, we currently have more than 1,200 employees working across 13 offices in North America, Latin America, Europe, and Asia.

Huge is committed to creating an inclusive employee experience for all. Regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, disability, or if you're parenting the next generation of innovators, we firmly believe that our work is at its best when everyone feels free to be their most authentic self.

Janssen Research & Development, L.L.C., a member of Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for a remote Global Data Manager within the United States, Europe or China.
Janssen Research & Development, LLC discovers and develops innovative medical solutions to address important unmet medical needs in oncology, immunology, neuroscience, infectious diseases and vaccines, and cardiovascular, metabolic, and retinal diseases. Please visit http://www.JanssenRnD.com for more information.
Thriving on a diverse company culture, celebrating the uniqueness of our employees, and committed to inclusion. Proud to be an equal opportunity employer. And our culture is interconnected by the shared values of Our Credo. It’s a culture that celebrates diversity and diverse perspectives. It helps employees achieve an effective mix between work and home life and supports their efforts to have a positive impact on their communities.
Principal Responsibilities:
Works with CRO, the trial customer(s) and other internal and external partners to establish, align and confirm data management expectations to the business for assigned trial(s).
With the trial customer, CRO and other functional partners: – Gathers content and integration requirements for eCRF and other data collection tools. – Participates in establishing conventions and quality expectations for clinical data. – Participates in establishing expectations for dataset content and structure. – Works with others to set timelines and follows-up regularly to monitor delivery of all data management milestones.
Performs trial level oversight controls as described in the oversight plan, QC process, and work instructions, with DML direction.
Reviews clinical data management documents (including submission package) for appropriate quality, scientific content, organization, clarity, accuracy, format and consistency. Works with DML to facilitate compliance with regulatory guidelines and the documentation matrix.
Works with DML to facilitate real-time inspection readiness of all DM deliverables for the trial. Participates in regulatory agency inspections and J&J internal audits as necessary.
Works with DML to plan and track content, format, quality, and timing of data management deliverables, including, but not limited to, CRF, data review plan, QC plan, oversight plan, database release plan, final datasets, submission plan and archival. Works with DML to ensure deliverables are on time.
Supports the assigned clinical working group(s) to ensure that DM and TA trial needs and deliverables are met.
Identifies and communicates lessons learned with support from DML and frequently asked questions at trial level.
Participates in process, system, and tool improvement initiatives within DM.
Presents at investigator and monitor meetings.
May undertake the principal responsibilities of a CDM, as appropriate

Qualifications
Education and Experience Requirements:
BS/BA degree or professional experience equivalent is required.
A minimum of 2 years of work experience is required.
Preferred Experience:
Data management experience
Experience in clinical drug development within the pharmaceutical industry or related industry

At Bell, we do more than build world-class networks, develop innovative services and create original multiplatform media content – we advance how Canadians connect with each other and the world.
If you’re ready to bring game-changing ideas to life and join a community that values, professional growth and employee wellness, we want you on the Bell team.
Bell’s forward-thinking Customer Operations team is creating the ultimate service experience for our residential, wireless and small business consumers. We lead strategic development and execution of day-to-day operations, develop tools and processes to drive service enhancements, manage customer loyalty and retention, and leverage big data and artificial intelligence to create intellectual property.
About Us:
The Data Science Team within Customer Operations is at the forefront of innovation. Our goal is to leverage the power of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning to provide the best service for our customers while accelerating our product roadmaps. The work we do is critical in ensuring that Bell remains the best telecommunications provider in Canada. As the product team focused on customer loyalty, we manage ML products and features that better serve customers and keep them with Bell.
Position Description:
Working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, activities will include product management of one or more of our AI/ML product lines, which will include product lifecycle management, use case development, business adoption, competitor benchmarking and analysis, and business planning activities. The successful candidate will drive the product vision while ensuring a flawless customer experience. They will be a key interface between business facing and technical delivery teams, while maintaining concise updates for the executive team. This role requires leadership, maturity, strong analytical capabilities, solid business acumen and a deep-seated impulse to sweat the details of our products and projects – all to ensure amazing experiences for our customers.
Responsibilities:
Collaborating with cross-functional teams & industry leading partners to build and launch new innovative products
Full lifecycle support of products including ideation, coordination, business adoption, performance monitoring and iteration
Pitching innovative solutions and recommendations in concise and compelling presentations to senior executives
Leading use case discovery with business partners and co-ordinating into a concise roadmap to be executed on with business and technical teams
Creating business cases for pursuing product initiatives; performing deep analysis to uncover obstacles and opportunities
Combining your creativity with sound data analysis to design the optimal experience
Influencing partner teams on the right direction to take and working closely with partners to ensure proper prioritization of activities as they relate back to business objectives
Maintaining visibility to new and emerging technologies and trends that may inform roadmaps
Contributing to a growing Agile team and being part of a program that emphasizes team building, collaboration and continuous improvement
Qualifications:
Self-governing, action-oriented and demonstrated ability to deliver results
Strong problem solving abilities and able to develop an approach to decision making
Advanced capability to access, process, and analyze data
Strong ability to tell a story with data, simplifying complex concepts into easily consumable messaging
Excellent communication; clear and concise verbal and written communication style, able to effectively convey, influence and present at all levels
Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities simultaneously with minimal direction
Ability to learn new technologies; comfortable with technical discussions
Flexible and resilient; able to adapt in a fast paced environment where priorities shift frequently
Team oriented and possessing excellent leadership
Product management experience considered an asset

job_description:
We are seeking a dynamic Engagement Manager, Analytics, and Insights to assist our mission-critical, Real World Data & Analytics team. The Engagement Manager, Analytics, and Insights will work closely with Operations teams to ensure engagement success and satisfaction from our largest and most complex clients.
The Analytics and Insights team provides custom and semi-custom data and analytical solutions to the world's largest biopharmaceutical and medical technology companies. We engage our clients in a consultative approach, working in partnership to translate challenges into business questions, which we answer using data-driven methodologies. We seek self-directed, critical, and inquisitive professionals capable of proposing, executing, and owning such engagements, and who are excited by applying advanced methods to big data to solve consequential and complex problems.
As an Engagement Manager, you will independently manage and lead Real World Data-based data analytics projects through execution and delivery with minimal support from their manager, leading client interactions, project success, and client satisfaction for a portfolio of clients. Also, execute and support larger, complex engagements in collaboration with senior team members; and create and communicate client-ready deliverables that clearly answer business questions, and ensure high-quality outputs and results that make sense in business and therapy area context. As well as facilitate workshops with clients to understand needs and how to leverage Real World Data to meet those needs. Other aspects include supporting the growth of the Analytics business by driving or contributing to the sale of data, services, and advanced analytics, collaborating with teams across the organization to leverage Subject Matter Experts and Thought Leadership to promote services. Finally, you will serve as a mentor to junior team members, identifying their areas of growth and providing constructive feedback.
This position can be worked remotely anywhere in North America. You will work with teams in North America (primarily EST) and internationally, and must have the ability to work adjusted business hours as needed.
What you will need…
B achelor’s degree in a science, engineering, or business-related field
At least 5 years of experience in project management, data analysis, and/or consulting roles, including experience in client-facing roles of increasing responsibility
Familiarity in healthcare, and specifically life sciences
Experience working with Real World Data
Would be great if you also have…
Excellent presentation, verbal, and written communications skills
Structured thinker able to quickly analyze and distill key issues
Passion for solving complex data challenges and ability to communicate them in a concise fashion

In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

job_description:
ACML’s Management team is growing! Are you looking for a challenging and rewarding career with Canada’s leading provider of customized operations and solutions? If you are a devoted and career-minded professional looking to contribute to a hard-working, dedicated team, we want to hear from you!
WHO ARE WE?
With over 50 years of experience throughout North America, Angus Consulting Management Limited (“ACML”) is one of Canada’s most trusted facility operations management companies. We have extensive knowledge managing critical environments including data centers, healthcare facilities, commercial facilities, central utility plants and Public Private Partnership projects.
WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
ACML is actively seeking a Manager - Facilities Management Services located in Toronto, ON whose main responsibilities will include, but are not limited to, the following:
Oversees day-to-day operations/maintenance services in a complex, mission-critical environment; takes necessary steps to ensure data centre Uptime, reliability and safety of staff.
Develops/maintains client relations; participates in client meetings re: facility enhancements, capital expenditures, asset plans, expanded FM services, etc.; anticipates short/long-term client needs and develops options.
Develops/applies systems, processes and procedures to mission-critical maintenance and operations activities to meet client/quality management standards; ensures compliance by staff/external service providers.
Develops/prepares monthly client reports and comprehensive business plans.
Monitors/analyzes/reports on facility results relative to deliverables.
Develops/implements maintenance and operations goals consistent with service level agreement.
People Management: manages recruitment, mentoring, coaching and professional development of staff; supervises staff; provides work direction/assignment of duties; develops site goals/objectives; facilitates employee goal setting; identifies training/educational requirements; conducts performance reviews; investigates staff performance issues/initiates appropriate action.
Applies planning/scheduling techniques and risk-mitigation strategies to ensure effective delivery of preventive, predictive and responsive maintenance; ensures appropriate use of CMMS.
Manages tendering process; negotiates costs/fees; oversees external service providers; monitors contractual agreements for specialized maintenance, purchased services, etc. as required.
Liaises with stakeholders re: maintenance projects; coordinates activities of staff, consultants and contractors to ensure requirements met and facility impact minimized.
Participates in development/implementation of business continuity plans in cooperation with client.
Maintains facility consistent with Uptime standards/industry best practices re: energy conservation, carbon footprint reduction and other relevant environmental standards.
Provides client support re: infrastructure, technical standards, systems commissioning, contract management and safety/integrity management; as acting member of client organization participates as a subject matter expert within area of expertise.
Makes decisions utilizing policies/guidelines with some flexibility to depart from standards if minimal risk to client/company; makes complex decisions based on interpretation of policies and previous management precedent.
Gains competency/technical knowledge through research, training and industry contacts.
In collaboration with next level of management, defines skill/competency gap and creates/implements personal/career development plans; seeks opportunities for personal growth/development.
Performs/supports other initiatives/duties as assigned.
WHAT WILL YOU BRING?
7-10 years progressive facilities maintenance and operations management experience in complex, mission-critical environment; LEED certification an asset.
Post-secondary diploma/degree/certification in a relevant field of study (e.g., Certified Engineering Technician/Technologist (CET), Building Environmental Systems (BES), Operating Engineer, etc.); or a combination of education, training and experience.
Knowledge/understanding of Occupational Health & Safety Act; building/fire/other codes and applicable standards/regulations pertaining to facilities maintenance and operations.
Proven ability to apply proactive/innovative thinking to complex issues.
Strong communication skills (verbal and written).
Good proficiency in Microsoft Office (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).
Proven ability to analyze, organize, prioritize and delegate.
Proven ability to plan, organize, prioritize and implement.
WHY SHOULD YOU APPLY?
We work hard to find the right people and provide opportunities for them to flourish.
We offer a collaborative environment with experienced leaders and room to grow. We are a company that values integrity, continuous improvement and operations excellence. A full list of the benefits and perks that we offer is available on our website https://acml.ca/careers/.
If you’re as excited about the future of our company as we are, we would love to hear from you! We welcome and encourage all qualified candidates to submit a detailed resume.
We are an accessible workplace. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.
Accessibility
ACML is committed to providing an accessible work environment. Upon request during the recruitment process, ACML will accommodate applicants with disabilities.
For more information on our Accessibility Program please refer to our Accessibility Policy
