Assist on-call Data Centre Facilities support for timely resolution of all incidents/issues.Design and lead the implementation of Network structured cabling solutions for new hardware deployments and data centre upgrades.First point of contact for the critical IT infrastructure support for the TMX offices (LAN rooms, UPS, Cooling, servers/Network equipment etc.). Responsible for the planning and implementation of all EOL equipment replacements and upgrades.Assistance to the DC manager for both the short and long term planning for the evolution of the TMX Data Centres.Lead the team in the operation and maintenance of the Data Centre monitoring system. Implementation of all upgrades to the monitoring system and to work with the other ISE support teams to deploy software updates and ensure all security protocols are met. Lead the team in the upgrading of all environmental monitoring for the critical IT infrastructure at the TMX office locations.Responsible for all monthly reporting (Client power and environment, TMX Power Usage etc.).Take the lead in liaison with property management groups to coordinate work pertaining to building systems that impact TMX data centres or office space (building power and chilled water system shutdowns and other maintenance work). Develop and continually build upon effective working relationships with the various property management groups in the locations where the team supports TMX critical IT infrastructure.Lead all aspects of all major electrical and mechanical preventative maintenance. Coordinate all major work to ensure all long-term planning is done to avoid date conflicts with other support groups.Lead contact for assigning cabinet space for all new equipment. Assess space, power and cooling requirements to install new equipment.Lead the team to develop and implement enhancements for the TMX data centres that would improve power and cooling efficiencies. Track upgrades and identify all cost savings.Lead the team as the main representative for all external audit requirements (Provide tours to auditors as required, compile and provide evidence as requested etc.).Part of the Data Centre facilities on-call rotation (every 5 weeks).Position to be based at 100 Adelaide Toronto with requirements to frequently work out of the Markham location.Quarterly travel required to Calgary, Vancouver and Montreal offices.Must Have Skills: Minimum 5+ years of experience in a data centre environmentStrong infrastructure experienceExcellent networking and cabling experienceExcellent communications skills as this role communicates internally with team members and externally with vendors.Strong overall technical aptitude, keeping up in trends in data centre technology.Sustainability experience - bringing new insights to improve all aspects of the data centre.Flexible to travel weekly between Markham and downtown TorontoFlexible to travel quarterly to Vancouver, Montreal and CalgaryWillingness to work on-call rotation every 5 weeks as well as weekends.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $75,000.00-$80,000.00 per yearAdditional pay:Bonus payOvertime payBenefits:Company pensionDental careEmployee stock purchase planExtended health careLife insuranceRRSP matchVision careSchedule:8 hour shift

Customer Data Strategy is critical to many of the transformational initiatives ongoing and upcoming soon at Moneris. You will be a go-to resource for prospect and customer data and lifecycle management. Supporting all lines of businesses in Canada, this role is a key component in spearheading the enablement, activation and to operationalize the multi-channel customer lifecycle journeys.

Key Accountabilities
Provide strategic leadership, guidance, and highly specialized knowledge to internal partners in the area of customer data management and enhancement
Own and manage the Customer Data Platform (CDP) and Real-time Interaction Management (RTIM) platform to build a centralized data ingestion, processing and activation platform for journeys and campaigns
Learn and understand the internal data models and structure of various aspects of customer, behavioral as well as engagement data
Build the strategy to combine and merge data from various sources for both always-on journeys and individual campaigns
Build, manage, sync and enhance the unified profile of the customer in CDP/RTIM as well as other data management & processing platforms
Advise on end-to-end data ingestion, processing and activation strategy on multi-channel automated customer journeys including reporting and re-using the data for predicting other journeys that the customer can be a part of in the future
Provide strategic data and technological inputs in refining the marketing architecture consisting of Moneris internal applications as well as external third-party vendor solutions
Identify the need for additional contextual data when needed in specific journey scenarios and advise on the ways to ingest and merge with the existing customer profile
In partnership with marketing stakeholders, create data models for the next best offer, cross-sell and up-sell by utilizing the AI capabilities of Salesforce
Implement key compliance and regulatory practices for individual engagement channels. For example, expertise in managing customer experiences using CASL compliance data in the E-mail and SMS channels, understanding of cookie preferences for onsite personalization etc.
Stay on top of the changing landscape of cookie-less regulations and accordingly advise our partners on data & segment activation through the CDP via regular connects
Build strategic and growth-oriented relationships with our Marketing, Digital and Technology partners – who are key stakeholders in customer data ingestion and activation
Qualifications

Professional Experience
An undergraduate degree or diploma in Computer Science, Engineering or a related project
A post-graduate degree or diploma in marketing, data analytics, business management or business intelligence
5+ years working as a data strategist or data management role in marketing technology or related field
Experience in fintech and/or finserv in Canada is preferred although not necessary for the right candidate
Experience in digital communications and omni-channel customer personalization is a plus
Certifications in Salesforce Marketing Cloud, Salesforce CRM, and CDP is a huge plus
Technical Knowledge

Must have/be
Over 5 years of proven work experience in building delightful customer experiences by innovative use of technologies and 1st party, 2nd party and 3rd party data
Strong project management skills and experience in working with multiple stakeholders and partners towards achieving a common goal
Knowledge of how to leverage CDP, CRM data, and/or data lakes to add value to a customer’s journey at each interaction point with Moneris – building roadmaps and defining tactical use cases for execution
Strong foundation of centralized data management function to fuel multiple omni-channel journeys across all banking & investment lines of business
Stronghold on data modelling concepts to build propensity, attrition and lookalike models
Knowledge of how marketing technologies work with internal IT and Data Management systems
Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements – collaborate with data engineers and solution architects to ensure business objectives are prioritized and realized
Deep understanding of customer data use cases and business value realization
Strong analytical ability to derive insights from customer behavioral data, transactional and campaign data and to predict the future channel-specific behavior of the customer
Knowledge of data analytics solutions like SQL, Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, Datorama etc
Soft Skills
Self-motivated
Highly organized and project management skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Ability to work with a cross-functional team of marketers, developers, analysts, and business stakeholders
Strong relationship-management skills to establish productive working relationships within the team and with marketing and product partners
Highly personable, motivated and collaborative in nature – a true team player!
Demonstrably a critical thinker – can find insights/opportunities in improving status quo through observation, data and offering creative solutions to problems
Go getter and proactive attitude towards work and constantly thinking about process improvement
To reduce the risk of COVID-19 transmission and to facilitate a safe return to the office for all employees, clients and vendors, Moneris has developed a vaccination standard that requires all employees and contract resources to be fully vaccinated in order to attend company premises, company events or conduct business travel on behalf of Moneris (and provide proof). Bona fide exemptions may be requested in accordance with legally protected grounds.
Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

Lead operations processes for the loyalty business to ensure effective and efficient delivery of technical issues resolution, systems enhancement, vendor oversight, loyalty data management and end to end technical project delivery. Create technical requirements documentation for vendor teams

Day to day ownership of loyalty operations infrastructure to offer the Loyalty program at the Bank. This includes the ownership of infrastructure roadmap and identification of initiatives, intake of initiatives from BNS teams and third parties
Maintain strong working relationships with key partners and stakeholders to ensure smooth transition and execution of projects. Tracks impact and outcomes and provides regular reporting to key stakeholders
Champions a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge.
Lead the onboarding of new Partners to the Loyalty program from operational end and facilitate technological integration working with platform provider and internal technology teams.
Lead customer facing regulatory notice implementation and legislation compliance working closely with Product teams.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational risk, regulatory compliance risk, AML/ATF risk and conduct risk, including but not limited to responsibilities under the Operational Risk Management Framework, Regulatory Compliance Risk Management Framework, AML/ATF Global Handbook and the Guidelines for Business Conduct.
Education and Other Requirements
Technical background such as Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering degreeBA, BSE, PMP qualification is an assetBachelor's Degree required, Graduate degree a plus7+ years progressive experience in loyalty, operations, technical project management, business analyst, product management, data managementExperience in project management of new initiativesAble to work in cross functional teams on initiatives and projects of varying scope and duration simultaneouslyAbility to navigate a multifaceted global organization to secure resources, information and consensus through determination, personal creativity, drive and convictionExcellent written and verbal interpersonal skills; ability to convey information clearly and simply at all levels

job_title: Engagement Manager, Real World Data Analytics (Remote)

job_description:
Angi® is transforming the home services industry, creating an environment for homeowners, service professions and employees to feel right at "home." For most home maintenance needs, our platform makes it easier than ever to find a qualified service professional for most indoor and outdoor jobs, home renovations (or anything in between!). We are on a mission to become the home for everything home by helping small businesses thrive and providing solutions to financing and booking home jobs with just a few clicks.

Over the last 25 years we have opened our doors to a network of over 200K service professionals and helped over 150 million homeowners love where they live. We believe home is the most important place on earth and are embarking on a journey to redefine how people care for their homes. Angi is an amazing place to build your dream career, join us—we cannot wait to welcome you home!

The Team and Role:

Angi Services connect customers to vetted, independent local professionals at the tap of a button, while providing upfront pricing, customer choice in scheduling (no more pesky 4 hour windows), cashless payments and a service guarantee. The Services Analytics team provides insights and helps optimize strategy by working closely with leadership across our marketing, customer care, product development, and finance organizations. Due to the multifaceted nature of our business, our team provides an excellent environment to stretch your business acumen, technical know-how and quantitative skills while providing insight to the company. The manager of the Services Analytics team is responsible for not only communicating updates to the Services business, but also identifying and promoting new opportunities and data-driven strategies to enhance the organization's efforts.

What you'll do:

Present and communicate results and recommendations to Services leadership teams
Manage and develop a team of analysts supporting cross-functional projects to grow the Services business
Support and develop your teams' technical skills – particularly in SQL, Tableau, Looker, and R
Partner cross-functionally to model strategies for new ways to increase bookings, marketing effectiveness, and increase the LTV of our Services business
Learn the complex Angi ecosystem and be the subject matter expert on Services data
Synthesize large data sets into digestible information
Pursue new approaches to solving problems with creativity and innovation

Who you are:

4+ years relevant experience in an analytical capacity.
Analytics managing experience required, including email performance analytics
Proven track record of driving impactful insights for consumer behavior or segmentation a plus
Bachelor's Degree or higher
Advanced SQL knowledge, expertise in Excel, and Looker (or Tableau) experience
Excellence in quantitative and qualitative data analysis and reporting on results.
A track record of taking ownership over projects and helping them succeed.
A bias toward action: preferring to work in a fast-paced, agile environment.
Master's degree and/or home services industry experience a plus!

Compensation & Benefits:

The salary band for this position ranges from $120,000 - $155,000, commensurate with experience and performance. Compensation may vary based on factors such as cost of living
This position will be eligible for a competitive year end performance bonus and equity package
Full medical, dental, vision package to fit your needs
Flexible vacation policy; work hard and take time when you need it
Pet discount plans & retirement plan with company match (401K)
The rare opportunity to work with sharp, motivated teammates solving some of the most unique challenges and changing the world

Our Story:

About You:
You are a high achiever looking to thrive in a fast-paced environment. You take pride in your own work but are comfortable collaborating with a team of highly motivated individuals. You can communicate clearly and concisely with teammates and clients, and you enjoy strong company culture and camaraderie. You can navigate multiple corporate functions, including global lines of service and corporate centers of excellence. You possess strong interpersonal skills and are willing to take on diverse tasks to achieve the team’s common goal. You value personal and professional growth and are ready to take the next step in advancing your career.

If this sounds like you, well, then you will love the culture at Avison Young!

About Us:
Avison Young is a global commercial real estate brokerage and advisory firm, offering transaction, management, financial and consulting services. We’ve designed our corporate structure to best serve our clients by enhancing collaboration across our organization.

Real estate can have an enormous positive impact on people’s lives – and we’re in the business of making spaces and places work better for people. Our purpose is to create real economic, social and environmental value as a global real estate advisor, powered by people.

We care about each other and we have each other’s backs. This makes AY a great place to be a client, and a great place to work. We support the whole person and their complete wellness – economic, mental and physical – because what’s best for our business comes from our people bringing their whole selves to work.

Of course we love it here, but outsiders think we’re pretty great too: Avison Young was awarded the prestigious America’s Best Midsize Employers for 2022, presented by Forbes and Statista, Inc. We’re proud to be regularly recognized for our team, services and culture and our team members enjoy comprehensive compensation and benefit programs. Through our customized work options, we give our people the flexibility to create a work environment that puts their overall well-being first. After all, we are powered by people.
Overview:

The Data Architecture Team is responsible for the delivery & reliable operation of the data and analytics platforms in AY, primarily the Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW)
The Data Operations Lead is responsible for the management of daily data operations delivering Data “as a Service” to the entire company and works in close collaboration with Product teams, Analytics specialists, IT Leaders and Business Leaders to ensure proper support to all centralized data activities within the company.
This is a key role with a growing responsibility as the EDW becomes a Data Hub in AY’s data driven organization and as it powers the AVANT range of client facing technology products.
The demand for Enterprise data in Avison Young via the cloud is growing and an opportunity has arisen to take a lead role in scaling up and the smooth running of this service globally.
Responsibilities:
Management of a team of analysts & engineers responsible for the successful & reliable day to day operation of the EDW & associated analytics platforms.
Validation and Management of Data Ingestion requests including technical prerequisite implementation and deployment of final ingestion pipelines
Validation and management of data-set access requests
Auditing of data access and provision of specific reporting for data owners' consultation
Validation and Management of datasets migrations requests from dev to test and from test to production
Housekeeping and usage statistics for EDW data sets
Development and maintenance of specific data “freshness”, “popularity” and “quality” indicators: initially basic data profiling “at the point of ingestion” but extending then quality controls also to dataset specific content (data in context) in collaboration with data owners
Maintenance of Data Catalog content and collection of metadata
Managing the preparation phase of projects for new data ingestion
Maintenance of backlog reporting and project status
Securing all confidential configuration and documentation
Qualifications:
Knowledge of Data Lakes and Enterprise Data Warehouse principles and strong understanding of cloud-based platforms such as Snowflake.
Knowledge of ETL or data transformation tools within Modern Data stack such as Apache Airflow, DBT, Python, Fivetran
Experience of Microsoft DEVOPS for Agile
People management experience
Proven track record coaching and enabling teams to successful achieve results.
Ability to Influence key executives and stakeholders across the organization, not limited to Industry, engineering, product, partner and services teams.
Experience in leading and supporting technical colleagues through either direct or indirect management
Our Equal Opportunity Commitment:

Avison Young practices as an equal opportunity employer in all services locations around the world. We are committed to building and maintaining a workforce diverse in experience, skills and knowledge with uniformity in service excellence, commitment and integrity.
The firm maintains a strict policy to ensure employment opportunities are equal and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, creed, age, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, citizenship, disability, marital and civil partnership/union status, protected veteran or military service status, or any other elements protected by law.
For those requiring assistance with disabilities, information relating to the need for accommodation and accommodation measures will be addressed confidentially.
Avison Young is committed to employing the best talent with the most fair and equitable recruitment practices. Apply with us TODAY!

What is the opportunity?
In this role, you will report to the Director, Data Analysis, and Decision Management. Becoming the subject matter expert for Cards, Payments & Banking Data, you will play a key role in driving superior business results, by providing key strategic insights and recommendations on new and existing business opportunities, through in-depth knowledge of the RBC data warehouse environment. Champion the use of deep analytic rigour as the basis for the decision management methodology. Leverage all available sources of data to create value within the business.
What will you do?
Become the data subject matter expert (SME) for Cards, Payments and Banking, Retail, Small business and Commercial credit card holders
Support the roll-out of key business projects and ensure data and analytics capabilities are developed on time and on budget.
Help in data preparation for complex analytical projects
Responsible for the rapid identification, prioritization and deployment of reporting and analytics to define new potential business opportunities and to make well informed decisions (short and long term) through the use of internal, industry and competitor data.
Provide and support reporting requests, on Cards, Payments & Banking clients to appropriate groups (both internal and external), as required.
Transform the way Cards, Payments and Banking uses data by developing advanced reporting and analytics to serve external and internal clients.
Develop new methodologies and business analytical tools to address complex business issues. Identify measure and monitor the impact and success of new and existing initiatives, including but not limited to pricing, acquisition and portfolio management.
Manage BI Tool ThoughtSpot roadmap and increase usage adoption and engagement.
Lead or co-ordinate projects with other partner groups to meet business requirements on behalf of Cards, Payments & Banking that are completed using other Centre’s of Excellence.
Support senior management by analyzing new business opportunities and providing recommendations and support in developing business cases.
What do you need to succeed?
Must have: (Max. 6 bullets)
Expert knowledge of working with data in relational databases and/or Hadoop
Demonstrated research and analytical capabilities.
Proven technical skills and experience at using analytical software tools and applications such as SAS, Tableau, SQL, Python, R
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Strategic mindset and vision of the future for the Cards, Payment & Banking business.
Proven ability to manage multiple projects.
People Management experience.
Product management experience.
Nice to have:
Certification in SAS, Tableau and/or relational databases
Understanding of credit & banking products and credit granting.
Knowledge of RBC databases and RBC data warehouse environment.
Knowledge of credit cards, payments and/or Banking
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
Opportunities to do challenging work
RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.
RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.

At Rogers, we connect Canadians to a world of possibilities and the memorable moments that matter most in their lives. Every day we wake up with one purpose in mind. To bring loved ones together from across the globe. To connect people to each other and the world around them. To help an entrepreneur realize their dream. A sports fan celebrate a special moment.
Because we believe connections unite us, possibilities fuel us, and moments define us.
As we grow our team, the well-being of our team members remains our top priority. To ensure the health and safety of our team members, including those in the recruitment process, our team members are working from home, and are equipped to do so safely and efficiently.
Combining Wireline and Wireless views of our customer is key to providing superior insights and analytics to the organization. This position will be instrumental building an enterprise solution for the single source of truth for converged customers. The tools, systems, and processes will be developed to drive and monitor some of the key indicators used to drive business insights and decisions.
What you'll do:
Work with business stakeholders of all levels (analysts to VPs) and represent them in the technical implementation and delivery of one source of the truth for converged customers
Develop logic and transformation rules that converts the raw data in to KPIs that will be used to manage the business
Partnering with IT and a scrum team, create and maintain an optimal data pipeline in a cloud environment that serves the business needs for insights and operations
Build dashboards and views that utilize the converged data to provide actionable insights into customer acquisition, operational efficiency, and other key business performance metrics
Working with IT and the scrum team to design/setup the cloud infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using ‘big data’ technologies and plan its cloud migration from on-prem.
Be a subject matter expert on all facets of the converged data sets
Understand the Wireless and Wireline billing systems and how the customer journey is reflected within them
What you'll bring:
Degree in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Statistics, Information Systems, or another quantitative field.
Strong analytical skills working with structured & unstructured datasets including a successful history of extracting value from large, disconnected datasets.
Advanced knowledge and 5+ years expertise with SQL, SAS along with at least one of these object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python, PySpark and Scala etc.
5+ years of experience and solid understanding of BI & Data analytics in data pipeline process management, defining reporting/analytics standards, developing reporting analytics tools and data access tools, constructing interactive dashboards, developing data visualization tools, testing, and validating its data.
Experience working with ‘big data’ data pipelines, architectures, and data sets with big data tools: Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, etc.
Experience supporting and working with cross-functional teams in a dynamic agile environment by managing a scrum team with strong project management and organizational skills.
Experience performing root cause analysis on data and processes to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for improvement.
Must be an individual who is focused on delivering results with integrity.
Knowledge of cloud architectures and data warehouse technologies and concepts at least from one of these:
Google Cloud Platform (GCP), Microsoft Azure, or Amazon Web Services (AWS), BigQuery, Redshift, Azure SQL, Snowflake, Databricks or any cloud data transformation platform equivalent.

Purpose:
As a Data Strategist in Global Data and Analytics Team, you will help integrate analytics capabilities into the Bank’s digital products and by developing and implementing data strategies that will help improve customer experience.

What will you do in this role?

Build, manage and grow relationships with product, design, and engineering teams by enabling data driven decision making.Understand performance trends, identify opportunities for growth, and provide actionable insights.Work cross functionally to define data strategy and analytics roadmap for digital initiatives, collaborating with Scotia Digital, other analytics teams, and the data office.Proactively identify, and drive analytics solutions to improve customer experience in collaboration with Data ScientistsDeep dive into data to identify opportunities, influence product development, and/or overall functional and business strategies.Create and deliver analytics solutions and data products to optimize revenue growth and improve customer experiences using predictive modeling and machine learning.Communicate and coordinate with teams to implement data-driven strategies while measuring progressConduct analysis and present performance results to business line stakeholders within Scotia Digital, analytics and across the bank.Develop and produce analyses, reports, and insights for partners that help drive tactical, operation, and/or strategic decision making in support of Digital Banking goalsCollaborate with data scientists, data engineers, and operational teams to implement quality controls and automate data feeds and report generation.Champion change in the bank by promoting data literacy, data analytics, and data informed decision making.

You have a strong business acumen, and you excel at developing and communicating analytics insightsYou are not afraid to challenge the status quoYou have a deep curiosity about data, processes, and customer behaviour. Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

You use sound judgment in the creation of analysis, validation, interpretation, and presentation of findings.You have experience cleaning, transforming and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g. unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files, image)Being proficient in one or more statistical programming languages (eg. Python, R) and having practical experience with data science tools and libraries (eg. scikit-learn, Pandas, NumPy, Git etc.) is desirable.Knowledgeable about common supervised and unsupervised Machine Learning approaches (eg. feature engineering, ensemble methods, classification, regression, clustering, NLP, time series forecasting, etc.)You have experience with Big Data ecosystem tools (e.g., Hive, Pig, Sqoop, Spark, Google Cloud Platform) and are comfortable with creating large queriesYou have experience using visualization tools like Power BI, Tableau or QlikViewYou have experience leveraging digital analytics tools such as Adobe Analytics, Google Analytics or SplunkStrong project management and communication skills (both oral and written).Ability to manage process and planning, facilitate teamwork, and coordinate execution of multiple deliverables.

Company Description
Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.
At Shopify, we build products that help entrepreneurs around the world start and grow their business. We’re the world’s fastest growing commerce platform with millions of merchants in more than 175 different countries, with solutions from point-of-sale and online commerce to financial, shipping logistics and marketing.

Job Description
Shopify is now permanently remote and working towards a future that is digital by default. Learn more about what this can mean for you.
At Shopify, we build products that help entrepreneurs around the world start and grow their business. We’re the world’s fastest growing commerce platform with millions of merchants in more than 175 different countries, with solutions from point-of-sale and online commerce to financial, shipping logistics and marketing.
Responsibilities:
Build and help grow a diverse team of analysts that are highly aligned, curious, passionate about Shopify’s talent and the business, and impactful
Apply data visualization principles, SQL, and the right BI tool (Mode, Google Data Studio) to improve our reporting layer, leading by example
Build a roadmap of support to provide key stakeholder teams with dashboards that provide the data and insights they need to empower and unlock their roles
Lead discussions and decisions with stakeholder teams around the right metrics/KPIs to monitor and surface
Communicate, educate and influence stakeholder teams on how they can best use data to improve their programs
Manage and prioritize ad-hoc requests, identify the right opportunities to inform our roadmap, and improve the process around receiving and executing on requests
Define and advance best practices for how to best collaborate with external analyst teams and how to partner with People Analytics

Qualifications
Strong SQL, able to lead by example in implementation (PostgreSQL, BigQuery)
Experience with BI tools (Mode, Google Data Studio)
Leading/building teams analysts or equivalent technical/analytical roles
Stakeholder management (prioritization, setting expectations, problem scoping and solving)
Data storytelling; communicates the constraints/considerations of the data, makes clear recommendations
Communication skills (clear, succinct, approachable)
A passion/curiosity for the people/talent data domain
Analytical and systems mindset
Pragmatic problem solver
Nice-to-have’s:
Product analytics
Python
Git
ETL/data systems
Partnering with data scientists/engineers
Additional Information
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
If you’re interested in helping us shape the future of commerce at Shopify, click the “Apply Now” button to submit your application. Please submit a resume and cover letter with your application. Make sure to tell us how you think you can make an impact at Shopify, and what drew you to the role.
Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere
Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.
At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

job_description:
The Data Analytics Senior Manager accomplishes results through the management of professional team(s) and department(s). Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area. Contributes to standards around which others will operate. Requires in-depth understanding of how areas collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinate and contribute to the objectives of the entire function. Requires basic commercial awareness. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Has responsibility for volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of end results of an area. May have responsibility for planning, budgeting and policy formulation within area of expertise. Involved in short-term planning resource planning. Full management responsibility of a team, which may include management of people, budget and planning, to include duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary and terminations and may include budget approval.

Responsibilities:
Integrates subject matter and industry expertise within a defined area.
Contributes to data analytics standards around which others will operate.
Applies in-depth understanding of how data analytics collectively integrate within the sub-function as well as coordinates and contributes to the objectives of the entire function.
Employs developed communication and diplomacy skills in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular, colleagues in other areas and occasionally external entities.
Resolves occasionally complex and highly variable issues.
Produces detailed analysis of issues where the best course of action is not evident from the information available, but actions must be recommended/taken.
Responsible for volume, quality, timeliness and delivery of data science projects along with short-term planning resource planning.
Oversees management of people, budget and planning, to include duties such as performance evaluation, compensation, hiring, disciplinary action and terminations and may include budget approval.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency, as well as effectively supervise the activity of others and create accountability with those who fail to maintain these standards.
Qualifications:
6-10 years experience using tools for statistical modeling of large data sets
Education:
Bachelor’s/University degree or equivalent experience, potentially Masters degree
This job description provides a high-level review of the types of work performed. Other job-related duties may be assigned as required.

Requisition ID: 143765

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose
This people manager provides a focus on optimizing the overall efficiency and accuracy of global data keyed by Global HR Services Operations (GHRSO). The incumbent identifies and implements process improvements that enhance employee experience and generate efficiencies and profitability. Use experiences and direct feedback to improve data quality of keyed transactions and global processes to eliminate downstream and pay impacts. They will be responsible for the implementation and sustainment of medium complexity strategies and plans and are responsible for analyzing the success of implemented strategies as well as current organizational processes. They contribute to the overall success of GHRSO by ensuring specific individual and global team goals, plans and initiatives are executed and delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with respective countries governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
Accountabilities
Works with the Directors and senior leaders to conduct process assessments and identify improvement opportunities and recommend solutions to business challenges.
Monitor existing and implement new data quality checks and processes; define critical data points, controls, data targets, thresholds and escalation procedures
Oversee process and procedure errors and remediation; impact on use, root-cause analysis of data defects and implement remediation plans with respective leaders to eliminate
Suggest and implement business rules directly into system to avoid errors from conception
Analyzes workflows, processes, procedures and data to ensure accuracy and minimal risk and impacts
Performs root cause and gap analysis techniques, design future state work flow processes and procedures and analyzes system flows including identification of business impacts due to changes
Formulate and document business test strategy and create test cases for system fixes and enhancements
Designs and executes implementation plans, including training and communication
Optimizes existing processes and activities within GHRSO by identifying trends, gaps and opportunities through data analysis, making recommendations and ensuring action plans are developed and actioned
Ensures controls, compliance and oversight mechanisms are in place to minimize risks
Assesses and reports on the quality of execution of the GHRSO business, based on the established quality assurance program to drive performance and ensure that deliverables are defect free, complete, and fulfill all stated requirements.
Understands how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment
Education/Experience Required:
Post-secondary degree in HR, Business, Operations, Science, Engineering
3 - 5 years of leading operational excellence and/or continuous improvement initiatives
Strong knowledge of the Bank’s Global policies, processes, procedures, best practices and respective local regulation
Good knowledge and understanding of data quality and controls, understanding downstream impacts (pay and non-pay impacting) and data elements
Experience in Data Quality tools (Accenture), process automation (Anaconda 3/Jupyter) and Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Visio
Knowledge and understanding in building quality assurance checks and data quality monitoring
Exceptional written and verbal skills to convey messages identifying and solving cross-team downstream impacts
Excellent collaboration skills and demonstrated passion for executing excellence
Experience in process improvement and change management
Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills
Comfortable using data to drive decisions
Superior interpersonal, listening and probing skills to ask key questions
Builds relationships and brings together individuals with different perspectives and opinions to drive toward a common goal.
Enjoys investigating complex problems and making sense of information. Confident in communicating complex information in a meaningful and impactful way
Proven ability to exercise good judgment, initiative, and maintain confidentiality while handling large data sets
Ability to motivate and lead change to a global team (in person and virtual)
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

55 Bloor Street West
Job Family Group:
Data Analytics & Reporting
Manager, NACCC Data Analytics will be responsible to apply data analytics to identify opportunities on call reduction, sales generation, greater customer and employee experience. Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
Strong technical skills with extensive experience in data curation - extracting data from multiple sources, manipulating and validation using database tools . Must have SAS, SQL skills and experience
Understand and experience in text analytics/text mining projects -prefer to have Python
Strong business acumen - Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.
Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
Strong communication and presentation skills - build relationships with stakeholders
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently on a range of complex tasks, which may include unique situations.
Qualifications:
5+ years experience in business intelligence/ ETL, analytics
5+ years experience in Finance industry
Strong experience within data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, SAS, R/Python
Technical proficiency gained through education and/or business experience.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth.
Collaboration & team skills - In-depth.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth.
Influence skills - In-depth.
Data driven decision making - In-depth.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

100 King Street West
Groupe de famille d'emploi :
Stratégies et gest chang
Leads a portfolio of projects from project initiation to implementation to achieve desired business results. Drives to mitigate execution risk to achieve the desired business outcomes. Understands the business/group and facilitates communication with other program/project managers and stakeholders. Directs, manages, and coordinates team members including other project managers, business and technology resources, user groups, internal and external consultants and contractors, as well as vendors.
Regularly connects work to BMO's purpose, sets inspirational goals, defines clear expected outcomes, and ensures clear accountability for follow through.
Builds interdependent teams that collaborate across functional and operating groups to create the highest value for all stakeholders.
Attracts, retains, and enables the career development of top talent.
Improves team performance, recognizes and rewards performance, coaches employees, supports their development, and manages poor performance.
Provides strategic input into business decisions as a trusted advisor.
May network with industry contacts to gain competitive insights and best practices.
Influences and negotiates to achieve business objectives.
Assists in the development of strategic plans.
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
Helps determine business priorities and best sequence for execution of business/group strategy.
Conducts independent analysis and assessment to resolve strategic issues.
Acts as the prime subject matter expert for internal/external stakeholders.
Manages/validates financial forecasts and conducts ongoing reconciliation.
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Socializes change management plans with stakeholders and consistently measures project effectiveness and adoption.
Directs complex initiatives typically involving multiple business units.
Negotiates complex contracts with external vendors (in consultation with Strategic Sourcing) to ensure receipt of specific resources and materials
Manages overall portfolio budget.
Provides guidance to the project sponsor on the implementation and sustainment of projects, resulting in successful project outcomes.
Executes project requirements in governance frameworks focused on risk appetite, regulatory and compliance standards.
Monitors and controls project deliverables. Makes recommendations and adjustments to the overall project plan to achieve deliverables,
Provides project sponsor with advice on the viability of the business case (costs, benefits, KPIs, etc.) throughout the project.
Understands interdependencies and demonstrates critical thinking that proactively identifies project risks and establishes effective risk mitigation from the outset.
Leads and/or represents the project in team meetings, governance forums and inter-department forums.
Adheres to Bank risk, regulatory and compliance controls.
Operates at a group/enterprise-wide level and serves as a specialist resource to senior leaders and stakeholders.
Qualifications:
Typically 7+ years of relevant experience and/or certification in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Project management experience – 6 to 8 years.
Valid PMP designation from the Project Management Institute (PMI) is an asset.
Financial Services experience is an asset
Data and Analytics experience is an asset
Entrepreneurial skills – In-depth.
Judgement skills – In-depth.
Learning agility – In-depth.
Stakeholder management – Expert.
Able to navigates challenging situations effectively.
Able to apply project management methodologies or approaches.
Able to manage project and business risks, including project interdependencies.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth / Expert.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth / Expert.
Influence skills - In-depth / Expert.
Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration - In-depth / Expert.
Able to manage ambiguity.
Ici, pour vous.
À BMO, nous sommes animés par une raison d’être commune : Avoir le cran de faire une différence dans la vie, comme en affaires. Cette raison d’être nous invite à entraîner des changements positifs et durables pour nos clients, nos collectivités et nos gens. En travaillant ensemble, en innovant et en repoussant les limites, nous transformons des vies et des entreprises et favorisons la croissance économique partout dans le monde.
En tant que membre de l'équipe de BMO, vous êtes valorisé, respecté et entendu, et vous avez plus de moyens pour progresser et obtenir des résultats. Nous nous efforçons de vous aider à obtenir des résultats dès le premier jour, pour vous-même et nos clients. Nous vous offrirons les outils et les ressources dont vous avez besoin pour franchir de nouvelles étapes, car vous aidez nos clients à franchir les leurs. Au moyen de formation et de coaching approfondis ainsi que de soutien de la direction et d'occasions de réseautage, nous vous aiderons à acquérir une expérience enrichissante et à élargir votre groupe de compétences.

Use experiences and direct feedback to improve data quality of keyed transactions and global processes to eliminate downstream and pay impacts. They will be responsible for the implementation and sustainment of medium complexity strategies and plans and are responsible for analyzing the success of implemented strategies as well as current organizational processes. They contribute to the overall success of GHRSO by ensuring specific individual and global team goals, plans and initiatives are executed and delivered in support of the team’s business strategies and objectives. Ensures all activities conducted are in compliance with respective countries governing regulations, internal policies and procedures.
Accountabilities
Works with the Directors and senior leaders to conduct process assessments and identify improvement opportunities and recommend solutions to business challenges.
Monitor existing and implement new data quality checks and processes; define critical data points, controls, data targets, thresholds and escalation procedures
Oversee process and procedure errors and remediation; impact on use, root-cause analysis of data defects and implement remediation plans with respective leaders to eliminate
Suggest and implement business rules directly into system to avoid errors from conception
Analyzes workflows, processes, procedures and data to ensure accuracy and minimal risk and impacts
Performs root cause and gap analysis techniques, design future state work flow processes and procedures and analyzes system flows including identification of business impacts due to changes
Formulate and document business test strategy and create test cases for system fixes and enhancements
Designs and executes implementation plans, including training and communication
Optimizes existing processes and activities within GHRSO by identifying trends, gaps and opportunities through data analysis, making recommendations and ensuring action plans are developed and actioned
Ensures controls, compliance and oversight mechanisms are in place to minimize risks
Assesses and reports on the quality of execution of the GHRSO business, based on the established quality assurance program to drive performance and ensure that deliverables are defect free, complete, and fulfill all stated requirements.
Understands how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions.
Actively pursues effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk.
Champions a high performance environment and contributes to an inclusive work environment
Education/Experience Required:
Post-secondary degree in HR, Business, Operations, Science, Engineering
3 - 5 years of leading operational excellence and/or continuous improvement initiatives
Strong knowledge of the Bank’s Global policies, processes, procedures, best practices and respective local regulation
Good knowledge and understanding of data quality and controls, understanding downstream impacts (pay and non-pay impacting) and data elements
Experience in Data Quality tools (Accenture), process automation (Anaconda 3/Jupyter) and Microsoft Excel, Powerpoint and Visio
Knowledge and understanding in building quality assurance checks and data quality monitoring
Exceptional written and verbal skills to convey messages identifying and solving cross-team downstream impacts
Excellent collaboration skills and demonstrated passion for executing excellence
Experience in process improvement and change management
Strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills
Comfortable using data to drive decisions
Superior interpersonal, listening and probing skills to ask key questions
Builds relationships and brings together individuals with different perspectives and opinions to drive toward a common goal.
Enjoys investigating complex problems and making sense of information. Confident in communicating complex information in a meaningful and impactful way
Proven ability to exercise good judgment, initiative, and maintain confidentiality while handling large data sets
Ability to motivate and lead change to a global team (in person and virtual)
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

Sharethrough is disrupting the legacy digital advertising supply chain as the first ad exchange to auto-enhance every standard impression by rendering a higher-performing ad that dynamically fits into any placement on any site. Our technology and approach enables advertisers to see substantial campaign performance improvements and cost savings using the same standard video and display creative as well as the buying workflow they use with standard exchanges. The Sharethrough Exchange (STX) powers over 225 billion monthly impressions and is integrated with more than 30 of the world's largest demand side platforms, enabling buyers to efficiently achieve their marketing objectives at scale.
Sharethrough is looking for an engineering manager to steward our talented Data team through the large-scale, complex data challenges the advertising technology space has to offer. The Data team’s services form the foundation of data used to operate our products and business: architecting and modelling accessibility to petabyte-scale datasets in a clean, flexible, and fast manner. We’re powered by a robust, stable Snowflake- and Airflow-based ETL pipeline that you’ll be driving! Thorough approaches to team leadership that focus on identifying problems and root causes will fit right in.
About the Role
We value managers who care personally and build strong relationships with the folks on their teams. To that end, you’ll be conducting weekly 1-on-1s where you will:
Ensure the right people are in the right roles by forming meaningful relationships and understanding them individually.
Challenge them directly to move outside their comfort zones and become stronger versions of themselves
Provide mentorship to other members of the data team.
Set clear expectations by defining goals and outcomes.
Provide candid, timely feedback and hold people accountable.
Collaborate closely with Product and other Engineering teams, helping to ensure the Data team is focused on translating the right problems into solutions at the right time; ideating, prioritizing and stewarding data related projects to completion.
Construct and steward a vision for how we’ll extend our platform with solid Data governance, building data management standards and procedures. We’ve scaled substantially and you’re going to get us even further! (For example: Sharethrough Engineering Philosophy).
Own the business relationship with our largest vendor - Snowflake - projecting and managing costs as well as increasing efficiency; making our Snowflake credits go further than ever.
Iterate and improve our engineering processes and technical culture. Our methods of product development were created by product and engineering working closely together, and you’ll be a part of that.
About You
You’ve successfully contributed to and led a data team through scaling, performance, and optimization challenges
Significant experience with ETL, data warehousing, data technologies (Snowflake and Airflow ideally) and analytics concepts.
Experience managing and projecting budget for data- and data-adjacent (e.g. infrastructure) costs and optimizations.
You’ve led teams utilizing modern software processes and practices like Agile (any form), Continuous Improvement, Continuous Delivery, Test-Driven Development, Infrastructure-as-Code, etc.
It would be great if you had some familiarity with ad tech. If not, that’s cool - we can skill you up quickly. The ecosystem is large, complex and constantly evolving with sea changes on the order of months, which is what makes this both a challenging and exciting industry to be a part of!
Getting Started
You’ll have a ton of support to help you hit the ground running when you join us.
You’ll start by completing Sharethrough University, a three-day program where you’ll learn everything Sharethrough (industry context, product suite, detailed financials, etc.). Next comes an Engineering Onboarding program; two-weeks of meeting with multiple engineers from every team to understand our architecture, technology and product development process. Finally, you’ll be a part of a company with a strong management culture that values and invests in management-as-a-skill.
What's In It For You?
Competitive compensation packages
Generous group health insurance plan
Access to the virtual healthcare platform Dialogue
Access to the company's stock option plan
16 days of vacation per year, which increases with seniority at the company
3 paid Caring days
1 paid volunteer day
Offices closed during the holidays
Wellness allocation of $840 per year (for gym memberships, sportswear, etc.)
In-house training programs on our company and industry
Encouragement and funding of continuing education and training
Very active social committee and free online sports classes
Access to a tool that measures your engagement and job satisfaction anonymously
Pairing with a buddy for your first 6 months
Advantageous referral program
Inclusive, inspiring, and dynamic work environment
Casual dress code
Work from home and flexible hours
And more!

Company Description
Make an impact at a global and dynamic investment organization
When you invest your career in CPP Investments, you join one of the most respected and fastest growing institutional investors in the world. With current assets under management valued in excess of $500 billion, CPP Investments is a professional investment management organization that globally invests the funds of the Canada Pension Plan (CPP) to help ensure long-term sustainability. The CPP Fund is projected to reach $3 trillion by 2050. CPP Investments invests in all major asset classes, including public equity, private equity, real estate, infrastructure and fixed-income instruments, and is headquartered in Toronto with offices in Hong Kong, London, Luxembourg, Mumbai, New York City, San Francisco, São Paulo and Sydney.
CPP Investments attracts and selects high-calibre individuals from top-tier institutions around the globe. Join our team and look forward to:
Diverse and inspiring colleagues and approachable leaders
Stimulating work in a fast-paced, intellectually challenging environment
Accelerated exposure and responsibility
Global career development opportunities
Being motivated every day by CPP Investments’ important social purpose and unshakable principles
A deeply rooted culture of Integrity, Partnership and High Performance
If you share a passion for performance, value a collegial and collaborative culture, and approach everything with the highest integrity, here’s an opportunity for you to invest your career at CPP Investments.

Job Description
Active Equities is looking for a Manager to enable data-driven research activities through analytics solutions. You must be a very self-motivated individual and be able to proactively operate in a cross-functional team.
Through close partnership with investment professionals, you will see firsthand how your contribution is delivering long-term value to the CPP Fund for the benefit of 20 million CPP contributors and beneficiaries.
The opportunity:
Work in a fast-paced environment, collocated with data engineers, data scientists and portfolio managers.
Enable cutting edge data and analytical tools that can be leveraged by investment professionals.
Partner with the investment team to analyze business requirements, design and implement solutions that support the integration of alternative data into a discretionary investment process.
Define and shape CPP Investments future technology and research process.

Qualifications

University degree in Engineering or Computer Science preferred.
Deep technical expertise leveraging cloud technology best practices to deliver scalable big data solutions efficiently.
Experience using cloud providers and associated services – AWS/GCP/etc.
Exposure to analytical tools (Databricks/Snowflake/etc.)
Practical knowledge of software engineering concepts and best practices, including testing frameworks and libraries, automation
Proficiency with one or more programming languages: Python or Scala.
Familiar with one or more analytic tools such as Tableau, Looker.
Experience building flexible solutions that can adapt quickly to changing requirements.
Ability to work in an entrepreneurial environment and be a self-starter.
Additional Information

Data and Analytics Manager
About the Chartered Professional Accountants of Ontario
At CPA Ontario, we are a regulator, educator, provider, advocate and thought leader. We ensure that our more than 94,000 members and 22,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We provide certifications, continued training and learning for the profession. We serve our members and students with a commitment to quality and efficient delivery. We champion the interests of our profession with the business community. And we develop cutting-edge ideas and thinking that evolve the profession. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills, global perspectives and leadership.
CPA Ontario’s strategic priorities include attracting a pipeline of new entrants to the profession, building member connectivity, maintaining high standards and creating a strong brand. As an organization, we are guided by a set of core values and behaviors that are reflected in the work we do, how we treat each other, and how we represent ourselves.
 We protect the public. We advance our profession. We guide our CPAs. We are CPA Ontario. For more information, visit us at cpaontario.ca
Position Description:
CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Data and Analytics Manager reporting to the Senior Director, Business Intelligence and Data Governance. The Data and Analytics Manager will be responsible for understanding the enterprise strategic direction, business processes, functions, and activities. This position will collaborate with senior leaders to acquire and understand enterprise and business unit strategic requirements with a lens of the entire solution lifecycle, including dataset development and transformation, data presentation and visualization, and for build solutions to increase data-driven strategic decision making.
The Data and Analytics Manager also contributes to the growing of data literacy capabilities across the organization, including the building of reporting self-service models, and contributing to the Data Governance program at CPAO.
A portion of this role will involve the understanding, consumption, processing/transformation, and analysis of financial data. This candidate will support the Finance and other business units for budgeting, planning, reporting and reconciliation efforts, leveraging Data and Analytics tools and technologies.
Major Responsibilities:
Business Unit Relationship Management – 20%
Understand CPAO enterprise strategic direction, and business processes, functions, and activities.
Acquire and understand enterprise and business unit strategic requirements for building of solutions to increase data-driven strategic decision making.
Data Engineering and Architecture – 35%
Contribute to the growth of the Analytical Data platform. Build ETLs to create datasets, including target versus actuals tracking, projections, predictions and point-in-time contexts for reporting and analytic consumption using Azure tools including Data Factory, Data Lake and Data Bricks.
Reporting and Analytics – 35%
Build robust analytical solutions including projections, predictive analytics, point-in-time metrics, performance metrics including target versus actuals tracking.
Build Advanced analytics solutions including the use of Data Science including AI/Machine Learning, and statistical techniques.
Build Financial data-based solutions to support Finance and other business unit divisions.
Change Management, Data Literacy and Training – 10%
Build solutions to enable the growth of data literacy in the organization including the building of data models to enable business units to build their own reports, and training on the business models to assist in business unit’s learnings.
Contribute to the Data Governance program at CPAO including updating of artifacts such as the Business Glossary of Terms and the Data Dictionary.
Qualification Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree in Data Analytics, Information Systems, Information Technology or Equivalent
7+ years of experience in report and dashboard development is required
7+ years of experience with front-end BI tools is required (Experience with Power BI is highly preferred, experience with Cognos, Tableau, or similar is an asset)
7+ years of experience in performance metrics building including target to actuals reporting and tracking
7+ years of working in SQL query dataset and stored procedure development
3+ year of working with Azure data platform including Data Factory, Data Lake and Databricks
Experience working with finance system models and data, including transactional data such as invoicing and receipting, and revenue and expenses is an asset.
Experience in budget and planning support is an asset.
Experience working with analytical/statistical tools such as R is an asset
Strong analytical skills, experience with statistical analysis, regression modeling and forecasting, time series analysis, data mining, and financial analysis is an asset
Excellent interpersonal, communication (verbal and written) and relationship building skills with proven ability to communicate with both non-technical business teams and technical teams is required.
We thank all candidates for their interest, however, only those being considered will be contacted.
CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with “Accommodation Required” in the subject line to provide your contact information. Recruitment Services staff will contact you within 48 hours.

Our Client, is an award winning Canadian software SaaS, multi-tenant e-commerce leader is seeking for the Product Manager (Data & Analytics) into their team of some 100.

The ideal candidate would have PhD or Masters in analytics, mathematics or statistics and expected to have an experience in analysing and drawing insights from a large data sets.

One of the responsibilities for the Product Manager position will be to design and build new product and services, that leverage data created by Company’s platform. The selected candidate will be collaborating closely with Data Scientists, Product Manager and the dev teams .

Working in downtown of Toronto, you will be having flexible hours, bonus RRSP and other benefits.

Please send to us your CV by email or via form, should you are interested in this position.

This position is to provide oversight and management of reporting, analytics and performance monitoring of Moneris’ products and partnerships. The Manager, Data Analytics & Strategy will manage, coach and lead a team of data analysts within the Product and Partnerships team. The role will always strive to refine, automate and create synthesized reporting that can be visualized to support effective decision making.
Key accountabilities include:
Participates in leadership meetings to present data and statistics reporting on the health and performance of our products and partnerships
Drive innovation with the Product and Partnership team with a focus on data visualization and driving results through data
Work collaboratively with Product and Relationship Managers to determine areas of opportunity and makes recommendations to ensure plan being met
Manage reforecasting processes based on results YTD and creates projections for future performance through the use of models
Maintain relationships and support senior leadership for all product and partner performance data
Representing Product and Partnership Data Analytics & Strategy team on projects with the EMPO if directly related to role
Represents the Product and Partnership team for data stewardship, governance, etc.
Provides leadership, influence and inspires team members using effective management techniques
MINIMUM POSITION REQUIREMENTS
University degree is required (Equivalent work experience may be considered a substitution)
Minimum of 7-10 years of experience
3 years of people management experience
Ability to present data via graphics or other illustrations to facilitate a deeper understanding of data-driven insights for the business teams
Advanced experience with Excel, Access, Tableau, SQL and SharePoint with an understanding of R, Python, Azure Databricks or other programing languages
Fluent in English (reading, writing, and verbal)
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) with proven ability to communicate technical and highly complex information
Strong business insight and analytical skills including ability to conduct quantitative analysis
Self-motivated and driven, ability to quickly prioritize/reprioritize.
Ability to lead a team
Demonstrated passion for people management

Bona fide exemptions may be requested in accordance with legally protected grounds.
