The Data Manager will be responsible for leading data management (DM) activities for clinical trials including database set-up, study conduct and close-out. The Data Manager will work collaboratively with a cross functional team to maintain project timelines and to deliver high quality DM deliverables. Key responsibilities may include, but are not limited to:Lead Data Management activities and ensure study deliverables meet timelines and quality standards.Review of Clinical research documents (e.g., Protocols, Case Report Forms).Create and review electronic Case Report Form (eCRF) specifications.Develop critical DM documents such as the Data Management Plan, Data Validation Plan, eCRF Completion Guidelines, Data Entry Guidelines and Data Review Plan.Develop edit rules/checks, query logic and query messages.Develop User Acceptance Testing Plan and perform testing on data entry screens and edit checks.Create and provide training to the clinical team and sites.Perform ongoing data review/reconciliation activities and provide metrics and patient trackers to monitor data clean up.Perform database lock/unlock and freeze/unfreeze activities as appropriate for statistical review, interim analysis, and final database lock.Coordinate the archiving of study databases and related documents.Create Data Transfer Specifications and perform external vendor reconciliation.Perform SAE reconciliation.Work to maintain/improve client satisfaction by ensuring high quality service, communication and management of clinical data.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in clinical/pharmacy/biological/mathematical sciences or related field or nursing degree.At least 3 years data management and/or related work experience in a medical device or pharmaceutical industry/company is preferred.Working knowledge of Clinical research and Clinical trial process and related regulatory requirements and terminology.Strong knowledge and experience in several Electronic Data Capture systems such as Medidata Rave, Oracle InForm, OpenClinica and Medrio.Perform duties in compliance with SOPs, Good Clinical Practices and ICH guidelines.Ability to prioritize and to adapt quickly in fast-paced and changing industry conditions.Ability to lead a study or data management team independently.Proactively drive quality and efficiency to meet timelines and milestones to deliver high quality data management deliverables.Excellent verbal and written communication skills.Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.).Oncology experience is preferred.

As a Manager, Data Science and a member of the Data Science team, you play an important role in making sure our team grows their skillset and that we advance ML projects and deliver value to customers through developing AI/ML based solutions to their business problems.

As a people manager, you will manage your direct reports and coach them as they advance their career.
As a technical leader in projects, you will lead teams to develop AI/ML solutions utilizing Data Mining and Machine Learning techniques. You will work with multiple tools and gain experience in many AI/ML and data processing fields. You will ensure that ML developers follow our rigorous ML development processes and will work on improving them. You will also be accountable for the quality of assurance processes in the projects you lead. You will be given resources and mentorship to help with your growth and career advancement.
What you'll do as a Data Science People Manager:
Lead the development and performance of your direct reports
Plan career growth for your reports
Provide feedback based on observations
Have 1:1s regularly with your direct reports
Have quarterly coaching conversations with direct reports
Onboard new team members
Foresee and resolve problems that arise between team members
Promote company’s culture to your team
Ensure good communication with other teams and with all stakeholders on the projects that your team works on
Hands-on and/or hands-off technical leadership on projects
May play a role of senior ML Developer on a project
Mentor less senior employees, as required
Improvement of internal processes and standards
Actively improve existing processes and propose new processes as gaps are identified
What you'll be accountable for:
Development and performance of your team
Hands-on and/or hands-off technical leadership on projects
Strategic goals and initiatives assigned to your team
Improvement of internal processes and standards
Deliver projects according to budget, time and quality constraints
Quality assurance of work performed in projects
Support business development activities
Adherence to company development standards and processes and promotion of them within your teams and reports
What you bring:
Senior level work experience in applied AI/ML (including 2+ years experience leading applied AI/ML projects)
Experience in managing and mentoring people
Broad knowledge of AI/DS with in-depth domain in specific subareas
Degree in Comp Sci, Comp Eng, Statistics, or related field Expertise with Software Development practices and tools
Expertise with Python (Pandas, SciKit, and similar) Expertise with Machine Learning and Data Mining concepts and techniques
Business awareness and effective communication skills
First Nations Acknowledgment
As this role is an opportunity in Toronto, Ontario - AltaML acknowledges that we are on the traditional territory of many nations including the Mississaugas of the Credit, the Anishnabeg, the Chippewa, the Haudenosaunee and the Wendat peoples and is now home to many diverse First Nations, Inuit and Métis peoples. AltaML also acknowledges that Toronto is covered by Treaty 13 signed with the Mississaugas of the Credit, and the Williams Treaties signed with multiple Mississaugas and Chippewa bands.
Equal Opportunities
AltaML is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a safe, diverse and inclusive environment. We encourage qualified applicants of all backgrounds including ethnicity, religion, disability status, gender identity, sexual orientation, family status, age, nationality, and education levels to apply. If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please let us know.
About our Company:
AltaML is a fast-growing startup that focuses on applied Machine Learning (ML). We see AI as the next step forward in unlocking the best in all industries - and people. We are experts in ML commercialization and help our industrial partners gain a competitive advantage by combining their data and domain expertise with our analytics and ML proficiency. Data informs our every move, and we aim to work quickly, collaboratively, and creatively. We have offices in Edmonton, Calgary and Toronto.

AltaML works with progressive partners in industries such as Health, Financial Services and Natural Resources. Sure, we are a tech company, so we offer a well-stocked kitchen including good coffee, sparkling water, and snacks. We are an office filled with foodies and enjoy experiencing different flavours from around the world. We also offer Welcome Lunches, Friday Socials, hot sauce tastings and so much more!
Data informs our every move, and we aim to work quickly, collaboratively, and creatively.
What you’ll get:
You will be working in a high-paced environment that focuses on creating unique ML solutions to problems within a number of different industries to generate impactful value.

You will be working at a company with employees who have multiple years of industrial and academic experience in data science, software engineering, product management, and machine learning fields. To solve the problems we apply various ML techniques from traditional Machine Learning and Data Mining algorithms, through to vision, Deep Learning, Information Extraction, advanced NLP and conversational agents.

You will be able to experience a collaborative company culture, which means we believe in working hard, getting the job done, and enjoying the group social on Fridays. You’ll also get flexibility in where you work, what hours you work, how much vacation you take, and what you wear. We expect hard work but respect work/life balance.

So, however you identify and whatever background and experiences you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you “tap dance to work” every day. We would love to add your biological uniqueness to our own! :-)

Job Description
The Manager, Loyalty Analytics is accountable for delivering high impact insights and business recommendations on Scene+ members to inform strategic decision making for business lines across the organization.
This individual will integrate campaign optimizations, channel analytics, customer models/segmentations and recommendation/decision engines to help elevate our customer’s experiences and support progress toward a 1:1 customer journey. They will consult with internal partners to reveal new market opportunities, identify gaps and opportunities for performance improvements, and define objectives, processes, and requirements as it relates to loyalty strategy, planning, and business intelligence.
As a key member of the Cineplex Loyalty team, the Manager, Loyalty Analytics will contribute to and lead several critical initiatives to improve our customer intelligence and overall engagement success. A curious problem-solver, the successful candidate will look beyond the data to uncover growth opportunities.
Leverage SCENE+ member data and other customer data sources to provide analysis, insights, and recommendations to inform past, current, and future marketing strategies, programs, and campaigns for multiple stakeholders across the organization’s various lines of business.
Develop and improve upon essential data models and serve as the Loyalty business lead on key data science projects and strategic initiatives.
Work with internal enablement teams (IT, Data Science), partners (SCENE GP, Scotiabank), and vendors to improve data quality, resolve data integrity issues, optimize reporting, and support new data integrations.
Prepare and evolve regular Loyalty reporting for senior leadership summarizing KPIs, SCENE member behavior, and highlights.
Build and maintain automated and integrated processes for data retrieval, analysis, and interpretation to track customer engagement and value over time.
Research industry trends and emerging technologies to increase Cineplex’s ability to compete on analytics.

Qualifications

A Bachelor’s Degree or College Diploma with a focus in Analytics, Business, or Marketing.
2+ years of B2C experience in data analytics or business intelligence.

Job Description
The Manager, Loyalty Analytics is accountable for delivering high impact insights and business recommendations on Scene+ members to inform strategic decision making for business lines across the organization.
This individual will integrate campaign optimizations, channel analytics, customer models/segmentations and recommendation/decision engines to help elevate our customer’s experiences and support progress toward a 1:1 customer journey. They will consult with internal partners to reveal new market opportunities, identify gaps and opportunities for performance improvements, and define objectives, processes, and requirements as it relates to loyalty strategy, planning, and business intelligence.
As a key member of the Cineplex Loyalty team, the Manager, Loyalty Analytics will contribute to and lead several critical initiatives to improve our customer intelligence and overall engagement success. A curious problem-solver, the successful candidate will look beyond the data to uncover growth opportunities.
Leverage SCENE+ member data and other customer data sources to provide analysis, insights, and recommendations to inform past, current, and future marketing strategies, programs, and campaigns for multiple stakeholders across the organization’s various lines of business.
Develop and improve upon essential data models and serve as the Loyalty business lead on key data science projects and strategic initiatives.
Work with internal enablement teams (IT, Data Science), partners (SCENE GP, Scotiabank), and vendors to improve data quality, resolve data integrity issues, optimize reporting, and support new data integrations.
Prepare and evolve regular Loyalty reporting for senior leadership summarizing KPIs, SCENE member behavior, and highlights.
Build and maintain automated and integrated processes for data retrieval, analysis, and interpretation to track customer engagement and value over time.
Research industry trends and emerging technologies to increase Cineplex’s ability to compete on analytics.

Qualifications

A Bachelor’s Degree or College Diploma with a focus in Analytics, Business, or Marketing.
2+ years of B2C experience in data analytics or business intelligence.
2+ years of B2C experience in loyalty.
Champions a customer focused culture and demonstrates the One Cineplex way of thinking, putting the customer at the heart of everything that they do
Analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate technical considerations into business implications and synthesize data into actionable insights
Excellent analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills, with emphasis on financial, marketing post-mortem, and strategic analysis
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases
Advanced knowledge of Excel (i.e. formulas, pivot tables, databases, VBA, and macros)
Experience using business intelligence tools: Microsoft Power BI, Alteryx, Tableau, Google Analytics, or similar
Hands on CRM experience, with a focus on building segmentation.

About Us
Snapcommerce is a high-growth company that sits at the intersection of mobile commerce and fintech. Our flagship product, Snaptravel allows millions of users around the world to book their travel over messaging. We are currently in the scale-up phase of the company with plans to grow from ~150 employees to ~300+ employees as fast as possible while maintaining the competitive advantages and culture of being a startup.
With a high-performing team of world-class leaders, Snapcommerce thrives on tackling complex problems within AI, E-commerce, and Conversational Design to push the boundaries of the value we can add to our users’ lives!
At Snapcommerce, we pride ourselves on the performance-driven environment we’ve created for our team to prosper and excel. Our values are rooted in making data driven-decisions and risk-taking actions that add value to both the user and the company. Check out this article from our CEO, Hussein on Snapcommerce's Core Values to learn more!
About the Role
We are looking for an Analytics Manager to lead one of our data analytics teams through the next phase of growth. This is an exciting opportunity to have a lot of influence on the future structure and process of the data function at a hyper-growth phase startup.
The role will be responsible for driving our analytic capabilities, supporting our analyses/experimentation function, partnering with our business teams to support our data-driven culture, and developing a robust internship program to support the rapid growth of Snapcommerce. You will mentor, lead and coach a high-performing group of Data Analysts, and work closely with senior leadership to drive data-centric business decisions and reach our ambitious company goals. You will also play an ownership role in the selection, maintenance, and onboarding of our modern technology stack (Fivetran, Snowflake, Amplitude, dbt, and Looker).
We are looking for someone who can leverage our large-scale data on user behavior with predictive analytics, segmentation, AB testing, and other advanced methodologies to increase customer retention and acquisition, and support our growing new verticals. In this role, you will be a thought partner with business stakeholders and engineering leaders helping to build upon the algorithms and insights that inform every customer journey.
Key Challenges
People Leader: You will hire, train, motivate, and support direct reports. You will oversee a team of 3+ Analysts. You will compare actual versus expected deliverables at high frequencies and exchange actionable feedback.
Analytical Vision: Articulate a strategic vision for your team covering the business plan, technology, tools, operations, and align that with various other teams across the company. Implement and enforce best practices and workflows that improve the use of data across the organization.
Experimentation Framework: Build upon the existing testing framework to support our business teams in quick interactions on A/B testing to drive hypothesis-driven innovation.
Data-driven Culture: It’s one of our core values! You will be an ambassador for our data-driven culture, taking data and using it to answer complex business questions, drive strategy, and inform decision-making.
Solution Architecture: You will work closely with our data engineering team to define data requirements and design systems that will scale and can be leveraged across applications.
Analytics Engineering Health: You will promote the health (integrity, reliability, cost) of our data platform with code reviews, technical mentorship, tech talks (internal & external) and expansion of best practices.
Delivery Excellence: You will partner with leaders and stakeholders across Snapcommerce to define, design and deliver data solutions to support self-service analytics and promote data-supported decision making across the company.
Collaboration: You will build a collaborative and inclusive team culture that breaks down barriers, builds bridges and grows the team to become stronger and more versatile.
About You
You enjoy mentoring people and are very good at it. That means you’ve had a team of direct reports (2+ individuals) for at least 1+ years and you’ve demonstrated the ability to develop a team including hiring, coaching, and mentoring of team members.
You have 3+ years of progressive experience in the Analytics field using modern tools to build reports, dashboards, data visualizations, data models, data warehouses/lakes and queries.
You have worked as an analytics lead and/or data team lead in a fast-paced environment and understand how to drive insights from complex data.
You have extensive experience working with Team Directors across business functions and using data to influence company decisions.
You can design clear and actionable analysis plans that target impactful insights and use the most appropriate statistical practices.
You have extensive experience in your analysis language of choice (Python or R) to complete analyses that have clear conclusions and recommendations.
You are outstanding at pulling, cleaning, and manipulating large sets of complex data and transforming them into structures that are easy to understand.
You understand that some systems need to be built to scale and others need to be built fast. You can make those tradeoffs and reach mutually beneficial conclusions with stakeholders.
You are a problem solver, forward thinker, and someone who can ruthlessly prioritize different business initiatives.
You can acquire and establish credibility quickly by demonstrating your subject matter expertise in the technology and our areas of business.
Perks & Benefits
We are a Remote-first company, we offer flexible working hours with complete work-from-home freedom and a guilt-free unlimited vacation policy
Enjoy employee rewards, and travel discounts using SnapTravel
Competitive salaries, equity options, full benefits from day one, wellness budgets, and paid development - we’ve got you covered!
UberEats credits, meal budgets, special treats, and team lunches. When in the office, enjoy daily snack services and unlimited coffee, tea, and other drinks
Supporting continued growth with Learning & Development, Diversity & Inclusion events, TED talk Tuesdays, and Lunch & Learn opportunities
We welcome new additions with a generous EI top-up, parental leave, additional vacation, and a flexible return-to-work plan
Game nights, Happy Hours, internal hackathons, team building games, workouts, and more
We Believe in Equal Opportunity
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Position Title: Manager, Data Analytics (Contract - Full Time)
Division: Digital & Innovation
Department: Strategy & Business Intelligence
Reports To: Director, Data Analytics
Location: Toronto, Yonge & Eglinton (on the Yonge subway line)
TVO is at a unique intersection of education, journalism, digital technology, broadcast, and philanthropy. As creators of award-winning content, we’ve been inspiring learning that changes lives and enriches communities since 1970. Our vision is to be a globally recognized digital learning organization.
What’s in it for you
When it comes to learning, we walk the talk: it’s the cornerstone of everything we do, and each one of us invests deeply in our own learning while elevating each other’s knowledge – whether through peer-to-peer learning, workshops or lunch & learns. You’ll work with folks who are thrilled and driven by the digital learning and media landscapes. Roll up your sleeves and work cross-functionally with great teams where collaboration is the beating heart of all that we do. We’re a tight-knit community and we’re just the right size, meaning that you’ll get to meet and work with people from across our organization, at all levels – the ones who have been here for 10 months, 10 years, and well beyond. Maybe you’ll even get to meet Polkaroo.
Who we are
TVO is poised for its next chapter as we embark on the next phase of strategic planning. We know we are a better organization when we honor our commitments, when we thrive with diverse voices, when we value bold thinking, and embrace change. We understand and celebrate that we are better, together.
However, you jump in with us, you’ll join a team of good people who are constantly inspired and challenged to do great work. Join us on our journey as we go from great to greater.
TVO is funded primarily by the Province of Ontario, and is a registered charity supported by thousands of sponsors and donors. Find and follow us on: YouTube (@TVO), Twitter (@TVO), Facebook (@TVO), and Instagram (@WeAreTVO).
The Opportunity
The Manager, Data Analytics will be responsible for design, procurement and analysis of the organization’s Business Information. This includes: Audience data for broadcast digital and social media; Proprietary data of our educational products including revenues, usage and educational metrics; Proprietary donor and CRM data, and various third party data sources (including custom research) that provide competitive and market analysis.
Reporting to the Director, Data & Analytics this individual will provide quantitative and qualitative findings on TVO’s and competitors to assist various departments and inform the overall strategic planning efforts of the company, helping develop and drive innovation, identifying opportunities for growth, and commercializing new business.
The incumbent will be responsible for standard reporting, ad hoc requests, and special projects. The Manager is a versatile leader within the Data team and collaborator with internal stakeholders. The successful candidate will be confident in media and product data skills and will be supported in the continuing evolution of their digital analytic skills. He/she will ensure that recurring product data, market intelligence reports and analysis are issued accurately and on schedule, while at times working autonomously on analytical assignments. The Manager will oversee qualitative initiatives on an as needed basis and work closely with TVO’s business development team in the preparation and evaluation of research to support new content monetization initiatives. In addition, the manger will oversee the work of four direct reports, Senior Data Analyst, System Administrator - Philanthropy and two Database Developers.
The successful candidate must have a comprehensive understanding of all aspects of the quantitative research function, revenue management systems and business strategies primarily in the education and media industries, but related experience would an asset. In addition he/she must have extensive knowledge of web analytics in order to provide business analysis on the effective use of data and information to drive positive results against key success factors. Exceptional organizational skills, management experience, an analytical mindset, expertise in PowerPoint, Excel and report development and tracking are a must. The Manager must also have an overall understanding of broadcast program evaluation, corporate sponsorship, and marketing and be a self-starter who knows how to manage external vendors and seek out alliances and partnerships to develop effective and actionable reports.
How you will make an impact
Work with product teams and support areas in providing competitive market analysis and establishment of business cases.
Work with product teams and support areas in establishing metrics and performance agreements (PAs).
Oversees the design and execution of process, policy and procedures for delivery of Business Information to internal clients (including data self-serve options).
Oversees the design and execution of weekly, monthly and quarterly reports that assess TVO and competitors’ Business Information on multiple platforms.
Procurement of data suppliers that support TVO in its New Strategic Directions (NSD) and the success of its products and support departments. Manage negotiations and relationships with ComScore, Environics, Comscore, Numeris, and any other appropriate vendors in order to provide necessary research tools for the organization.
How can the challenges facing content providers in a fragmenting market be quantified?
How can TVO reach and engage with all Ontarians?
What role does technology play in lifelong learning?
What are the trends on the educational media competitive landscape?
How do organizations ensure they are using the appropriate data sets?
Leads data analysis/interpretation and recommendations to internal clients.
How can data ROI be maximized
Lead in the development of new analytics: bring ideas forward to internal clients on new or better ways of analyzing things; recommend new metrics (and ways to measure them) that might be more appropriate to our existing and future operations.
Oversee analytics systems for Broadcast (Numeris), Online (Comscore, Google, Brightcove), Social Media (Hootsuite, Facebook Insights, Crowdbooster), Media behaviours & consumption (MTM, PMB, Environics) and internal TVO systems (Convio, ILC & HH databases).
Work with product teams to ensure proper coding is imbedded in TVO products (e.g. Google Analytics) for data measurement.
Provide strategic research analysis and expertise to support the corporate strategy and multi-year business plan.
Oversee the planning and execution of focus group and awareness studies and surveys as required by internal clients where needed.
Play a strategic role in monitoring the multi-platform media industry for key trends, initiatives, competitive dynamics, market estimates and emerging technologies.
Manage a team of Senior Data Analyst, Database Developers x2 and System Administrator - Philanthropy.
Effectively communicate and manage internal clients to ensure Data processes are well understood and adhered to.
Ensure internal clients are sufficiently certified / trained for data self-serve options.
What you will bring to TVO
Minimum of ten years of related research experience (preferably in media & education).
Bachelor’s Degree in business, marketing, communications, statistics, or related field.
Detailed inside/out knowledge of Google Analytics, Numeris, and comScore systems.
Experience with social media measurement software.
Exceptional skills in SQL and relational databases
An expert at data analysis and interpretation.
Knowledge in one or more of the following specialty areas is a significant advantage: Digital Product Development, MySQL, big data sets, R, Tableau, SWOT analyses, conjoint analysis.
Strong PowerPoint and Excel skills and presentation experience.
A highly motivated team player, organized, strategic thinker and passionate about the media industry.
Demonstrated team building skills including experience in goal setting, motivating, leading, evaluating and developing cooperative teams.
Proactive and able to use initiative to develop solutions, problem solving and decision-making.
Ability to plan, execute and analyze strategies within a designated timeframe and deadlines.
Ability to manage and work with a wide range of individuals with varying business acumen.
Strong interpersonal skills and excellent communication skills (written and verbal).
High energy, enthusiasm, motivation and confidence.
You live out values of Excellence & Innovation; Ownership; Collaboration; Diversity, Equity & Inclusion; Trust and Respect
-
We invite you to submit your application by February 14, 2022 at 5:00 p.m. Think you don’t have everything we’re asking for, but know you can make a big impact? Tell us your story and we will be happy to consider you.
To learn more about us and our culture, please visit us at https://www.tvo.org/about/work-at-tvo.
TVO is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to an inclusive, equitable, and accessible workplace where all employees feel valued, respected, and supported. We believe that the diversity of our team strengthens our ability to develop creative solutions and products that are reflective of the communities in which we serve across Ontario. At TVO, we recognize the importance of using anti-oppression practices, both within our organization and in our content.
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process (e.g., including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms). If you are seeking accommodations during the application or interview process, please advise us as soon as possible so that appropriate arrangements can be made by sending your request to accommodations@tvo.org.

Position Title: Manager Global Data Governance
Position Type: Regular - Full-Time
Position Location: Toronto HQ OR Florenceville GTC
Grade: Grade 06
Requisition ID: 14486

We know the importance that food plays in people's lives – the power it has to bring people, families and communities together. Our purpose is to bring enjoyment to people’s lives through great tasting food, in a way which reflects our values. McCain has recently committed to implementing regenerative agriculture practices across 100 percent of our potato acreage by 2030. Ask us more about our commitment to sustainability.

OVERVIEW
McCain is embarking on a digital transformation. As part of this transformation, we are making significant investments into our data structures and policies to increase the quality of our data, the confidence of our business teams to use this data to make decisions and drive value through the use of data.
We have a new and ambitious Global Data & Analytics group, which serves as a resource to the business teams in our regions and global functions. We are currently recruiting an experienced data governance professional to join our world-class data governance team.
JOB PURPOSE
The Global Data Governance Manager will support the development and roll out of global processes and leverage global tools to govern data in a way that is consistent and standardized across all regions. As a member of the Global Data Governance team, the individual will support development of data governance strategies, including enforcement of policies, guidelines, standard procedures, and ensuring proper communications. The position will assist in data management, governance, and data quality of master data requirements for various functions to ensure master data integrity across the organization. This role will be responsible for driving data quality; creating reports/metrics to ascertain data quality and integrity; research, analysis and root cause identification of data errors and providing key design input for application functionality. This role will report into the Director Global Data Governance.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
Data Governance Practice
The successful candidate’s responsibilities will span the people, process, and technology pillars of Data Governance:
Assist the Director Global Data Governance in the build of global data governance strategy, policy, standards and adoption of processes to drive enterprise value
Lead the implementation of data management, data governance, and data quality tools/platforms
Lead the build of enterprise data catalog, data lineage and metadata management tools within the organization’s big data environment
Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand data requirements and create standard definitions for key metrics used throughout the organization
Ensure compliance with records retention, data classification, and security policies
Work with other governing bodies to ensure content is current, accessible with appropriate sanctioning framework and processes
Create documentation pertaining to business processes and data
Develop processes aligned with the Critical Data Register, Highly Critical Data mapping and yearly attestation of roles and responsibilities
Collaborate with Data Platforms team, Data Architecture to ensure consistency in engineering practices, and enterprise data model
Lead data governance projects as assigned
Lead enterprise efforts in mapping highly critical data through tool sets and processes
Build Data Literacy Program across the organization
Data Quality & Analytics
Support the build of the global data quality program
Work with the Business to build data quality rules and metrics for specific data attributes and monitor on a monthly basis
Assist with regular compliance reviews against policies and standards
Build the Issue Tracking and Resolution Management process
Work with business to mitigate downstream impacts of change to multiple systems.
Receive and analyze requests for new standards and values.

KEY QUALIFICATION & EXPERIENCES:
Education and Experience
 o Bachelor’s degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
 o Minimum of 8+years’ experience with data management/governance, including but not limited to data governance, master data management, data protection, and/or data quality
 o Preferred: experience working in SAP for master data management
 o Preferred: experience working with PIM, Salesforce, and Data Catalog / Data Governance / MDM technologies and systems
 o Preferred: experience in CPG or food and beverage
Global data transformation and data-focused change management
 o Led initiatives harmonizing systems, processes, and/or data across business areas and functions
 o Experience developing and implementing data governance policies and standards
 o Experience building data catalogs and business glossaries
 o Experience documenting solutions in support of standards and best practices
 o Demonstrated track record of producing work that is highly accurate, demonstrate attention to detail, and reflect well on the organization
 o Experience participating in or leading organizational change management initiatives
Communication and influencing skills
 o Strong facilitation and project leadership skills with the ability to drive issues to closure
 o Demonstrated ability to influence and foster collaborative relationships with ability to engage resources outside of direct-control to gain consensus, meet deadlines and achieve goals and objectives.
 o Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written
 o Positive attitude and a team player
Experience and flexible self-started
 o Experience working on an agile team in a virtual, distributed environment
 o Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and participate as an independent contributor with little supervision or as an active team member depending on the situation and needs
 Critical thinking
 o Analytical and interpretation skills, ability to review data and gain insight
 o Decision-making skills with the ability to investigate and weigh alternatives and select the course of action that provides the greatest benefit to the organization
 o Creative thinking skills with the ability to ask the needed bigger-picture questions that lead to process improvements
 o Experience establishing metrics/key performance indicators to measure business impact and process compliance

Job Family: Information Technology
Division: Global Technology
Department: Customer & Vendor Data

Location(s): CA - Canada : Ontario : Toronto || CA - Canada : New Brunswick : Florenceville-Bristol
Company: McCain Foods (Canada)

Overview:

KPMG is a global organization of independent professional services firms providing Audit, Tax and Advisory services. We operate in 146 countries, have more than 220,000 people working in member firms around the world.
KPMG International acts as a coordinating entity, carrying out business activities for the benefit of KPMG firms. More than 2,500 talented colleagues make up the KPMG International team, with a focus on ensuring global consistency and providing expertise to support member firms in the achievement of KPMG’s Trust and Growth ambition. KPMG International is comprised of a number of high-performing global teams, including: Global Advisory, Global Audit, Global Clients & Markets, Global Corporate Affairs, Global People, Global Quality and Risk Management, Global Tax & Legal, Global Technology and Knowledge, the International Office of General Counsel, and the Office of Chief Administrative Officer. Working together, our global team is changing the way our business operates, delivering value to our member firms and driving positive change in the communities we serve.
The Global Chief Administrative Office (CAO) supports KPMG's Collective Strategy by being the most trusted source of financial, HR and operational information, insight and monitoring that enables the growth and health of our business across KPMG. The Business Enablement Services (BES) Investment Intelligence team is a trusted advisor to Global leadership and investment teams in providing investment decision-making support.
The team strives to build a transparent digital space where the KPMG network can see investment progress and benefits from Business Case to Return on Investment. Investment Intelligence also monitors the Global investments by engaging in various auditing and reporting processes to provide demand-driven investment analyses. The information collected provides Global leadership with key insights into the evolution of strategic initiatives. The vision is to help KPMG realize the value of its investments.
This role is responsible for providing Investement Intelligence services. It will involve day-to-day liaison with KPMG leadership. All outputs and activities must be at the highest possible standards and the successful candidate will need to display exceptional communication and influencing skills.
The role will champion new ways of working, using cutting edge technology to create, data visualizations by building initial prototypes, including dashboards and reports for production systems.
Responsibility includes the end-to-end design, development and curation of reporting solutions for Investment Intelligence. These solutions are focused on building or enhancing insights to support KPMGI leadership's strategic decisions pertaining to global investments. This role will help lead our strategy, identify best practices, new ways of working and advance our reporting capabilities.
This role requires strong project management skills, an ability to connect ideas and resources for new purposes and an eye for quality.
What you will do:
Collaborate with Investment Intelligence senior leadership and senior stakeholder team members to understand business needs and suggest effective visualizations to drive insight and decisions
Develop and implement the strategy for data management, data extraction, data analysis, and advanced analytics and reporting
Design, implement and manage various reporting process and dashboards;
Drive the development and improvement of the analytical reporting for all stakeholders
Combining data from multiple sources depending on business requirements
Build automated ingestion processes to prepare, extract, and transform a variety of structured and unstructured data sources
Work with data warehousing concepts, relational databases and structures
Work with large data sets with variety of tools (Power BI, Tableau, etc.)
Lead the professional development of the Investment Intelligence team relating to data visualization best practices.
Lead innovation sessions to identify business opportunities, define problem statements and design analytical solutions
What you bring to this role:
Experience working with and consulting senior managment
Minimum of 7 years of recent experience (minimum of 3 years of managment) in Data Analytics and Data warehousing
Expertise working with data systems and SQL
Expertise building and creating dashboards through visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, QlikSense
A track record of development of and implementing forward-thinking approaches and initiatives that have a lasting impact on the organisation and its operating performance
Comfortable with complexity and finding a new path or solution coupled with strong business acumen
Strong influencing skills, an ability to articulate clear, compelling ideas and to persuade others to take action
Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in a quantitative field (data science, computer science, economics, mathematics),
Strong communication skills with ability to explain technical concepts and analytics driven findings to leaders and non- technical audiences
Understand complex data and processes to perform data analysis, review reporting logic, trace data lineage and sources
Operate in a fast-paced and dynamic environment with both virtual and face-to-face interactions
Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate exploratory models that will reveal insights
Ability to prioritize and organize effectively with an attention to detail
Ability to communicate and function in a culturally diverse and change oriented setting
Proven experience building compelling and engaging data visualization and presentations
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to travel when necessary
Intelligent Working
At KPMG International, we are supportive of helping you to achieve a balance between your home and work demands. We are happy to discuss individual requirements and our range of flexible working arrangements could be of interest. Please ask to find out more.
KPMG International's commitment to inclusion & diversity
At KPMG International, we recognise that we need inclusion and diversity to be successful. We want to attract, retain and develop diverse talent at all levels. This means recruiting from the widest pool of talent across our network and beyond, removing barriers that can prevent our people from reaching their full potential, and fostering a fully inclusive environment which empowers everyone to bring their whole selves to work.
Applying with a disability
KPMG International is proud to be an inclusive place to work and we are committed to ensuring that you are treated fairly throughout our recruitment process. Should you be successful after the initial application stage, please discuss any reasonable adjustments that you may require with your recruitment contact.
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
KPMG is committed to the health and safety of our people, clients and communities. With this commitment in mind, KPMG complies with all public health mandates (provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and has implemented various safety measures, including a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. KPMG's COVID 19 Vaccination Policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated if they wish to or are required to attend a KPMG office and/or other congregate settings in the course of their duties (such as client sites or third-party venues).
As this role requires occasional or consistent attendance at a KPMG office and/or congregate setting, the successful candidate must be fully vaccinated (i.e. have received all doses that are recommended by Health Canada, including any boosters) and must provide KPMG with proof of vaccination. KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.
KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice.
For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.

job_description:
Address:
100 King Street West
Job Family Group:
Data Analytics & Reporting
BMO has anchored its future ambition on the use of Data and Analytics across the Bank. In their current mandate, the Data and Analytics team (DnA), under the leadership of the Enterprise Chief Data and Analytics Officer is accountable for developing the broader strategy for DnA along with capabilities in support of the efforts of the Bank.
These efforts begin with active engagement with each Group/Service through Business leaders, Digital/Technology leaders and DnA leaders; partnering with the group/service to evaluate and elevate their Data and Analytics practices, ideation on new opportunities to utilize Data and Analytics and execution through a partnership model to deliver measurable value while operating within a strong risk management framework.
This position will serve as the primary point of contact for Data Lifecycle Processes and is accountable for the delivery of optimal processes and seamless experiences (for data access and data intake) across enterprise data platforms.
The Manager, Data Quality Management will:
Manage the end-to-end data lifecycle processes, workflows, controls and experiences, from data acquisition to disposal for enterprise data repositories (both cloud and traditional on-premises)
Participate in all aspects of process excellence activities including fostering process adoption, process reviews and maturity assessment, facilitating feedback forums, process walk-throughs, process design and requirements validation, maintaining updated process artifacts etc.
Lead data lifecycle process optimization initiatives to simplify work, reduce complexity, improve data quality and increase operational efficiency
Drive and deliver process change across all lines of business and manage ongoing process excellence culture
Lead data related strategic initiatives or a component of an initiative, in collaboration with Technology partners, Business stakeholders and data community
Support regulatory and audit reviews at various levels, including preparation of evidence materials for internal and external stakeholders
Applies expertise and thinks creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine.
Note this is an individual contributor role
Qualifications:
Post-secondary degree in related field of study with a concentration in a technical major or an equivalent combination of extensive education and technical proficiency gained through business experience
Prior experience in an operational role relating to data access, data classification or data intake preferred
Good knowledge and understanding of data management processes, procedures and controls, data governance, data quality, catalogues, data elements
Knowledge and experience in building Data Quality checks and Data Quality monitoring
Good understanding of lean six sigma principles and process mapping fundamentals
Deep knowledge in financial industry business as well as knowledge of major data consumption use cases in financial services
Excellent collaboration skills and demonstrated passion for execution excellence
Analytical mindset and problem-solving skills
Experience in Process Improvement & Change Management
Data driven decision making
Experience in Data Quality tools like Informatica IDQ, Info Analyzer, Ataccama and other DQ tools is preferred
Understanding of query and SQL
Experience in reporting tools like PowerBI would be an asset
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

As the captive finance company of the Audi, Ducati and Volkswagen brands in Canada, VW Credit Canada, Inc., also known as Audi Finance and Volkswagen Finance, is a wholly owned subsidiary of VW Credit, Inc. Audi Finance and Volkswagen Finance offers a wide range of leasing, retail financing and protection plans expertly tailored to meet the needs of our Customers. Additionally, we provide commercial financing products to Audi and Volkswagen Dealers to support expanding dealership capabilities and enhancing overall operations.
The NAR Remarketing Data & Analytics Manager is responsible for overseeing the day to day data transfer, analytics and reporting functions including the supervision of Remarketing Analyst roles. This position ensures timely and accurate management of data and the performance of applications and technologies required to process and produce remarketing reporting and analysis. Acts as a departmental SME for all data and data processing functions for internal and NAR Remarketing to vendor related data. Plays an important role in leading the charge for implementation of new technological and data science related functions for NAR Remarketing.
Responsibilities:
Oversees Data / System Related change management and Requirements for Remarketing Projects. Evaluates and presents new technologies that can be incorporated in the NAR remarketing business including AI capabilities.
Manages and Oversees the processes for Data mining, manipulation and interpretation ensuring the quality of data for both Internal and Vendor data sources.
Manages and Maintains all reporting related process flows, operating procedures, work instructions and implements effective Quality Control procedures for outgoing reports.
Supervises Remarketing Analysts including monitoring of daily work activity, quality and productivity to achieve performance expectations and objectives.
Assist in development, coordination, implementation, & analysis of various Remarketing programs & processes by performing analysis as required by the Director, NAR Remarketing Operations and Analysing industry trends.
Experience:
5 years in a professional role.
1 year in a Supervisory experience
Preferred: 3 years in automotive industry experience
Prior project management exprience
Previous database management experience

Master's degree with concentration in Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science or Finance

Skills:
Advanced querying skills
Strong analytical skills
Critical thinking skills
Active listening skills
Knowledge Business Objects
Presentation skills
Detail Orientation
Project Management
Experience with Data Visualization tools like Tableau & Sales Force

Preferred skills:
Relational Database management skills
Experience with VBA and SQL
Knowledge of Finance and Accounting
MS Access
Experience with implementation of new technologies related to process improvement and enhancement.

Hybrid

VW Credit Canada, Inc. is committed to the health, safety, and well-being of our employees. Effective November 8, 2021, VW Credit Canada, Inc. will require all new employees to be fully vaccinated (with the number of doses recommended by public health guidance) against COVID-19. New employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination or entitlement to an exemption. If you are entitled to an exemption (as determined by VW Credit Canada, Inc.) then you will be required to follow the company’s applicable protocol for unvaccinated workers. VW Credit Canada, Inc. is also committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to individuals with disabilities. A career at Consumer Protection BC puts you at the centre of a highly valued marketplace guardian. Our vision is for all citizens of British Columbia to feel empowered in their transactions as a result of rigorous and consistent business compliance and through the provision of solution-based information. We believe in engaging, educating, empowering and enforcing to build a stronger marketplace in the province of BC.
If you’re looking for an opportunity to help make a difference in the community, we invite you to explore the possibilities with us. We offer competitive benefits and pension plan, access to training and development opportunities and the chance to work with a team of passionate professionals committed to making a difference. Please review our current vacancy below.
Manager of Data Science and Analytics
Location: Victoria, BC
Term: Full-time, permanent
Salary Range: $67,843.62 - $77,521.17 annually
Consumer Protection BC is looking for a Manager of Data Science & Analytics to join our team!
A day in the life:
Upon entering the office (or logging in from home), you grab a cup of coffee and have a quick chat with your co-workers. As you are very self-driven, you spend time at your desk working on analyzing some recent data looking for trends and anomalies. You might switch gears midmorning to work on internal data policies, ensuring plain language to create a powerful internal tool for the entire organization to use and understand.
You might spend your lunchbreak in the lunchroom working on a crossword with co-workers, or you might head out for a stroll around Swan Lake. Or if you’re working from home, maybe you take 15 minutes to check out the latest posts in our employee engagement platform Yammer.
In the afternoon you might fine tune a presentation to staff, which will bring them along on your progress so they can better understand what the impact of your recent analysis and recommend process changes will have on them. Later in the afternoon you will host an internal working group meeting that will change how we gather and store data from consumers that will help us better understand and solve problems. Being involved in projects that require you to obtain, review and process specific information is of great value to our organization. You appreciate the ability to be involved with other departments and you are grateful for the opportunity to learn something new every single day.
Who you are:
A problem solver with the ability to analyze problems, identify underlying causes and generate solutions.
An information seeker, driven by a desire to know more about things by going beyond the questions to find potential information or opportunities.
A team player who enjoys working with diverse teams, work groups and across an organization to achieve group and organizational goals.

What you will be doing:
Using your advanced knowledge of statistics and analytical modeling to draw insights that inform strategic and operational decision-making.
Acting as the key statistical resource internally and externally with our stakeholders, including working on diverse teams or attending external meetings.
Guiding individuals, teams, and leadership in your areas of expertise to ensure work processes and procedures are effectively implemented and communicated across the organization.

We are looking for people who have:
University degree with a focus in statistics, mathematics, data science, research or other related fields of study. A combination of experience and education will be considered.
Minimum two years’ experience in advanced analytics, complex statistical analysis, mathematical modeling, data mining, data visualization and optimization.
Track-record of applying modeling techniques and statistics to solve real world problems.

How to apply:
If you’re interested in this role we invite you to review the complete job description and submit a resume via email to careers@consumerprotectionbc.ca. An eligibility list may be established.
job_title: Manager of Data Science and Analytics, Consumer Protection BC

job_description:
JOB INFORMATION


Position Title: Senior Clinical Data Manager
Position Location: Canada or US (home-based)
Position Reports To: Manager, Clinical Data Management
Department/Unit Name: Clinical Data Management
JOB SUMMARY:

Responsible for leading, planning and execution of all data management activities for assigned projects, ensuring focus on data integrity, validity, reliability in accordance with standard processes, sponsor guidelines, industry best practices and regulatory standards. Act as coach, mentor and/or Subject Matter Expert within the department, aiding Manager in process improvements, issue escalation and training development and delivery. Support the department and company in achieving objectives and strategic goals.
ROLE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
Project Support

Serve as the Lead Data Manager and primary contact responsible for overseeing day-to-day data management activities from study start-up through final database lock, including, but not limited to:
Creation and maintenance of the Data Management Plan
Development and design of Case Report Forms (CRFs)
Develop Database Build specifications and coordinate database build and testing activities with database programmers
Define and test edit checks
Perform data review and query generation/resolution
Track study progress and issue periodic status reports
Process/reconcile electronic data received from other data sources, e.g. CIMS, Safety database, labs, IRT
Oversee database lock and transfer process.
Coordinate and supervise the day-day work of Data Management (DM) staff assigned.
Train and mentor assigned employees on data management procedures and guidelines.
Participate/lead internal/sponsor meetings as required, working directly with the assigned project manager and team to provide data management support
. Ensure approved study documentation is maintained and properly stored in the trial master files.
Manage project resources per budget and within expected timeframes.
Develop or assist with the project training development and delivery, for investigators, clinical sites, project teams and sponsors on data collection processes, tools and/or equipment as required.
Act as point of escalation for data related issues and queries.


Department Support

Contribute to the continuous improvement of DM and the wider organization through information sharing, training and education.
Promote and be an advocate of DM internally and externally.
Coach, mentor and/or train peers, contribute to peer selection, performance evaluation, peer orientation and project communications.
May participate in and/or lead the development, review and implementation of processes, policies, SOPs/WI’s and associated documents affecting DM.
May participate in and/or lead DM and cross functional working groups.
May supervise Data Management staff.


QUALIFICATIONS:

Applicants should have a minimum of a one to two year post-secondary certification in a relevant field of study, and 3-5 years of related work experience in Clinical Data Management with ongoing training. CCDM designation is considered an asset.
WORKING CONDITIONS:
 Home-based
Accommodations for job applicants with disabilities are available

Aon is looking for a Financial Data & Reporting Manager

Aon’s Digital Client Solutions Finance team is looking for a Financial Data and Reporting Manager. This senior technical resource to work with our Finance, Technology, and Business groups to create insightful financial reporting and support business decision-making. The ideal candidate will understand the worlds of Finance users, front-end sales/service, and development to make connections across functions.

Responsibilities Include:
Maintain current set of excel-based reports that are sourced from multiple systems until they can be retired (Salesforce, Looker, Stripe/PayPal, Applied Epic, etc.).
Enhance and automate legacy reporting for improved reliability and effectiveness, developing comprehensive management dashboards for key metrics and financials.
Create ad-hoc financial reporting as needed from different systems, in partnership with teams in other areas such as Business Intelligence, Controllership, and Operations.
Test quality of data throughout platform migrations and model changes. Establish methodologies to ensure financial data integrity and flag issues where they may exist. Design tests to be performed by domain experts (BI) and ultimately sign-off on data quality.
Proactively identify and suggest steps to remediate errors that may occur. Uncover root causes and work to rectify via process improvement.
Demonstrate understanding of relational database concepts and navigate within large and complex data
Ability to effectively assimilate, transform, and summarize complex datasets, and present appropriate findings for solutions. Reporting examples include: revenue reporting, expense reporting, staff planning, payables/receivables reporting, time/cost modelling
Coordinate with key stakeholder groups regarding their financial data needs, including Finance, Data/BI team, and Sales Operations. Aim to provide one consistent view of the truth as it pertains to financial reporting.
Strong communications skills, particularly for both technical and non-technical users will be key

Qualifications:
4+ years experience in similar roles
Bachelors degree in Finance, Computer Science, or similar quantitative analysis focus
Advanced proficiency in MS Excel (VBA) required; GSuite (Google Sheets) an asset
Intermediate proficiency with data visualization tools – Looker, PowerBI, Tableau
Intermediate proficiency with data analytics tools – Alteryx, Trifacta
Experience working with insurance brokerage policy and financial data a significant asset

We offer you

A competitive total rewards package, continuing education & training, and tremendous potential with a growing worldwide organization.

Our Colleague Experience:
From helping clients gain access to capital after natural disasters, to creating access to health care and retirement for millions, Aon colleagues empower results for our clients, communities, and each other every day. They make a difference, work with the best, own their potential, and value one another. This is the Aon Colleague Experience, defining what it means to work at Aon and realizing our vision of empowering human and economic possibility. To learn more visit Aon Colleague Experience .

About Aon:
Aon plc (NYSE: AON) is a leading global professional services firm providing a broad range of risk, retirement and health solutions. Our 50,000 colleagues in 120 countries empower results for clients by using proprietary data and analytics to deliver insights that reduce volatility and improve performance.

Aon provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, veteran, marital, or domestic partner status. Aon is committed to a diverse workforce and is an affirmative action employer.

Nothing in this job description restricts management's right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

For Canada Applicants: By applying for a position with Aon, you understand that, should you be made an offer, it will be contingent on your undergoing and successfully completing a background check consistent with Aon's employment policies. Background checks may include some or all of the following based on the nature of the position: SSN/SIN validation, education verification, employment verification, and criminal check, search against global sanctions and government watch lists, fingerprint verification, credit check, and/or drug test. You will be notified during the hiring process which checks are required by the position.

Aon is committed to a diverse workforce as an Employment Equity employer (Women, People with Disabilities, Aboriginal Peoples, and Visible Minorities). 2502306

Lead, Data Engineering at Data & Analytics
Global Asset Management.
Overview:
This is an opportunity within the Data & Analytics team at RBC Global Asset Management to spearhead the technology build that will enable self-serve analytics. As part of this group, the successful candidate will lead the development of the foundational data capabilities using cloud native technologies to drive data-as-a-service and launch AI-Platform-as-a-service.
As the successful candidate, you would lead a team of engineers to gather customer’s technical needs and the business drivers, synthesize it into a multi-quarter technical product roadmap and anticipate / manage expectations of stakeholders in the organization. You'll also be responsible for bringing in the best practices in data technologies pertaining to data engineering, ML, BI, governance from the field. In general, you are able to provide sound methods and identify key results to support strategic decisions. Ideally, you have to have excellent communication skills, and you should be able to work effectively and efficiently with everyone from fellow engineers to business executives.
What you will do:
Be a hands-on leader, and provide technical leadership & mentorship to fellow technical staff.
Play people manager role to lead a development team working as part of multiple squads
Help drive the data platform strategy for the firm that’s in-line with the data-as-a-service and self-serve analytics vision.
Work with the data leadership to create a common set of principles and patterns and standard set of technology frameworks and libraries for the data teams to use.
Drive DevOps/DataOps/MLOps by providing frameworks for data engineering teams to use to increase velocity and accuracy of deployments.
Provide technology guidance for automating the resolution of data integrity issues, & data governance for data.
Provide leadership across the architecture community to ensure solutions are built in alignment with platform principles and standards.
Apply design-thinking and agile mindset in working with various stakeholders to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on solutions that enable end-users to extract insights and value from data.
Explore new capabilities and technologies to drive innovation.
What you need:
10 years’ experience in a data driven organization with a focus on end to end medium/large scale project management
5 years of experience with deploying data engineering workloads on Hadoop or Cloud platforms
Hands-on experience with building and optimizing data pipelines in programming languages like Java, Scala or Python
Experience with leading data engineering projects and teams
Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift to run scalable workloads
In-depth understanding of Apache Spark architecture and working with HDFS/S3 FS
Experience with writing and optimizing SQL queries
Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships with key stakeholders be the liaison between technical and non-technical members.
Strong communication and influencing skills to drive implementation and adoption of technical solutions with business teams
Experience with data quality, data modeling, data observability and data classification techniques
Bonus points
ElasticSearch, Neo4j
Starburst Trino
Java Spring and MVC based web development concepts
Experience with event tracking
Building workload monitoring dashboards

This role can be based in either Mississauga, Canada or Penzberg, Germany.
Impact Healthcare
Roche Information Solutions (RIS) is developing innovative technologies that provide data-driven insights to help healthcare professionals make more informed decisions. Our cloud-based decision support portfolio helps navigate the challenges of oncology research and practice. Our solutions standardize and simplify individual steps in decision making and facilitate access to relevant data from diverse sources. Our goal is personalized healthcare - getting the right treatment to the right patient at the right time.
Make a Big Difference
Do have experience in creating RWD strategies for organizations? Do you want to leverage those skills to build robust RWD operations in our Digital Health group?
As a Manager of Real World Data (RWD) Domain, internally known as Data Steward, you will contribute to the Diagnostics Data Strategy by executing efforts leading to making RWD FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable). As an experienced RWD practitioner, you will be contributing to the RWD Domain foundations (included but not limited to: RWD Access and Governance, RWD Processes and Systems, RWD Compliance/Policies and RWD Knowledge) by leading, providing expertise or aiding to specific projects and initiatives as well supporting daily operations of the RWD activities in Diagnostics.
Reporting to the RWD Domain Team Lead, you will work closely with your peers - other RWD Domain Managers (Data Stewards), Diagnostics Data Office, key stakeholders across the entire DIA organization and other RWD teams in Roche Group.
Responsibilities:
Provide expertise and develop the RWD Domain foundations.
Identify key RWD stakeholders needs for RWD data and respective RWD sources to satisfy those needs (e.g. licensing, collaborations, spotlight projects).
In collaboration with Group RWD functions, negotiate with the data source owners to make most possible and complete RWD available.
Ensure contracting and proposals and protocols with collaborators follows internal requirements.
Make RWD findable - establish and maintain an RWD catalog.
Define access rules and manage access requests for the RWD assets.
Define, review and safeguard RWD domain-specific processes, and procedures for data maintenance (e.g., methods, standards) and data usage and applications to ensure the highest quality outcomes.
Define needs, identifying possible providers and/or managing development of the RWD analytics systems and technologies enabling faster and more efficient RWD analyses.
In collaboration with respective functions, co-create Diagnostics internal RWD policies and compliance processes.
Developing RWD domain training strategy and contributing to its implementation.
In collaboration with other RWD Group functions, develop and contribute to the Diagnostics RWD knowledge repository enabling users an efficient and fast access to the company’s RWD know how.
Contribute to an effective RWD communication.
Acting as role-model for Agile behaviors, as well as for our culture, mindset & behaviors as defined in We@RocheDiagnostics.
Who You Are
When you join us, you will have meaningful work as you help us to develop innovative technology that saves and improves lives around the world. As you collaborate with some of the best in the industry, you will make a huge difference in disease diagnostics! Our team is collaborative and fast-paced. And, we offer a competitive salary with a rich benefits package.
Requirements:
Master’s degree in Epidemiology, Public Health, Pharmacoepidemiology or similar areas of academic discipline
Minimum of 4 years hands-on RWD experience with demonstrated increase in responsibilities over time
Good understanding of the RWD environment and market trends
Practical experience with RWD operations as a user or a contributor
Good understanding of data privacy, governance and policies
Good understanding of data science and data technologies
Results-oriented, diligent and has a sense of urgency. Assertive, responsible for his own (self-directed) work, and is willing to commit to deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with a strong desire to work in multifunctional teams
Proven ability to operate effectively in a global, matrixed, cross-functional environment
Constructive problem solving mindset
Good knowledge of English in a business environment
Prior experience working in Diagnostics industry is a plus
Relocation benefits are available for this job posting.
Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.
As of January 4, 2022, Roche requires all new employees who work in Canada to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 on the date they take office. This requirement is a condition of employment at Roche that applies regardless of whether the position is on a Roche campus or remotely. If you have a valid reason for not being fully immunized, which is limited to certain specific medical reasons or other valid reasons protected by applicable human rights laws, you may request an exemption and / or adaptation measures regarding this vaccination requirement.
Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Job Level:
Individual contributor
