Ideally, you have to have excellent communication skills, and you should be able to work effectively and efficiently with everyone from fellow engineers to business executives.
What you will do:
Be a hands-on leader, and provide technical leadership & mentorship to fellow technical staff.
Play people manager role to lead a development team working as part of multiple squads
Help drive the data platform strategy for the firm that’s in-line with the data-as-a-service and self-serve analytics vision.
Work with the data leadership to create a common set of principles and patterns and standard set of technology frameworks and libraries for the data teams to use.
Drive DevOps/DataOps/MLOps by providing frameworks for data engineering teams to use to increase velocity and accuracy of deployments.
Provide technology guidance for automating the resolution of data integrity issues, & data governance for data.
Provide leadership across the architecture community to ensure solutions are built in alignment with platform principles and standards.
Apply design-thinking and agile mindset in working with various stakeholders to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on solutions that enable end-users to extract insights and value from data.
Explore new capabilities and technologies to drive innovation.
What you need:
10 years’ experience in a data driven organization with a focus on end to end medium/large scale project management
5 years of experience with deploying data engineering workloads on Hadoop or Cloud platforms
Hands-on experience with building and optimizing data pipelines in programming languages like Java, Scala or Python
Experience with leading data engineering projects and teams
Hands-on experience with Docker, Kubernetes/OpenShift to run scalable workloads
In-depth understanding of Apache Spark architecture and working with HDFS/S3 FS
Experience with writing and optimizing SQL queries
Demonstrated ability to build strong working relationships with key stakeholders be the liaison between technical and non-technical members.
Strong communication and influencing skills to drive implementation and adoption of technical solutions with business teams
Experience with data quality, data modeling, data observability and data classification techniques
Bonus points
ElasticSearch, Neo4j
Starburst Trino
Java Spring and MVC based web development concepts
Experience with event tracking
Building workload monitoring dashboards

This role can be based in either Mississauga, Canada or Penzberg, Germany.
Impact Healthcare
Roche Information Solutions (RIS) is developing innovative technologies that provide data-driven insights to help healthcare professionals make more informed decisions. Our cloud-based decision support portfolio helps navigate the challenges of oncology research and practice. Our solutions standardize and simplify individual steps in decision making and facilitate access to relevant data from diverse sources. Our goal is personalized healthcare - getting the right treatment to the right patient at the right time.
Make a Big Difference
Do have experience in creating RWD strategies for organizations? Do you want to leverage those skills to build robust RWD operations in our Digital Health group?
As a Manager of Real World Data (RWD) Domain, internally known as Data Steward, you will contribute to the Diagnostics Data Strategy by executing efforts leading to making RWD FAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable and Reusable). As an experienced RWD practitioner, you will be contributing to the RWD Domain foundations (included but not limited to: RWD Access and Governance, RWD Processes and Systems, RWD Compliance/Policies and RWD Knowledge) by leading, providing expertise or aiding to specific projects and initiatives as well supporting daily operations of the RWD activities in Diagnostics.
Reporting to the RWD Domain Team Lead, you will work closely with your peers - other RWD Domain Managers (Data Stewards), Diagnostics Data Office, key stakeholders across the entire DIA organization and other RWD teams in Roche Group.
Responsibilities:
Provide expertise and develop the RWD Domain foundations.
Identify key RWD stakeholders needs for RWD data and respective RWD sources to satisfy those needs (e.g. licensing, collaborations, spotlight projects).
In collaboration with Group RWD functions, negotiate with the data source owners to make most possible and complete RWD available.
Ensure contracting and proposals and protocols with collaborators follows internal requirements.
Make RWD findable - establish and maintain an RWD catalog.
Define access rules and manage access requests for the RWD assets.
Define, review and safeguard RWD domain-specific processes, and procedures for data maintenance (e.g., methods, standards) and data usage and applications to ensure the highest quality outcomes.
Define needs, identifying possible providers and/or managing development of the RWD analytics systems and technologies enabling faster and more efficient RWD analyses.
In collaboration with respective functions, co-create Diagnostics internal RWD policies and compliance processes.
Developing RWD domain training strategy and contributing to its implementation.
In collaboration with other RWD Group functions, develop and contribute to the Diagnostics RWD knowledge repository enabling users an efficient and fast access to the company’s RWD know how.
Contribute to an effective RWD communication.
Acting as role-model for Agile behaviors, as well as for our culture, mindset & behaviors as defined in We@RocheDiagnostics.
Who You Are
When you join us, you will have meaningful work as you help us to develop innovative technology that saves and improves lives around the world. As you collaborate with some of the best in the industry, you will make a huge difference in disease diagnostics! Our team is collaborative and fast-paced. And, we offer a competitive salary with a rich benefits package.
Requirements:
Master’s degree in Epidemiology, Public Health, Pharmacoepidemiology or similar areas of academic discipline
Minimum of 4 years hands-on RWD experience with demonstrated increase in responsibilities over time
Good understanding of the RWD environment and market trends
Practical experience with RWD operations as a user or a contributor
Good understanding of data privacy, governance and policies
Good understanding of data science and data technologies
Results-oriented, diligent and has a sense of urgency. Assertive, responsible for his own (self-directed) work, and is willing to commit to deadlines
Excellent written and verbal communication skills along with a strong desire to work in multifunctional teams
Proven ability to operate effectively in a global, matrixed, cross-functional environment
Constructive problem solving mindset
Good knowledge of English in a business environment
Prior experience working in Diagnostics industry is a plus
Relocation benefits are available for this job posting.
Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.

We're looking for an Associate Product Manager to join our team Data Engineering and Data Operations teams in Montreal, Quebec. You will help define and execute the vision for Big Data at Lightspeed.

Scope deliverables with customers and prioritize backlog for Data Engineering and Data Operations teams
Communicate progress on key initiatives to senior stakeholders and customers
Coordinate delivery across multiple teams to minimize delays

We're a team of eleven people located in Montreal, Canada. Our team is responsible for Lightspeed's Big Data infrastructure that powers our reporting and products.

Understanding of the needs for Big Data of a tech focused organization
Scoping and organizing requests from customers and communicating back progress

Ability to do your job in a truly flexible environment;
Genuine career opportunities in a company that's creating new jobs everyday;
Work in a team big enough for growth but lean enough to make a real impact.


… and enjoy a range of benefits that'll keep you happy, healthy and (not) hungry:

Lightspeed share scheme (we are all owners)

To all recruitment agencies: Lightspeed does not accept unsolicited agency resumes. If we have not directly engaged your company in writing to supply candidates for a specific vacancy, Lightspeed will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Where to from here?
Obviously, this has to be mutually beneficial: we want you to step into a role you love, and we want to offer you a place you're proud to come to every day. For a glimpse into our world check out our career page here.

Lightspeed is building communities through commerce, and we need people from all backgrounds and lived experiences to do that. We were founded in 2005, in Montreal's gay village and our original members were all part of the LGBTQ+ community. The ethos of our business has been about inclusion from the very beginning, and we strive to provide a workplace where everyone belongs.

Who we are:

Lightspeed (TSX/NYSE: LSPD) powers the businesses that are the backbone of the global economy.

Our one-stop commerce platform transforms and unifies digital and physical operations by enabling multichannel sales, expansion to new locations, global payments, financial solutions and connection to supplier networks. With the Lightspeed commerce platform, merchants in retail and hospitality can build thriving businesses for the future.

Headquartered in Montréal, Canada, Lightspeed is trusted by favourite local businesses, where the community goes to shop and dine in over 100 countries. Lightspeed has offices in Canada, the USA, Europe, Russia and APAC.

We're passionate about enabling people to do their best work. We dream big and we're looking for people who do the same. With us, career milestones happen often and we celebrate every one. Come work with us and find out where your career will take you at Lightspeed!

AT ADIDAS WE HAVE A WINNING CULTURE. BUT TO WIN, PHYSICAL POWER IS NOT ENOUGH. JUST LIKE ATHLETES OUR EMPLOYEES NEED MENTAL STRENGTH IN THEIR GAME. WE FOSTER THE ATHLETE‘S MINDSET THROUGH A SET OF BEHAVIORS THAT WE WANT TO ENABLE AND DEVELOP IN OUR PEOPLE AND THAT ARE AT THE CORE OF OUR UNIQUE COMPANY CULTURE – THE 3CS: CONFIDENCE, COLLABORATION AND CREATIVITY.
CONFIDENCE allows athletes to make quick decisions on the field, to reach higher. For us at adidas confidence means acknowledging that we don’t have all the answers. But we are willing to take risks, we try new things. And if we fail, then this is part of our learning – it helps us improve.
COLLABORATION. Every elite athlete relies on partners: coaches, teammates, and nutritionists. We, too, know that we are stronger together. Winning as one team takes open and candid dialogue, inclusiveness and trust in each other’s abilities and talents.
Being the best sports company in the world takes CREATIVITY. No great athlete succeeds by copying their predecessors’ training plans and strategies. We have to be open to new ideas, explore, gain an edge and stand out. Only then can we succeed.
ADIDAS CELEBRATES DIVERSITY, SUPPORTS INCLUSIVENESS AND ENCOURAGES INDIVIDUAL EXPRESSION IN OUR WORKPLACE. WE DO NOT TOLERATE THE HARASSMENT OR DISCRIMINATION TOWARD ANY OF OUR APPLICANTS OR EMPLOYEES. WE ARE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER.

About the Company
At Slate Technologies we are bringing fresh minds and tools to the world of Smart Buildings, Smart Infrastructure, Sustainability, architecture, and construction. With a credible team from world renowned institutions, we are leading the way in transforming the way buildings and Infrastructure comes to life.
Better decisions happen in construction when you have better context, without context stakeholders are unable to see the right information, at the right time to make confident and quick choices. That's why we created Slate, a Virtual Digital Assistant that helps you identify and evaluate information in your business so that you can make better decisions, save time and money and improve project outcomes.
Our mission at Slate is to help improve each construction professional impact construction productivity by revealing the timely context that helps them make earlier, better decisions. Slate’s “Digital Assistant'' uses machine learning and AI to execute multi-dimensional analysis across internal and external data sources. This includes public data such as weather, labor and traffic with the dark data locked in silos and non-integrated systems within their own and sub-contractor organizations.
Want to join us on this incredible journey?
Location: California, San Francisco Bay Area or Toronto, Ontario Canada
Essential Duties & Responsibilities
Create and own the data product strategies and data acquisition roadmap for our Slate product.
Work with our Data Science team to craft appropriates data models and schemas.
Collaborate with data stakeholders to create access layers to our data, via service APIs, and to enable surfacing data to internal consumers.
Define data governance that includes maintaining quality of data, implementation of access control, support security efforts and facilitate end-user consumption.
Collaborate with product, engineering, design, and data science teams to gather feedback and requirements. Break down work into releases for users, and shipping software regularly.
Monitor and revise artifacts in support of product development: product requirements, process maps, use cases, user acceptance test plans, project plans, and release notes.
Serve as the internal and external subject matter expert for data product offerings, working with Engineering, Sales, Customer Success and Customer Support groups.
Maximize efficiency in a constantly evolving environment where the process is fluid and creative solutions are the norm.
Required Experience/Skills
Demonstrated experience with data-informed product development, user-centered design, and agile/lean methodologies.
Experience actively working on or developing experiences for data science workflows.
Data fluent, with the ability to dive deep into large, raw datasets to find key information that will enable you to make decisions for your product.
Proficient with data analytics tools such as Python, HTML5/CSS, API interactions.
Thrive when inspiring engineering teams and building partnerships in a cross functional space, able to drive initiatives beyond the scope of your team.
Love to help your team prioritize and you are adept at communicating that priority outwards.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience with defining technical specifications describing requirements for data transfer, transformation, and storage, with attention to big data topics.
Strong analytic and quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions, recommendations, and drive actions.
Technically competent to influence and understand the data solution context & approach and aid engineering in estimating the complexity of work being requested.
If this sounds like you, you should apply right away so we can discuss how you can be a part of this exciting, fast-paced organization!
Slate Technologies, Inc is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Company Description
This is a remote role, employees are welcome to work near any of our principal location hubs: Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, Dallas and NYC.
SSENSE (pronounced [es-uhns]) is a global technology platform operating at the intersection of culture, community, and commerce. Headquartered in Montreal, it features a mix of established and emerging luxury brands across womenswear, menswear, kidswear, and Everything Else™.
SSENSE has garnered critical acclaim as both an e-commerce engine and a producer of cultural content, generating an average of 100 million monthly page views. Approximately 80% of its audience is between the ages of 18 to 40. It is privately held and has achieved high double digit annual growth and profitability since its inception.

Job Description
As an integral part of the Data Science team, the Senior Manager, Data Science will play a key role in our fast growing organization, helping us discover and generate material value from data. The primary focus will be on applying data mining & machine learning techniques to identify business opportunities and build high quality decision support tools & decision making systems. He/She/Them will challenge processes to make smarter decisions while advocating and evangelizing data-fuelled models to support our success.
The ideal candidate demonstrates a strong passion for producing new, creative and leading-edge solutions through all aspects of the data science product life cycle, including productionalization of developed solutions. As a Senior Manager, the candidate will play the role of multi-domain leader & company scientist expert (both as an individual contributor and as a team leader, on the technical strategic direction and on the business project management side).
The Senior Manager will develop high level understanding and become a subject matter expert in the fields and teams that the candidate will be directly overseeing. He/She/Them could be brought to contribute directly or indirectly in multiple fields including pricing, buying intelligence, customer knowledge, recommendation / personalization, marketing and customer.
In Pricing, the candidate will create, develop, support and execute pricing strategies to ensure our competitiveness and extract the most value from our inventory. He/She/Them will be responsible for the performance of markdowns (strategy, execution and monitoring) and contribute to performance pricing initiatives (outside of markdown periods).
Become the company subject matter expert in the field of pricing
Oversee a team of data scientists focused on the pricing topic (machine learning model building, data pipelines and process development) leading to the development of complete pricing solutions
Develop and execute the pricing roadmap (identify opportunities, be aware of business model changes that would require to update the strategies)
Build optimization strategies for different types of product groups (different objectives, constraints, etc)
Have a hands on approach and be fully accountable for markdowns operations and performance
Understand the pricing backend, data structure and technical processes in order to be able to identify upfront challenges and the impact of their changes on pricing models & processes
Interact with the technical teams to have the right tools in place to adapt to our growth
Partner with the internal stakeholders on pricing and pricing related topics

Qualifications
Advise with and elevate a team of world class data scientists, providing leadership through consulting and coaching on a regular basis
Manage & guide data scientists into providing data driven solutions partnering with strategic business stakeholders
Identify and lead data science projects that drive material business value and align with the strategic positioning of the department and of SSENSE
Develop partnership & guidance with the other departments (technical & business) to establish and deliver cross-functional projects
Gather and analyze data, identify key prediction/classification problems, devise solutions and build prototypes
Formulate machine learning approaches while paying attention to business metrics
Design features from the rich data available from many sources, training, evaluating, and deploying models
Develop high-performance algorithms to answer business needs
Test, implement and deploy algorithms while understanding and resolving dependencies across systems
Identify and solve for broad, highly complex problems based on a multitude of factors
Design experiments to maximize insights while minimizing errors
Enhance data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems
Process, cleanse, and verify the integrity of data used for analysis
Evangelize best practices for data synthesization, aggregation, and presentation
Remain abreast of cutting edge developments in the Data Science domain to enhance current practices and upskill team members
Additional Information
WORLD CLASS TECHNOLOGY
Technology is at the core of everything we do at SSENSE. Driven by an engineering mindset and a problem-solving attitude, we blend fashion with technology to deliver an unparalleled experience to our customers as we build seamless, custom solutions to deliver the SSENSE offering.
WORLD CLASS TEAM
The SSENSE tech team is responsible for an international headless commerce platform. Working in an agile environment, our squads are made up of experienced innovators in Product Management, QA, Design, DevOps, Software Development, Machine Learning, Data Engineering, and Security. Headquartered in Montreal, our technology organization has been growing at a rate of 2X year-over-year and is doubling once again in 2021 as we expand across Canada, US, and Europe.
WORLD CLASS PLATFORM
The SSENSE platform runs on Amazon Web Services making use of serverless microservices across web, mobile and app. Our event-source architecture already achieves over 10,000 requests / second and growing at an unmatched pace, currently unseen across the industry. Our data-driven culture of innovation empowers every product team across the tech organization to explore building, testing and learning with the latest in Machine Learning techniques. Our automated continuous improvement DevOps model (making use of both blue / green and canary deployments) results in an average of 50 production releases every day.
Read more about us on our SSENSE Tech Blog.

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose of Job:
As a member of the Global Retail Provisions Reporting & Planning team, contributes to the overall success of the Global Retail Provisions team who are accountable for establishing prudent levels of loan loss allowances (ACL) for the Retail International and Canadian portfolios and Canadian Small Business portfolios.
The incumbent will be responsible for the leading the implementation & automation for new forecasting and planning capabilities for Retail Provisions Losses.
Job Responsibilities:
Lead implementation & automation for new forecasting & planning capabilities for Retail Provision Losses.
Design improvements in the preparation of Forecast and Planning processes for both ACL and Provision for Credit Losses for Global Retail portfolios.
Design, develop and implement of financial risk management provision forecast reports across the provision metrics and products on end-to-end work flow solution along with ETL process, database solutions, Program coding and Data visualization tools.
Support the design and maintenance to the Global Provisions database to assist in the preparation of the Provisions reporting framework.
Lead the consolidation and aggregation of Global Retail Provisions metrics for both Actuals, Plan and Forecast metrics, establishing controls that are aligned with the Bank’s end user control (EUC) directive.
Maintains a high-level of customer service and satisfaction that is consistent with Global Risk Management – Retail Credit Risk and Scotiabank service standards.
Knowledgeable on provision methodology and IFRS9 accounting standard.
Job Requirements:
Previous experience in consumer Retail Risk analytics such as predictive analytics and data mining.
Prior loan loss provision and financial modelling would be an asset.
Integrity, high attention to detail, thoroughness and accuracy are critical to ensure quality outputs.
Good interpersonal and communication skills are essential in dealing with many senior internal and external stakeholders, as well as preparing reports for Executive Management.
Good knowledge of SAS, SQL, PowerBI, Excel and database would be an asset.
Solid organizational and time management skills to manage competing activities within short time frames.
An undergraduate degree in a quantitative subject (economics/accounting/Finance/statistics). A professional designation (such as CFA, CMA or CA) would be considered a plus.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Working with us means being part of a team of talented, passionate individuals with a shared focus on working together to deliver great customer experiences. Driven by the mission to democratize education, Paper is the largest provider of educational support, supporting millions of students through partnerships with thousands of school districts. Paper helps deliver true educational equity through their category leading Educational Support System (ESS) that offers virtual access to 24/7 tutors and essay reviewers. Founded in 2014, Paper philosophically believes that all students should be given the tools and resources to reach their academic potential, independent of socio-economic status, geography, language or other barriers. We are headquartered in Montreal, Quebec with remote employees across the US and Canada. Paper is proud to have been named by GSV as one of the most transformational growth companies in digital learning.
About the role:

We are looking for a Manager of Reporting & Analytics who will be instrumental in developing a world class team of report developers. The ideal candidate is already a master of dashboard and report design and loves to mentor and coach others to achieve the same level of expertise.


You'll partner with business stakeholders to develop and execute a roadmap of reporting assets with a focus on repeatability, flexibility and scalability. Along with managerial duties, you will be expected to also work on projects directly.

To succeed in this role, you should love both partnering with leaders across the business to execute our overall reporting vision as well as coaching your team to execute at their highest caliber.

Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain an ecosystem of dashboards, data sources and data definitions material that is focused on accuracy, transparency and ease of use.
Lead a team of talented report developers with a focus on coaching and mentorship.
Work with other analytics leaders to ensure consistency in approach across various reporting work streams.
Empower business stakeholders to make timely business decisions based on data by making insights readily available.
Manage and delegate inbound analytics requests for your team with a strict adherence to expected delivery timelines.
You will be leading a growing team so you'll be expected to work on larger projects directly.

Qualifications:

2-3 Years experience directly managing or mentoring data analysts/bi developers.
High level of Tableau expertise or similar BI visualization tool with 6-8 years experience building and maintaining a cohesive reporting ecosystem.
A mastery of dashboard design; ability to take very complex data questions and display them in intuitive visual dashboards for non-technical users.
Proven track record of effectively managing an analytics team or mentoring team members in a lead capacity.
High level of proficiency writing SQL with expertise in query optimization and efficiency for large data pulls.
Advanced verbal, written and visual communication skills - both in the design and rollout of reporting assets and providing clear direction to your team.

About Paper

Paper offers an exciting, dynamic, inclusive work environment putting excellence at the center of everything we do. Our mission is woven into the fabric of our culture, challenging our team to build meaningful and creative solutions.

We thrive when we collaborate with each other, and use integrity and selflessness to align our business decisions with our mission. We approach every challenge with positivity, achieving the outcome we want regardless of what gets in the way. Our tenacity propels our hyper-growth, where trust is key and we all strive to make an impact every day.

We believe that diverse teams build better products. Paper does not and will not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender orientation, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status in any of its activities or operations.

job_description:
About AstraZeneca
At AstraZeneca, we 're dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and ignite your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration. Always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development.
AstraZeneca in Canada
Headquartered in Mississauga, Ontario, we’ve been recognized as one of Greater Toronto Area’s Top Employers for 8 straight years. Our collaborative work environment champions knowledge-sharing, decision-making, and entrepreneurial thinking. Our employees work across teams, functions, and even the globe. With a commitment to sustainability, we’re working towards making a positive impact where society needs it — health. We know the health of people, the planet and our business are interconnected, each impacting the others.
Our position
Are you insatiably curious about what drives a business to be successful? Are you a data wizard, a thought provoker who can credibly translate information about products and customers to build strategic insights? Do you have a customer focus and strive to assess and meet the needs of various business partners? Do you possess an ability to influence senior decision makers on key decisions and opportunities? Are you driven to impact how customer and product strategies are executed?
Reporting into the Sr. Manager, Performance and Digital Analytics, you will be an integral partner to cross-functional teams working across therapeutic areas and business units. You will work closely with therapeutic area aligned Analytics and Insights Manager(s) to deliver the insights, analytics and reporting needs of the organization.
Joining AZ Canada, you will have the opportunity to stretch your skills and apply your expertise to a rapidly growing business. You will have the opportunity to influence and drive growth across multiple disease areas and brands, including the enablement and optimization of omni-channel experiences. Through these experiences, you can deepen your skillset through modern techniques applied to wide-range of data including customer segmentation, sales and prescription data.
You will have responsibility to:
Actively analyze customer, competitor and product information and provide recommendations to brand teams, sales and business unit leadership
Communicate and influence strategic input into portfolio planning and optimization of resources across the portfolio, including creative simulations for various scenarios
Working across Commercial, Marketing, Medical (MSL, CSL), Dx, Patient, IT Teams to influence strategic initiatives through analysis of diverse types of data
Shape development of customer segmentation and patient share models to generate inputs for sales targeting strategies and execution plans
Facilitate the annual sales quota setting, in collaboration with the forecasting team, and incentive payout process
Ability to lead change and adoption through business strategies and process transformations
Drive implementation of advanced analytic models and outputs to enhance customer engagement effectiveness and business outcomes
Create data-driven recommendations through robust analysis across branded OMNI-channel experiences to drive impact and optimization of digital engagement strategies.
Deliver monthly reports, ad-hoc analysis and recommendations for all products in business portfolio
Measure execution of therapeutic area strategy against key performance indicators
Partner with Marketing and Sales to generate insights and reports to drive the strategic direction
Partner with other cross-functional teams, including the Data Capabilities, Advanced Analytics, and IT, to design and implement new business capabilities
Your qualifications include:
2+ years pharmaceutical experience (preferred) and / or University degree or equivalent experience in science and/or business (Pharmaceutical sales experience is an asset)
Intimate understanding and working knowledge of IQVIA & Patient Support Program data sets is an asset
Strong analytical mind-set and proven ability with analytics (e.g. Excel, Python, SQL, and/or R) and business intelligence solution (e.g. Power BI, MicroStrategy, and/or Tableau)
Strong communication and presentation skills, including proficiency with PowerPoint or similar
Strong strategic thinking/planning skills to create business value through dashboard and report creation.
Strong ability to build relationships including demonstrated history of successful collaboration and partnership
Great People want to Work with us! Find out why:
GTAA Top Employer Award for 7 years:https://reviews.canadastop100.com/top-employer-astrazeneca-canada
Best Workplace Culture Award at the 2018 Canadian HR Awards:https://www.linkedin.com/pulse/thriving-best-workplace-culture-gena-restivo/
Browse AstraZeneca's YouTube channel to find out more about us:https://www.youtube.com/user/astrazeneca
Are you interested in working at AZ, apply today!
AstraZeneca is committed to taking every reasonable precaution to protect employees, our customers and the healthcare systems in the communities in which we serve. In an effort to protect the wellbeing of our employees and customers, full COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement of all positions at AstraZeneca. As such, all offers of employment will be conditional upon either (i) proof of full COVID-19 vaccination or (ii) proof of need for accommodation under relevant human rights legislation, and AstraZeneca’s determination that the requested accommodation can be provided without undue hardship. You will be required to submit proof of full vaccination or proof of need for accommodation during our background screening process.
AstraZeneca is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion and providing a workplace that is free from discrimination. AstraZeneca is committed to accommodating persons with disabilities. Such accommodation is available on request in respect of all aspects of the recruitment, assessment and selection process and may be requested by emailing AZCHumanResources@astrazeneca.com.

RBC Ventures is a new kind of business – one that marries the strength of one of the world’s most trusted and successful financial institutions with a mission to reimagine the role we play in people’s lives – to move RBC ‘beyond banking’. We’re building a world-class organization focused on designing exceptional experiences, exploring new business models and creating exponential value. In 2020, we were named by Fast Company as one of the 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators and we’re looking for team members with the curiosity to explore, the capabilities to build and capacity to help us deliver our missionAbout OwnrAt Ownr, we have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. We're on a mission to become the leading platform for entrepreneurship in Canada, and it takes an entire team to build something big. So join our team and discover how we can help entrepreneurs make their dreams a reality.What is the opportunity?Ownr is seeking a talented, experienced and passionate Product Manager focused on customer insights, Data & Analytics to join our growing team. In this role you will work across the business to support and manage the execution of data-related products and projects to help drive our customer understanding and cross-functional capabilities. We are looking for vocal futurists who have a passion for technology and are inspired by the idea of bringing to life product roadmaps that benefit hundreds of thousands of people at a key milestone in their lives.What you will do· Help set the product vision and strategy for data, analytics, and customer insights· Own the translation of business requirements, you will execute to deliver solutions that expand our data and analytics capabilities across multiple portfolios.· Design and conduct analyses using various techniques (developing frameworks, building dashboards, segmentation, modelling) to provide value for the stakeholders you support.· Responsible for creating and managing quality data products, processes and services to ensure growth and achievement of our business goals.· Understand our key drivers, customer use cases, and full user flow impact across all platforms.· Create, manage, and maintain KPI's to monitor, analyze and improve conversion· Lead the product planning and development process through backlog grooming, refinement, and prioritization activities· Define and detail User Stories and prioritize team backlogs in accordance to our business drivers.· Evaluate and document the requirements for each product feature, articulate these requirements, answer questions and make scope trade-off decisions as needed.· Ensure optimal delivery by removing barriers and obstacles that impact performance and develop contingency plans to demonstrate adaptability while supporting continuous learning.· Bridge technical, business and creative worlds, engaging with matrixed teams including development, UX/UI design, copy, legal, risk and compliance, creating a collaborative environment while maximizing on business return.· Drive internal stakeholders and cross-functional business unit engagements necessary for an optimal on-time launch.· Focus on backend functionality as well as user-facing features that make world-class user engaging platforms.Skills you'll need to succeedMust have· Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience in an analytical function (e.g. Business Analytics, Consulting).· Experience working as a Product Manager in a SaaS environment.· Proven work experience in data product management (growth-stage company experience a plus) and working with agile teams and organizations.· Experience translating business requirements to actionable software solutions.· In-depth knowledge of agile processes and principles, with the ability to provide direction to the agile team and stakeholders throughout.· Extensive experience developing use cases, epics and stories in a clear and concise manner, enabling the engineering team to deliver maximum productivity and value· Experience maintaining and prioritizing the backlog in accordance to business and technology drivers.· Experience in the planning of product releases and setting expectations for delivery of new functionality.· A Proven ability to make hard decisions in a fast-paced environment, while actively identifying and mitigating issues that have an impact on successful completion of goals.· Ability to speak to business functions, customers and partners with confidence and professionalism.· Commitment to winning as a team.· An entrepreneurial & innovative spiritNice to have· Experience with the development process, use of tools like GitHub· Experience using analytics tools such as: SQL, Amplitude, and MetabaseWhat’s in it for you?We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.· A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable· Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities· Ability to make a difference and lasting impact· Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team· A world-class training program in financial services· Flexible work/life balance optionsLaunching and running a business can be daunting. But, at Ownr, we bring entrepreneurs closer to their dreams.We have helped thousands of Canadians establish their businesses. As we redefine the entrepreneurship landscape, we take pride in simplifying what it takes to be a business owner. Our industry-leading tools, resources, and ongoing support make it as easy as possible for entrepreneurs to start and succeed.VSPRODUCTRBC VenturesRBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.Job Type: Full-timeSchedule:Day shiftWork remotely:No

job_description:
FoodX is growing, and we're looking for an Operations Analytics Manager to join our fully-remote team (from ANYWHERE in Canada)!


The Operations Analytics Manager leads a team of passionate creators, investigators and innovators. They have exceptional attention to detail and understand that continuous improvements, however small, are key to our client’s ability to provide industry-leading customer experiences. This is a tech-savvy individual, who is comfortable operating in multiple different virtual environments. They understand their audience of business leaders, operators, people leaders & logisticians, curating focused solutions for each stakeholder to drive optimal performance.
FoodX is a subsidiary of Freshlocal Solutions (TSX: LOCL); a Vancouver-based leader in end-to-end grocery e-commerce solutions. Our mission is to leverage innovation and technology to create a sustainable and profitable food system for all. We have developed deep expertise across the farm-to-fork value chain, both digitally and physically. Combined with explosive growth in the industry, plus having gone public in 2021, our business is at an exciting stage of our growth!
Responsibilities:

Lead with positivity and empathy, while ensuring that team members respect their peers and the requirements of their positions.
Engage and develop your direct team through coaching, support, and regular feedback.
Data analysis and interpretation.
Development, execution, and distribution of operational reporting using analytical tools.
Communicating with partners on requests, insights, and tools.
Problem Solving & Investigation.
Work closely with management and executives to improve KPIs.
Innovate on operational processes and reporting tools.
Managing resources for multiple projects and sites on an ongoing basis.
Travel to launch sites to monitor site health and required adjustments.
Interdepartmental communication.
Assist with site design by providing analysis of proper inventory allocation and traffic.
Support the VP Global Solutions and other executive and organizational leaders in achieving primary organizational objectives.
Foster a culture of Creating Amazing Experiences, for all stakeholders.
Seek out and engage in opportunities to further personal leadership development.
Embrace and embody Food-X’s Core Values.
Other duties as assigned.
Sherlock Holmes-level detective skills
Strong verbal and written communication skills
Strong Interpersonal Skills as this role requires inter-department and inter-company communication
Advanced Microsoft Excel Skills
Advanced knowledge of analytical tools (Microsoft PowerBI, Tableau, Google Data Studio…)
Ability to extract data using Microsoft SQL
Knowledge of database function, interaction, and utilization
Extreme attention to detail
Ability to work in a team environment
Availability to travel
Background in warehouse operations is a plus
What's in it for you?

Join now and receive an initial $250.00 of SPUD credit, and another $250.00 of SPUD credit after six months of employment ($500.00 total)
20% discount on SPUD.CA purchases
Flexible health spending plan options and benefits available for all team members working more than 14 hours per week
FoodX's approach to inclusive hiring

Our team is committed to building relationships rooted in trust, integrity and respect. We believe in a growth mindset and support our team members' personal and professional growth in a safe work environment. We know from experience that great talent comes in many forms and we want to meet you at your best. Please let us know if we can provide unique accommodations that will enable your equal participation!
Our Values

Our values are more than just words to us. Our values drive our success and guide our growth:

Create amazing customer experiences. We are passionate in our commitment to deliver for our customers.
Lead with sustainability and consider our impact.
Learn, grow and make time to celebrate wins together
We welcome different perspectives. Diversity makes us stronger.
Prioritize, work smart and deliver results for our stakeholders and each other.
We are committed to our mission and that requires resilience, persistence and grit to persevere and succeed.

Engineering Manager - Data
About Viamo
Mobile technology is revolutionizing how organizations engage with their end users. More than 96% of the world's population has access to a mobile phone, meaning it is now possible to reach nearly every single person on the planet. Yet 3 billion people living in emerging markets still lack access to relevant, timely, and engaging information in their local languages, and their voices remain underheard. The organizations that serve them lack the technology and capacity to reach them, and many are unaware of the power of mobile technology to meet their organizational goals.
Viamo connects individuals and organizations using digital technology to make better decisions.
With more than 30 million people reached in 2020 alone, we are well on our way to meeting our goal of reaching 50 million people annually by 2023.
About the role
Viamo's services deliver essential life-improving information to millions of people per month in 30+ countries around the world, and connect companies and organizations to have stronger relationships with the hard-to-reach customers they serve. Our technology teams work within empowered Product Crews to create the communication products that make this happen. As an Engineering Manager and chapter lead for Data, your job is to lead and grow the people, tools, and systems in all Crews for maximum effectiveness in storing, structuring, harnessing, securing, and extracting insights from data - now and for the long-term.
About You
Note: Did you know that?
HR research shows that men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, but women and other under-represented people often apply only if they feel they check 100% of the requirements. We would love to see your application even if you don't feel you hit every point below.
Are you an engineering manager with strong experience in data systems? Are you passionate about creating technology to improve lives at fundamental level around the world, while growing people and building strong teams? We're looking for someone who has:
Experience managing and growing software developers and data analysts
Experience planning and supporting professional development / learning programs
Substantial knowledge of diverse database systems and database architectures.
Experience leading and reviewing data architecture and problem-solving in new product development
Ability to advise, discuss and clearly document complex technical concepts
Experience with continuous integration (CI) strategies, tools, and pipeline automation
Focused on achieving technical excellence and improvements, while focussing on customer value
Extensive experience working in agile teams and practices
Knowledge of SQL, Google BigQuery, Redis, and relevant cloud-scale data technologies.
Experience and judgement on effective testing strategies
Invested in supporting your team members, and creating respectful high-trust collaborations
Key Responsibilities
Professional growth of engineers: You will be the most senior person responsible for the people management and professional development of engineers and analysts in the Data Chapter. This includes their technical learning and advancement, as well as professional and teamwork skills. (Note: the Data Chapter is new for us. There are few current Data Engineers, but this is a hiring area for us.)
Architecture effectiveness: As an expert on data systems, you would be responsible for the effectiveness of architecture choices on new product development, and upgrades to existing systems. Rather than creating architecture exclusively by yourself, we're counting on you to enable "distributed architecture" by mentoring and building this skill set within Engineering Leads and other developers within Product Crews.
Engineering Roadmap strategy: Working with your Data Chapter, you would be responsible for curating and prioritizing the backlog for the Engineering Roadmap. (We target 30% of total developer time on Engineering Roadmap items: boosting future capacity, library upgrades, addressing tech debt, next-generation data technologies, etc.)
Growing the team: You would be the hiring manager, responsible for the effective selection and onboarding strategy for new Data Engineers.
Driving innovation: Propose ideas to leverage advanced data usage, machine learning and AI elements to increase value for users.
Team and Reporting Structure
Reports to Viamo's Chief Technology Officer
Line manages Data Engineering team
Location
Remote work possible
Ideally between GMT-7 to GMT+2
Profile
Required
Over 5 years of experience working as a data engineer/data architect
Experience managing other engineers
Experience of being part of a tech leadership team
Experience working remotely
An expert understanding of database systems and technologies
Experience of working with a data warehouse solution
Experience using ETL tools
Expertise in database management languages (MySQL, BigQuery Standard SQL, etc)
Strong technical problem solving skills, proven ability to troubleshoot and debug
Strong communication skills with technical and non-technical team members
A proven ability to systematically approach tasks and to manage multiple, at times changing priorities and expectations
A passion for helping people in emerging markets through technology
Experience working with user engagement data
The Technology
Our current stack makes use of:
PHP 7.4
Laravel
REST and GraphQL APIs
Asynchronous queue processing, currently using RabbitMQ
Various pipelines for CI and testing
Open-source telephony systems
An open-source middleware we developed in Go (Golang) to interface with telecom systems under a web application paradigm.
AWS EC2 combined with bare-metal servers deployed in data centers with telecoms around the world.
As we grow our platform strategy, we are open to introducing new technologies needed to scale and serve 30M users with benefits, and connect them to services from platform partners.
Viamo is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity and encourage applications from all candidates. We believe that diverse perspectives help our teams to create innovative solutions and understand our global clients' needs. In alignment with our values, we are committed to recruiting and retaining a diverse global workforce without discrimination.
Apply now with a CV and a short cover letter

job_title: Manager, Business Data Operations - Global Compliance

job_description:
Join us in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC advances a culture that helps everyone to thrive. It's one of the reasons we're recognized as a "Top Company" to work for in Canada. As you ignite a meaningful career and build a network that’ll last for life, you'll work with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to help solve important problems, empowered by technology to turn today's ideas into tomorrow's solutions. We cultivate an environment in which our differences are embraced and our people feel comfortable bringing their whole selves to work. An empowering and diverse environment starts with you. Are you ready to get started?
A career in Products and Technology would provide you the opportunity to be part of an organization that is building a leading tech experience that solves big challenges for our firm and our clients. Our products and tech-driven solutions are how we move faster, cut through complexity and fuel growth. We start with the problem and solve it with experience and tech know-how. Our skilled technologists, data scientists, product managers and business strategists are passionate about using technology to accelerate change.

Our external facing team focuses on the process of collecting, cleansing, transforming, designing and modeling data for the purposes of drawing critical insights and conclusions that support decision making. This team designs and develops data science, machine learning, natural language processing and related solutions to address business needs. They assist in the management and delivery of large data science projects, work with a wide range of automation teams to validate findings and proposed analytics solutions for our clients.

Reporting to the Strategy Leader, the Data Strategy Lead will act as a strategic advisor, providing best-in-class guidance, expertise and direction over our firm’s data products and data technology strategies. This role will lead the area that provides strategic support and delivery to our internal clients regarding data products and data management, as well as the business execution of work streams associated with their stakeholders’ Digital Transformation and Products & Technology agenda. The Director, Data Strategy will have insight into all active (and prioritized) digital initiatives within our data-related business unit, the Data Digital Transformation Team (henceforth referred to as ‘Data DXT’).


This role will be responsible for driving the Data DXT’s digital strategy, inclusive of prioritizing their digital transformation initiatives, ensuring the firm’s top data technology priorities are strategized and resourced against at speed, and acting as both a single point of contact and a subject matter expert of data strategy, opportunities and initiatives for the firm and the Data DXT. The Data DXT initiatives can result in new technology build, import, procurement, and alliance opportunities for the firm.
Important point(s) to consider
Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.
What you’ll create and do
As a Senior Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Data Strategy & Delivery (60%)
Continuously develop and stay up-to-date on all digital transformation related knowledge about the Data DXT and their business - both internally and externally - to become the subject matter expert for data strategy and management
Ensure firmwide alignment of how we source, manage, protect and unlock value from data across the firm, ensuring all digital transformation initiatives related to Data are prioritized appropriately at the Data DXT level
Provide advice, expertise, and guidance on end-to-end data management and data use, and develop a strong understanding of the entire PwC portfolio of data products and technology to drive organizational coherence
Lead a team of dedicated specialists with the capacity to execute on the Data DXT’s prioritized initiatives, including data-specific Digital Strategists, Global Associates, and/or Product Managers, ensuring we deliver a consistent client data and analytics experience while fulfilling gaps in how we govern and do more with data
Research emerging technologies and develop an understanding of market best practices and technology strategies related to data
Manage the Data DXT’s full funnel of digital transformation initiatives (both active and future initiatives) and lead in the prioritization of work streams needed to accomplish said initiatives
Support and lead in the decisions and tactics needed to execute on any given Data-related Digital Transformation initiatives (imports, alliances, new builds)
Own the production of DXO (Digital Transformation Office) insights and reporting metrics for continuous improvement in relation to our firm’s data strategy and management
Relationship Management (20%)
Consult the charge on the firm’s data strategy, connecting the LoS’ in data efforts at the Data DXT, and help to create a data-oriented culture at PwC Canada by engaging the right stakeholders and ensuring their strategic data needs are met at speed
Lead and train a team of professionals who are dedicated to demystifying data and empowering teams with the right knowledge and tools to leverage data to make informed decisions and solve client problems
Act as a single point of contact between the Data DXT and the Products & Technology organization, providing them with best-in-class technology strategy services
Monitor and ensure the success of all analyses and execution of digital transformation and data initiatives on behalf of the Data DXT
Continuously maintain and communicate knowledge of resourcing capacity and align teams against prioritized initiatives at speed, conversing cross-functionally through the entire P&T org
Leadership & Operations (20%)
Develop and support in the execution of KPIs that align to firm strategy
Contribute, alongside other Strategy team leaders, in the analysis of operating data and in suggesting new ways of working to support team KPIs
Lead connectivity of DXT work and insights to broader DXO strategy
Ensure the success of the Strategy team by displaying leadership skills, inspiring organizational coherence, and suggesting new ideas and best practices
Work in a teaming environment, building and sustaining relationships with peers and colleagues
What you’ll bring to this role
An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard
Bachelor’s degree required, MBA preferred (or related Master’s degree)
CPA designation preferred
Minimum 8-10 years of relevant work experience
Must have a strong understanding of process design and technology as it relates to data strategy and management
Highly developed and proven ability to quickly learn new technologies and develop new methodologies.
Experience with data and analytics software tools and service delivery practices
Experience using agile methodologies when conducting work
Strong leadership skills
Relationship building with senior stakeholders
Eager to participate in business development opportunities and initiatives
Superior organizational and project management skills
A self-starter who is quick to learn and apply new concepts
Flexibility and the demonstrated ability to prioritize activities
Demonstrated ability to be creative and effective in issue resolution
An excellent team player with a good level of initiative
Accepting and willing to take on both complex and simple tasks
Will be communicating regularly with firm leadership, engaging, influencing and aligning senior stakeholders on important initiatives
Exceptional presentation and writing skills with ability to adapt to various audiences
Conducts meetings within the Data DXT, acting as a strategic advisor and subject matter expert in digital transformation and data strategies
Prepares insights and reporting for the Data DXT stakeholders and the DXO
Understanding of client pain-points (internally and externally), and the short and long-term technology and market trends that are relevant to client needs
Why you’ll love working for PwC
At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc
See how you can create your future at PwC
www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/create-your-future.html
Get to know us
Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html
Applying at PwC
At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here: https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc
We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers: https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html

PwC is committed to building a diverse workforce representative of the communities we serve. We encourage and are pleased to consider all qualified candidates, without regard to race, colour, citizenship, religion, sex, marital / family status, sexual orientation, gender identity, aboriginal status, age, disability or persons who may require an accommodation, to apply.

Every day we see how people make businesses great. But it's not only about skills. If your experience is close to what we're looking for, please consider applying. We recognize that experience comes in many forms, and passionate teams reimagine the possible. Create your future at PwC.

Overview:

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 207,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 153 countries.With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.
What you will do:
Participate in special projects, e.g. building or implementing new tools, dashboards, Proof of Concepts (POC) etc.
Strong expertise in analysis, design and implementation of visualization / reporting applications especially using Power BI and Tableau
Experience in developing requirements and creating web based reports and dashboards
Manage effective implementation of multiple projects, prepare associate documents and perform appropriate tests on the same.
Develop and maintain various codes, documents and associate technical files.
Design effective plans and estimate efforts for multiple visualization projects of varied complexity.
Provide visualization technical support to the business functions and resolve any complex issues.
Translate business needs into dashboards, with a specific understanding of how customer requirements turn into easy-to-use dashboard solutions.
Conducts strategic data analysis, identifies insights and implications and makes strategic recommendations, develops data displays that clearly communicate complex analysis.
Organize and lead data review sessions with stakeholders, ensuring all process details are accurately captured and approved by the business SME
Provide support for automation developers, including clarifying automation requirements, facilitating creation of required environment and permission configurations, etc.
Participate in pre-deployment and post-deployment activities, e.g. UAT sessions, Go/No-Go meetings, hyper care calls, etc.
Assist with various operational issues, including troubleshooting production support issues, gathering and documenting change request details, etc.
What you bring to this role:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Creative approach and good design aesthetics
Exceptional documentation skills, including concise requirements and easy-to-follow process flow diagrams
Ability to forge consensus within a group of stakeholders, to deliver a solution that works for all
Knowledge of agile methodology and the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Prior working experience of at-least 7 to 10 years is must in Visualization tools - Microsoft Power BI, Tableau etc
Technical skills
Strong experience in working with data assets on Cloud such as Azure Synapse, Databricks, CosmosDB, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes etc.,
Knowledge in Azure Data Factory, Power BI Dataflows, Power Query
Strong Programming skills - SQL, DAX, T-SQL
Experience with Data validation including ability to create test plans, test cases, execute test cycles, etc.
Knowledge of programming languages is nice to have (JavaScript, HTML, Python etc)
Experience with tools such as Azure DevOps, SharePoint, Office 365, Microsoft Teams, etc
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
KPMG is committed to the health and safety of our people, clients and communities. With this commitment in mind, KPMG complies with all public health mandates (provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and has implemented various safety measures, including a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. As this role requires occasional or consistent attendance at a KPMG office and/or congregate setting, the successful candidate must be fully vaccinated (i.e. have received all doses that are recommended by Health Canada, including any boosters) and must provide KPMG with proof of vaccination. KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.

Overview:

Position Summary
The Forensic practice is interested in hiring a Data Analytics Manager to join its forensic data analytics (“FDA”) team. The FDA team performs data analytics to provide litigation support, the quantification of damages, and investigations into fraud and other inappropriate actions. Our team also performs data analytics for external audit, internal audit, as well as for other consulting engagements. Our team is made up of accountants, business valuators, programmers, forensic technology experts, business intelligence professionals, internal/IT auditors, statisticians, and others that are passionate about data and have specialized skills.
This position is available to a candidate with minimum 6 years professional experience who is interested in continuing a career in forensic data analytics, specifically in designing and programming algorithms to process and analyze large volumes of data (e.g. analyzing descriptive characteristics and calculating remediation for legal and compliance proceedings; creating/validating system calculations per business requirements; and running routines to identify patterns and high risk transactions which require further investigation).
Forensic Overview
KPMG Forensic helps uncover the facts and create clarity when people and organizations do not agree, or where financial and business behaviour does not comply with expectations. Our professionals can offer support after an incident to help our clients investigate allegations of fraud and misconduct, quantify losses in a commercial dispute, provide expert witness services, and recover damages. We also get involved before any incident has occurred - to help address exploitable weaknesses in corporate processes and systems.
What you will do:
Work with various engagement teams to translate data requirements into data analytics routines.
Review and/or develop scripts and workflows to assist with data extraction, queries, and data manipulation in accordance with business requirements.
Analyze client data, present findings, and suggest areas for improvement.
Review new and existing systems for adequacy of compliance and operational considerations.
Work closely with the Partners and Senior Managers to provide client service and carry out the day-to-day field work on a variety of assignments. This includes achieving quality and timeliness of working papers and deliverables. The candidate will often be responsible for managing several engagements at one time.
Prepare file documentation and ensure appropriate document management. Prepare written reports summarizing engagement procedures and findings.
Assist in establishing and monitoring project budgets, ensuring timely billing and collections, etc.
Assist the Partners in new client evaluation, engagement acceptance and related risk management practices.
Supervise junior employees on engagements and administrative projects.
Actively participate in marketing and business development at a Manager level, this will include developing your professional network, attending networking events, writing articles, preparing and delivering presentations and other activities to raise your profile within the business community.
What you bring to this role:
Experience with data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality, and manipulation; experience handling very large volumes of data.
Experience with some of the following software: Alteryx, Tableau, MS Power BI, SQL, Python, R, ACL/IDEA.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Bonus points if you have the following:
Experience in accounting and/or financial markets.
Forensic/accounting designations (CBV, CFF, CPA, etc.)
Technical designations (CISSP, CISA, etc.)
Experience with cloud platforms (GCP, Amazon, Azure, etc.)
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
KPMG is committed to the health and safety of our people, clients and communities. Are you energized by solving tough business problems, wrangling massive datasets, and developing clever code togenerate insight from diverse sources of data? Are you curious?
If so, then a role in the Analytics & Insights (A&I) Commercial Analytics organization is for you! We are looking for a dynamic, passionate individual to join our A&I team in Toronto beginning January 2022. In A&I, wecombine analytics and data science techniques to directly influence business strategy, product design, pricing, mediainvestments, retail, go to market strategy ... and much more. We use our data and boundless curiosity to discover whatconsumers want, why they want it, and how we can influence them through immersive exploration and in-depth analysis.
We use internal and external data sources to build predictive and explanatory models that enable insights into how our consumers, markets, and retailers behave.
Your role in A&I will involve building reproducible code, predictive models, analytics, storytelling, visualizations, andengaging presentations that facilitate a deep understanding of consumer and shopper behaviors. Your key to success willbe your ability to integrate exploratory data analysis, model building, model optimization and model production to deliverinsights that drive the business.
Our A&I Managers serve as internal business strategy consultants, whose role it is to ensure that consumer and shopper analytics and insights are the foundations of our business strategy and execution. You will work on multi-functional business teams - with Brand Management, Finance, Sales, and others - to constantly explore new opportunities for business growth.
Your key to success will be your ability to build on and combine soft skills with analytical skills to convey research findings and drive actions with your key business partners across levels and functions.
So, here's your opportunity! We're looking for hardworking and data driven individuals. Join A&I and help us anticipate what consumers want and to enable the business.
WHAT WE OFFER:

Responsibilities as of Day 1 - you will feel the ownership of your project from the beginning, and you will be given specific projects and responsibilities.
Continuous mentorship - you will work with passionate people and receive both formal training as well as day-to-day mentoring from your manager.
Work and be part of a multifaceted and encouraging environment - working over a diverse array of exciting problems.
Promoting agility and work/life balance for employees, we value every individual and support initiatives.
Experience true support for work/life efficiency and your long-term well-being.
A competitive salary and benefits' package.

Qualifications
We are looking for graduating students or recent graduates (up to five years' work experience) with analytical skills, team orientation, a "can-do" demeanor, and the ability to deliver breakthrough results.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Math, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Physical Sciences or Quantitative Social Sciences
Work experience or certification in SQL, Python or R not required, but preferred.
Work experience or certification in Data Visualization and Transformation packages (PowerBI, Tableau, KNIME, Alteryx) is an asset.
Ability to manage a data science or analytics project via envisioning, direction setting and enrolling others, and doing the coding/math/problem solving.
Work experience at applying analytics/algorithms on multiple business questions, in the space of media or retail.
Strong analytical skills, using multiple data sources.
You must be willing to relocate to Toronto
How to Apply:
Please apply on www.pgcareers.com and complete both your application AND assessments as soon as possible as we're reviewing candidates on a rolling basis for a January 2022 start date. We encourage you to review our Hiring Process here before starting your application.
Resume Submission: strong resumes will use the Context-Action-Results (CAR) format and highlight measurable results, in the areas of leadership and data analysis, achieved in your previous roles and experiences. Cover letters and transcripts are not required.
Assessment Overview: If your skills match our requirements, you will be asked to complete two online assessments. Please review our Assessment Overview here for more information on how to prepare. Assessment scores are valid for 12 months; to apply previous scores please click on the assessment link(s). If your score has expired, you will be prompted to re-write the assessments.
Additional Information:
P&G serves nearly five billion people around the world and has the strongest portfolio of trusted, quality, leadership brands, including Tide®, Pantene®, Pampers®, Gillette®, and Old Spice®. Join us to grow your skills as a world-class leader! P&G Canada has been named one of Canada's Top 100 Employers (2021), Canada's Top Employers for Young People (2021), and Canada's Best Diversity Employers (2021).
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. Underrepresented candidates including, but not limited to, People with disabilities, female and/or Black, Indigenous, Asian, Latin American, or two or more races are strongly encouraged to apply.
P&G is committed to accommodating any applicant with a disability, as required by law, during the recruitment, assessment, and selection process. If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please click here to submit your request.
Sponsorship for work authorization is not available for this role. It is the applicant's responsibility to ensure they are authorized to work in the location to which they apply.
