We are looking for a Product Manager to drive the evolution and scalability of our analytics ecosystem by pioneering cutting-edge capabilities and delivering delightful customer experiences. Dapper enables real people to experience the magic of blockchain. It is the first to offer truly unique scaled collectible NFTs to the sports fan community.
The ideal candidate is compelled by the applications and opportunities of crypto and blockchain technologies and enthusiastic about bringing the benefits of decentralization to a broad consumer audience. The key responsibilities consist of working with the analytics team to deliver new world-class Insights & analytics products driven by requirements from Executives and the leaders of Dapper Platform, Dapper Studio, Flow, and collectives. This role is for people who thrive in a fast-paced collaborative environment, enjoy ideating, bringing new products to market, pushing the boundaries, not being scared to take a risk, and love working with the best technology team in the world. This role will report to the Head of Data.
A little about us:
Founded in 2018, Dapper Labs uses blockchain technology to bring new forms of digital engagement to fans around the world. We are at an inflection point in our journey and it might be the perfect time for you to join us. Less than 6 months ago we launched NBA Top Shot on the new Flow blockchain and it is already on track to be the fastest-growing marketplace in history. We're now profitable and ready to invest in building out the ecosystem so everyone can benefit.
What we'll accomplish together:
Define and execute analytics strategy and roadmap in close collaboration with data engineering, analytics, sports analytics, and other partners across the company.
Create and execute strategic growth plans with quantified results to scale our analytics capabilities.
Profile and understand high-value, innovative use cases for analytics and plan the solution delivery.
Evaluate and prioritize requirements in partnership with Trust & Safety, Engineering, Compliance, and Dapper Platform leadership, leveraging industry best practices and new innovations.
Prioritize and manage a product backlog for effective release and sprint planning.
Facilitate requirements definition with design and engineering partners while identifying dependencies and relative priority with other product managers.
Develop and track clear metrics to assess the success and performance of analytics team, and support effective decision making.
Coordinate and execute as a cross-functional leader and run an efficient build-measure-learn development agile cycle, with clear prioritization criteria. Also serves as the central point of contact for analytics.
Be able to clearly communicate vision, important KPI’s, and how the team’s work prioritization aligns with the goals of the data analytics team.
A little about you:
Experience in product management preferably building data, reporting and analytics capabilities in an enterprise environment
Experience working with, and driving product development across cross-functional teams to implement customer facing solutions
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills that can quickly evaluate complex issues and break into actionable steps till resolution
Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming product requirements into an actionable product roadmap
Proven track record of balancing multiple projects at once and delivery of projects successfully on time.
Expert in managing time and schedules with multiple stakeholders and cross-functional teams to meet deadlines.
Take end-to-end responsibility for the analytics product’s success.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, matched with the ability to tell a story with the data.
Ability to think strategically, learn quickly, prioritize effectively and succeed in fast-paced and uncertain environments while acting autonomously.
An entrepreneurial mindset and a passion for using emerging technology and data to solve unmet user needs.
More about Dapper Labs:
Dapper Labs, the company behind CryptoKitties, NBA Top Shot, NFL ALL DAY, UFC Strike and the Flow blockchain, uses blockchain technology to bring NFTs and new forms of digital engagement to fans around the world paving the way to a more open and inclusive digital world starting with games and entertainment.
Since it was founded in 2018, Dapper Labs has given consumer enthusiasts a real stake in the game by bringing them closer to the brands they love, building engaged and exciting communities for them to contribute to, and producing new pathways for them to become creators themselves. Dapper Labs' current studio partners include the NBA, NBPA, WNBA, WNBPA, LaLiga, NFL, NFLPA, Warner Music Group, Ubisoft, Genies, and UFC. We have raised over $600M from leading and notable investors including Andreessen Horowitz, Coatue, Union Square Ventures, Venrock, Google Ventures (GV), Samsung, and the founders of Dreamworks, Reddit, Coinbase, Zynga, and AngelList, among others.
Dapper Labs is accelerating the move to Web3 by building new apps and platforms that enable great user experiences while being accessible to hundreds of millions of fans of organizations like the NBA and NFL, for example. We’re ready to empower even more to bring mainstream-ready user experiences and scale to web3 applications.
Visit our website to learn even more about Dapper Labs, including information about benefits and perks.

Are you technologically skilled as well as a good negotiator? Do you know what it takes to drive successful engagements with customers? Are you a collaborative team player? Can you speak the language of both technical and non-technical people? Join us to manage our projects as well as the delivery of our solutions in Data Quality, MDM, and Big Data to our customers world-wide.
Work from anywhere in Canada remotely. #LI-hybrid
Your challenge
We provide data quality and master data management solutions—on traditional as well as big data platforms. The solutions range from small pilots to large enterprise systems. Join our team and autonomously manage multiple projects at the same time.
Manage customer engagement to ensure our customers are getting value from Ataccama products and solutions.
Take care of customer engagement from the very beginning to the very end. Develop a project plan, handle the project schedule along with risks and issues, follow the project budget, and deliver the solution to the client with your project team. Yelp connects millions of people with great local businesses every day, and local businesses know it. About 200+ businesses subscribe to Yelp’s advertising products today, and those happy customers account for nearly all of our revenue. However, local business advertising is still a rapidly growing market, and there are millions of business owners who’ve claimed their Yelp profile and aren’t customers yet. That’s where you come in.
We’re looking for an experienced Technical Program Manager to support and develop our Data Infrastructure organization. Our Data Infrastructure ecosystem powers critical machine learning, real-time notifications, sales and marketing engineering, experimentation and data warehousing use cases across Yelp. You will partner with engineering managers, product managers, and data science leaders to help deliver Yelp’s next generation data infrastructure ecosystem. The Data Infrastructure group is located across London and North America; the group looks after our entire streaming infrastructure (Apache Kafka and Apache Flink) as well as our databases (MySQL and Cassandra) and data warehouse (Redshift) - You can read more about our infrastructure in our engineering blog.
Yelp engineering culture is driven by our values: we’re a cooperative team that values individual authenticity and encourages creative solutions to problems. You’ll have an opportunity to be hands-on in your first week, and your impact will only grow from there with the support of your manager, mentor, and team. At the end of the day, we’re all about helping our users, growing as engineers, and having fun in a collaborative environment.

Interested in becoming the TPM for our Data Infrastructure team? If yes, please send us your application!
We’d love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement in this posting. At Yelp, we’re looking for great people, not just those who simply check off all the boxes.
This is a fully remote position and we welcome applicants from throughout Canada.
Where You Come In:
Run top technical and complex and cross team initiatives while ensuring alignment of product decisions with company-wide objectives.
Drive the roadmap and quarterly planning process for the Data Infrastructure initiatives across Engineering.
Conduct research into new Data Infrastructure investments and proactively identify and analyze complex, long-term problems with leadership.
Evangelize Data Infrastructure best practices across the company while continuing to optimize process, establish metrics as well as reporting mechanisms for our initiatives
Manage program dependencies, milestones, risks, and resources requirements as well as provide transparency and predictability for stakeholders.
What It Takes to Succeed:
Be a process expert who can help our teams level up their execution, stick to milestone commitments and give partners solid communication and updates.
Experience working with various cross-functional teams and a broad set of internal partners across various departments and multiple locations (United Kingdom, Germany and North America).
Ability to communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences at all levels.
Strong ability to deal with complexity while effectively embracing change or uncertainty.
Experience in engineering leadership or program management may be an asset.
Be a team player who lives the Yelp Values and thrives in a diverse and inclusive work culture.

Description

The Data Strategy & Enablement team is on a continuous journey towards helping TELUS become a world-class leader in data driven organization, doing so by delivering data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data, and a data-product and data platform oriented culture while always keeping an eye on the horizon, preparing for the next big thing.

We are entrepreneurial, fun and passionate, believers that so much more is possible and can be achieved by creating value and great outcomes for our customers, team members, communities, and environment. Our team members appreciate diversity of thinking, ideas and experiences, and are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

Here's the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together

As a Senior Strategy Manager on the Data Strategy & Enablement Team, you will drive the development and execution of data strategy to lead TELUS into an insights driven company while creating value for our customers and company.
Play a key role in executing and expanding the awareness around our multiple transformation efforts. Using your communications knowledge and creativity, you’ll help promote the vision and behaviours to enable our transformation, translating technical lingo and complex ideas into engaging, easy to understand and digestable content for decision makers. You will help promote the Data & Strategy Enablement via collaboration across TELUS business units and share success stories in engaging formats via articles and presentations to wider audiences. Along the way, there will also be a ton of opportunities for both personal and professional development while developing long-lasting relationships within the TELUS family.

Here's How
Collaborate closely with leaders, partners and peers to develop, articulate and align on the strategic and execution roadmap

Develop business cases and financial models for key strategic initiatives and planning
Help establish an insights function to provide relevant market, technology news and POVs across the team, including the creation of unique insights that amalgamate 3rd party research and POVs with TELUS data.
Work with teams across TELUS to identify strategies targeting different audiences, building on TELUS’ industry leading awareness program.
Create content, short articles and point of views showcasing success stories of the team for internal PR and communications
Prepare and execute a transformation communications plan to drive engagement and motivate to execute and delivery

Stay up to date with the latest transformation efforts, methods and thinking on communication strategies

You are flexible, adaptable and open to feedback with the ability to pivot rapidly when needed.
You are an exceptional collaborator, relationship builder, influencer and negotiator
You and stay on top of emerging technologies and industry trends
Strong written and verbal communications skills

5 -7 years of experience working in a large organization in technology sector

Coursera can hire people in any country where we have a legal entity, assuming candidates have eligible working rights and a sufficient timezone overlap with their team. Our interviews and onboarding are conducted virtually, a part of being a remote-first company.

Coursera was launched in 2012 by two Stanford Computer Science professors, Andrew Ng and Daphne Koller, with a mission to provide universal access to world-class learning. It is now one of the largest online learning platforms in the world, with 97 million registered learners as of Dec. 31, 2021. Coursera partners with over 250 leading university and industry partners to offer a broad catalog of content and credentials, including courses, Specializations, Professional Certificates, Guided Projects and bachelor's and master's degrees. Institutions around the world use Coursera to upskill and reskill their employees, citizens, and students in fields such as data science, technology, and business. Coursera became a B Corp in February 2021.
Job Overview:
At Coursera, our Data Science team is helping to build the future of education through data-driven decision making and data-powered products. We drive product and business strategy through measurement, experimentation, and causal inference. We define, develop, and launch the models and algorithms that power content discovery, personalized learning, and machine-assisted teaching and grading.
As a Manager, Machine Learning you will lead a talented team of Machine Learning Scientists in defining and building innovative data products to unlock the next generation of career-centric learning experiences. This team is responsible for ideating, prototyping, and productionizing the machine learning algorithms that power Coursera's product and business with the Skills Graph and its wide-ranging applications. Our Skills Graph is a foundational data asset powered by NLP and crowdsourcing that maps a robust library of skills to the content that teaches them, the careers that require them, and the learners who have or want to learn them. Product applications of Skills Graph range from skills-based search and recommendations to real-time learner skill tracking.
In this role, you will own the vision, strategy, and roadmap for Skills Machine Learning at Coursera. The ideal candidate is an innovative and impact-oriented builder with experience in Machine Learning System Design, Develop and Deployment, exceptional leadership and management skills, and a passion for education. We believe the next generation of education is personalized, accessible, and efficient - reaching a world of learners who need it -, and that with our data, technology, and talent we are best positioned to make that vision a reality.
Responsibilities:
Build a vision for the Skills machine learning and data products at Coursera
Attract, develop, and retain a world-class team of Machine Learning scientists, including providing deep technical guidance
Collaborate with business and product partners in defining and executing on the Skills Graph data product roadmap, lead prioritization and planning
Drive forward on key initiatives and balance effective product feature delivery against managing ML tech debt
Be a thought-leader internally and externally on how data is transforming education.
Basic Qualifications:
5+ years experience building data-powered products
1+ years leading high-performing teams of Machine Learning scientists and/or engineers
Strong applied skills in machine learning, programming, and statistics
Excellent communicator and cross-functional collaborator
Passion for improving access to high-quality education
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience building and deploying end-to-end Machine Learning Systems
Experience managing a team owning data product platforms or components of a data product platform.
Experience in causal inference methodologies
If this opportunity interests you, you might like these courses on Coursera:
Machine Learning Engineering for Production (MLOps) Specialization
Leading Teams
How to Manage a Remote Team

job_description:
We are Demand Science, a global company which never stops innovating in our mission to provide the healthiest and most predictive global B2B data and intelligence for our customers. Our clients include sales and marketing professionals at global companies. Excellent execution is in our DNA. We provide innovative AI-analytics merged with enriched data to identify your next in-market prospects and customers at scale.
Data Product Manager

We are looking for a Data Product Manager to translate business requirements into well-defined product requirements and define the data. Someone who can define and design the product roadmap to achieve the company's business goals by solving the complex needs of enterprise customers.

"What You'll Do":

Own the product design - Shape and design existing/new features at all stages of product design, creating world-class B2B, data, AI, and SaaS applications.
Engage with diverse clients - work w/ internal stakeholders & customer-facing teams to understand business needs/goals and translate these to flows and use cases.
Lead and be the product expert - Lead the data integration efforts of a data product team with creativity and enthusiasm and provide product subject matter expertise in support of various company functions.
Serve as the product KPI expert - Define key performance indicators to evaluate product value and provide the methodologies to accurately measure the product's performance and usage.
Collaborate with other experts - Collaborate with cross-functional teams and various stakeholders, including engineering, data product developers, marketing, partnerships, and customer success.

Essential Qualifications "What You'll Need":

You have at least 5+ years of experience as a Product Manager working on SaaS data and/or analytic products. MSc engineering degree or an MBA degree preferred.

You will be a player/coach responsible for managing a team of analysts tasked with ongoing monitoring and surfacing of new threats in the digital advertising ecosystem. This role and team will have extensive interaction with large data sets (we monitor hundreds of thousands of transactions per second and collect tens of billions of events each day)

Role: Data Sciences Product Leader - Data Quality Lead / Data Manager
Department: PDD
Type: FTE
As a Data Sciences Product Leader you will be part of our Portfolio Delivery Pods within Data Strategy and Delivery in PD Data Sciences. You will work as a Data Quality Leader within the Clinical Data Management (CDM) function and with a team of experts in data life-cycle management who acquire and curate data for use in exploratory research, clinical development and evidence generation. You will collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to identify, design and execute fit for purpose data management solutions, adhering to F.A.I.R. (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) principles. You will ensure the timely completion of data management deliverables and partner with External Business Partners (ExBPs) and vendors, overseeing and providing technical expertise in the delivery of high quality data. You may also contribute to functional, cross functional, enterprise-wide or external initiatives that shape our technical landscape, business and healthcare environments. You will need strong strategic, collaboration and communication skills, as well as an entrepreneurial mindset, to evolve the way we collect and deliver data and to develop and deliver medicines for our patients.
Responsibilities
Collaborate with peers within the function and across the organization to identify, design and execute fit for purpose data management solutions, ensuring FAIR principles are adhered to.
Act as experts for data collection and acquisition, advising teams and stakeholders on best practices and proposing innovative solutions. e.g. the collection of new data types (e.g. emergent biomarkers), new technologies (e.g. sensors), and new data sources (e.g. RWD, EMR).
Partner with and provide oversight of data management deliverables (e.g. Work-Packages) to our External Business Partners (ExBPs) and vendors. Provide Quality Assurance on tasks as applicable to ensure a high quality of data and compliance with applicable pharma industry regulations and standards.
Proactively manage timelines and track decisions, ensuring successful delivery of the study work packages carried out at ExBPs. Continue to be accountable for quality and where needed, provide support in the form of business and technical expertise to our ExBPs.
Oversee ExBPs in Sample management and eManifest process, ensuring timely, proactive resolution of queries.
Proactively engage with stakeholders across the business to understand their needs and influence their understanding of decisions made in our function. Inform stakeholders of status of key deliverables and act on changing milestones.
Partner with stakeholders to understand their data insight needs and offer Data Management solutions. Demonstrate a strong understanding of the data flow from collection through to analysis and filing.
Partner with relevant functions for external data vendor selection and management. Oversee development of data transfer agreements with vendors ensuring use of standards, fit-for-purpose data models and transfer intervals.
Use data surveillance tools and strategies to provide aggregate level reviews designed to identify patterns or anomalies in our data to ensure high quality results.
Collaborate and contribute to functional/cross-functional initiatives or goals to promote new ways of working, including emerging technologies. Enable broader and more effective use of data to support the business.
Qualifications
BSc or MSc in Life Sciences, Data/Computer Science, Bioinformatics OR equivalent industry experience.
Experience in leading CDM study teams and maintaining oversight of all start-up, conduct and close-out activities for multiple or complex studies, ensuring fit for purpose quality (including oversight of ExBPs, Vendors, CROs and Collaborative Groups).
Experience in leading the collection of clinical trial and/or Real World Data.
Good understanding of molecule and disease area strategies, healthcare environments, as well as strong scientific and technical expertise.
Demonstrated strong collaboration and excellent communication skills – both written and oral (proficiency in English required).
Knowledge of CDISC data standards.
Knowledge of ICH-GCP and working in regulated environments.
Project Management skills.
Able to manage multiple requests and priorities.
Demonstrated leadership capabilities around decision-making, negotiation, motivation (self and others) and influencing.
Experience with data analytics and/or visualization tools and techniques.
Demonstrated entrepreneurial mindset and self-direction, ability to mentor others and willingness to learn new techniques.
Knowledge of biological principles, display interest and demonstrate scientific curiosity including an understanding of data types and their scientific use (clinical, biomarker, WGS, RNA-seq, etc.).
Extensive technical and/or industry experience required for senior roles.
Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.
Roche Pharma Canada has its office in Mississauga, Ontario and employs over 850 employees. The Mississauga facility is bright, vibrant, fosters collaboration and teamwork, and is reflective of Roche's truly innovative culture.

job_description:
Manages a team of data scientists responsible for a portfolio of diagnostic, predictive, and prescriptive analytics projects to support data-driven business decision making. Supports the continuous evolution and strategy of Vanguard's data science capabilities.
Core Responsibilities:
Hires, evaluates, and supervises crew. Provides guidance and training as necessary to develop crew. Sets performance standards, reviews performance, and makes informed compensation decisions in accordance with all applicable Human Resources policies and procedures.
Lead the AI/ML Business Solutions team that is in charge of developing innovative ML solutions to support key business goals, focusing on Vanguard’s direct business (B2C, Retail).
Manages a team of data scientists responsible for building novel and impactful set of ML-driven solutions, using ML techniques for targeting models, natural language (NLP), supervised, unsupervised, and reinforcement learning. Supports the continuous evolution and strategy of Vanguard's data science capabilities.
Lead the deployment and socialization of custom ML solutions, to supports key business goals and KPI’s. Working with intra and inter department stakeholders to support deployment, integration, updates, upgrades and measurement of solutions.
Oversees the execution of large scale, most complex analytics solutions. Bring new and innovative ideas to inspire and nurture the culture of applied AI/ML capabilities, solutions and multi-task engines. Partnering with the ML Engineer team to support technical implementation ML-solutions/models.
Partner with the Strategy team to create a robust and innovative roadmap to support key business objectives.
Engages with senior leadership to understand and probe business processes in order to develop hypotheses and lead the AI/ML development agenda. Brings structure to requests and translates requirements into a ML approach.
Drives innovative analytic applications and results. Keeps abreast of industry, market and company trends, and partners with business leaders to champion the adoption of new data, analytic approaches, techniques and capabilities.
Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications:
Minimum of ten years related work experience in advanced analytical/ML roles.
Experience with ML algorithms and methods, including supervised, unsupervised, NLP, reinforcement learning, statistical learning (parametric and non-parametric), deep learning, concepts of modern ML tools and cloud computing.
Undergraduate degree in Analytics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Sciences, Statistics or related analytical field of study or equivalent combination of training and experience. Graduate degree preferred.
About Vanguard
We are Vanguard. Together, we’re changing the way the world invests.
For us, investing doesn’t just end in value. It starts with values. Because when you invest with courage, when you invest with clarity, and when you invest with care, you can get so much more in return. We invest with purpose – and that’s how we’ve become a global market leader. Here, we grow by doing the right thing for the people we serve. And so can you.
We want to make success accessible to everyone. This is our opportunity. Let’s make it count.
Inclusion Statement
Vanguard’s continued commitment to diversity and inclusion is firmly rooted in our culture. Every decision we make to best serve our clients, crew (internally employees are referred to as crew), and communities is guided by one simple statement: “Do the right thing.”
We believe that a critical aspect of doing the right thing requires building diverse, inclusive, and highly effective teams of individuals who are as unique as the clients they serve. We empower our crew to contribute their distinct strengths to achieving Vanguard’s core purpose through our values.
When all crew members feel valued and included, our ability to collaborate and innovate is amplified, and we are united in delivering on Vanguard's core purpose.
Our core purpose: To take a stand for all investors, to treat them fairly, and to give them the best chance for investment success.
Future of Work
During the pandemic, we transitioned to a work from home model for the majority of our crew and we continue to interview, hire, and on-board future crew remotely.
As we have developed the path forward, we have taken a thoughtful approach that both maximizes the advantages of working remotely and the many benefits of coming together and collaborating in a shared workspace. We believe that in-person interactions among our crew are important for preserving our unique culture and advantageous for the personal development of our crew.
When our Crew return to the office, many will work in our hybrid model. A smaller proportion of our crew will operate in the Work from Home work model (for example, field sales crew); or in the Work from Office model (for example, portfolio managers).
The working model that your role falls into will be communicated to you in the interview process – please do ask if you are unsure. We encourage you to make the decision regarding your job interview and offer knowing which model your role will fall into. We will test and learn as our ways of working evolve and will continue to evaluate working models along the way.

Tangerine is Canada’s leading direct bank. We offer flexible and accessible banking options, innovative products, and award-winning Client service. The reason why Tangerine employees come to work each day is to help Canadians live better lives. We focus on making a difference in our communities, and that includes our own internal community. As Canada’s leading digital bank, Tangerine technology is at the heart of everything we do. We have redefined what digital banking is and we continue to evolve on what it can be, using technology to create innovative, forward thinking banking solutions with our clients’ needs in mind.
We are made up of high performing, curious, energetic and collaborative individuals who thrive in our high trust agile environment to deliver best in class solutions for our customers. We believe in giving people hands-on challenges and the responsibilities that come with them, allowing them to grow, evolve and create opportunities to build their career.
Are you ready to make the change and become part of an established disruptor with the backing of a highly engaged team? If so come join us and help redefine the Canadian banking landscape!
Job Summary:
Tangerine is looking for motivated and strategically minded individuals to join our team as we develop the next generation banking experience for Canadians.
Reporting to the Head of Digital Service, the Digital Data Analytics Manager helps us design and implement our digital analytics measurement framework and tagging while also helping us understand our Digital metrics overall. This role ensures we are tagging and tracking the right things and you are hands on and will build, implement, standardize & maintain our tag management strategy across our digital properties. You have a deep understanding of Google Analytics and are a hard-working, detail orientated individual. You will come with a proven ability as an Analyst who has done tag management and implementation and you are keen to utilise your skills and experience to make a direct impact at Tangerine.
Although we value self-organizing teams, the Digital Data Analytics Manager will often find their natural leadership skills called upon as they take responsibility for ensuring that the software and experiences we’re building are done with data in mind. This is a rewarding, creative and challenging role which demands initiative, communication, resourcefulness and good problem-solving skills.
Role Accountabilities:
Communication
Communicate with the business stakeholders and take responsibility for ensuring that we’re building “the right thing” to help us foster a data rich organization.
Serve as the primary source of external information for the Scrum teams for all things Digital Data and Analytics, offering clear definitions of the targeted capability and functional/non-functional requirements to ensure we’re able to measure what we build.
Apply incremental delivery principles to data tracking and measurement, drive the delivery of business value, communicate progress, elicit feedback and enable stakeholder reviews for validation in the process.
Leadership and Execution
Experience as a proven Digital Data Analyst, Marketing Insight Analyst, Insight Analyst, or Campaign Analyst
Google Analytics Certification is absolutely essential
Experience with Adobe Analytics, Audience Manager, Google Analytics, etc.
Experience in digital analytics implementations working with Tag Management Systems (TMS) such as Adobe Launch/DTM, or Google Tag Manager (GTM)
Strong knowledge of Adobe/Firebase Analytics Mobile SDKs
Experience in Adobe Experience cloud tools & solutions (Target, Audience Manager, AEP, Adobe APIs etc.)
Strong knowledge with JavaScript, HTML, CSS and modern framework (AngularJS, React, etc.)
Experience with Data and analysis
SQL Experience would be a massive help
Solid Marketing Technology understanding would be a solid asset
Excellent communicator and eagerness to manage stakeholders at a variety of levels, this includes being able to work with Engineers to translate business requirements to technical specifications
High attention to detail and appreciation for understanding processes
Be able to learn quickly
Bring Insight from Data to help us drive our KPIs and digital product metrics that inform the team’s direction.
Coach team members and help with their development / desired outcomes as required in the area of Digital Analytics.
Minimum Qualifications:
Education/Experience
University or College Degree
5+ years related experience in digital data analytics
Facilitation and fact-based problem solving to resolve complex issues and drive actionable outcomes.
Previous work experience with significant accountabilities relating but not limited to:
Digital Data Analytics Manager
Insight Analyst
Digital Data Anaylst
Experience in a technology company or top-tier technology consulting firm an asset.
Professional Certification
Google Analytics Certification is a must.
Technical Skills
Working knowledge of software, Information Technology, mobile and web development is an asset.
Abilities
Strong data driven approach, utilizing key metrics and evidence in decision making.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to communicate on a broad spectrum (from deep technical discussions to high level executive vision).
Attributes
Enthusiastic, thorough, inclusive and results-oriented; Ability and desire to help others thrive in a dynamic team-oriented environment.
Eager to mentor, teach, share and learn.
Deep passion in data driven customer experiences, innovation and delivering software.
An Agile “mindset” and the flexibility to adapt to new and evolving environments.
A positive attitude, thirst for knowledge, team oriented, pragmatic, willing to fail.
Very strong organizational sense and effective time and priority management.
Working Conditions:

job_description:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
The Manager of Data Mart and Integration will be reporting to the AVP of DataMart and Business Intelligence and is responsible for defining and communicating data management strategies across Canadian Tire’s banners and their data teams onto an enterprise data model.
Working closely and collaboratively with the team’s business stakeholders (VPs, AVPs and managers of Merch, Supply Chain, Finance etc.) in providing an enterprise curated model consumable by all stakeholders on cloud. The manager will provide direction on data modeling standards between data solutions managers, designers, and data consumers from the enterprise model and supporting semantic models. The managers review the designs to models, owns the process of updating the logical and physical models and is accountable to define changes to the model based on business need or market shift.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. This position is categorized as a Roamer, which means that the incumbent can successfully complete their role objectives virtually and are not required to be present on a CTC campus unless they choose to do so.
What You’ll Do
Team management: Responsible for the management of multiple development team (Contractors, Consultants & direct reports). The main responsibility of the manager is to ensures plans are in place to deliver on time, budget and with the required functionality for our users.
Enterprise Data Model Gatekeeper: Responsible for ensuring that the solution we develop respect the key data modeling principles and are driven through an enterprise lens across all banners
Review data management solutions: Responsible to review the availability of data and determine the table structures necessary for the delivery of each data domain. This review is necessary to ensure efficient development, performance, and reliability of the solutions.
Liaison with stakeholders: Responsible to manage the relationship with all the stakeholders of our projects including business leaders, IT project teams, designers, developers, and other team members. More specifically be the liaison with IT for all data initiatives and act as the Product Owners of the enterprise model
Project leader: Lead special initiatives specific to EDT relaunch and DNA specific programs. Ensure the right stakeholders are involved as needed.
What You Bring
8-10 years of multi-disciplined IT experience. Ideally the individual will have experience in a company with multi-unit, retail store and online environments with emphasis on customer service requirements.
Minimum of 5 years related work experience within Azure fundamentals supporting a cloud first strategy.
5-7 year of database management, ETL, data modeling and data management experience.
5 years’ experience in building Data Lake with a focus on MS Azure, ADF, Synapse, Snowflake.
Exposure to traditional BI Tools (PowerBI, tableau, Cognos, Qlik, SSRS, etc.)
Exposure to AI & ML Tools (Azure AI & M, or ML flow).
Drive projects that merge digital and transactional data for advanced analytics.
Must have Azure Synapse (dedicated pool, server less pool, spark integration), Azure Synapse analytics, Azure Data factory, Gen 2 storage, SQL server, My SQL, PostgreSQL skills.
ETL tools – SSIS, ADF.Tibco, DataBricks.
Reporting tools – Tableau, Power BI.
Establish data quality control framework while sourcing data.
Experience in BI and Data Lake projects.
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies. To learn more follow us on LinkedIn.
CTC is committed to the fight against COVID-19 and being there for Canadians. In support of this, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 testing in order to access the workplace until further notice.

 : Mar 1, 2022, 10:30:47 AM

For more than 25 years, Veristat has built a reputation as a thoughtful partner in the clinical development and regulatory submission process. We have done so by hiring talented people who align to our core values and share a common passion for our mission driven work.

Do you value a collaborative work environment and the opportunity to truly make a difference? If so, you will feel right at home here. At Veristat, you can grow both personally and professionally, with opportunities to discuss your achievements and advance your career through quarterly feedback conversations and meaningful work.

We do things differently than large CROs and would love to have you join our Veristat team!

Key Purpose:
Working independently, the Senior Clinical Data Manager is responsible for the performance of data management tasks from study start-up through database lock for assigned projects, including paper-based and electronic data capture (EDC) studies, and is responsible for overall data quality and documentation on projects.
The Senior Clinical Data Manager will work on projects in various indications and will lead a team of Clinical Data Managers to ensure all the contracted activities are carried out according to the Standard Operating Procedures of Veristat and/or Sponsor specific requirements.
In consort with Data Management leadership, the Senior Clinical Data Manager promotes consistent operations, efficient use of resources, and sharing of knowledge and best practices.
As directed, s/he will assist with the training of other data managers on project specific and general data management processes, procedures and systems, as well as providing training to other functions across the company as needed.
Primary Duties + Responsibility:
Lead studies as the Lead Clinical Data Manager; liaise between study personnel and the client, as appropriate, regarding clinical and/or technical issues. May also serve as support for other Lead Clinical Data Managers as needed.
Develop and/or review case report forms (CRFs) within an EDC system and build relevant database structure.
Develop or quality control review Data Validation Specifications (DVS) documents.
Program edit checks and other system functions within EDC as needed.
Facilitate or participate in User Acceptance Testing (UAT) prior to study go-live.
Author or perform quality control review of data management documents, such as CRF Completion Guidelines (CCGs), Data Management Plans (DMP), and Data Transfer Plans.
Responsible for data cleaning activities including data review, query generation and management, and development of study metrics either through direct action or delegation to other team members. May find discrepancies, track trends, and identify areas of retraining needed from members of the study team.
Responsible for the handling and reconciliation activities of external data (e.g., Central Labs, IVRS, etc.).
Oversee or participate in database lock activities, including managing user access and authoring or providing quality control review of lock documentation
Partner with other functional groups (e.g., Biostatistics, Statistical Programming, Medical Writing, Project Management, etc.) to ensure data management aspects of the project are properly considered and integrate well with the other activities.
Liaise between study center personnel and the client, as appropriate, regarding clinical and/or technical issues
Perform quality control activities on projects across the department providing feedback to necessary individuals and working with them to correct any issues.
May serve as a technical lead in a specific area across projects within the department (e.g., Coding Expert).
Provide mentorship and/or training opportunities for junior level staff within the Data Management department.
May lead trainings and/or department initiatives to advance team’s understanding of these areas and/or improve related processes.
Serve in a Project Management capacity as deemed necessary and appropriate.
As requested, assist in business development activities, such as bid defenses and capabilities presentations as the Data Management Team representative.
Participate in activities related to inspection-readiness, including representing the Data Management group at audits (internal and external).
Participate in SOPs update and process improvement.
Experience & Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in a related field & 5 years of relevant experience required; at least 3 years experience in clinical data management in a clinical research setting also required.
2 years of experience in leading project teams required.
Certifications and/or courses completed in Medidata Rave Study Design and Build Essentials strongly preferred.
Overall understanding of International Conference on Harmonisation (ICH) Good Clinical Practice (GCP) guidelines and other applicable regulatory rules and guidelines as well as of medical terminology, clinical trials, and clinical research.
Skilled in use of computer technology, including clinical trial databases and applications (g., IBM Clinical Development, Medidata RaveX) and ability to learn new applications
Detailed understanding of project planning and management methods.
Demonstrated ability to serve as a strong internal and external consultant, influence without authority, and guide project teams to mutually acceptable outcomes.
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills with the ability to work independently and in a team environment.
Ability to work in different projects with different priorities and act as team mentor, and provide data management expertise.
Additional Requirements:
Driving/Travel requirements - Travel up to 25% (US, Canada, or International)
Physical requirements – ability to occasionally lift/move up to 25 lbs.
Hours/Conditions – US & Taiwan: 40 hour work week; Canada & UK: 37.5 hour work week
FLSA Classification – Exempt

Join us in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC advances a culture that helps everyone to thrive. Are you ready to get started?
A career within Cybersecurity and Privacy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients implement an effective cybersecurity programme that protects against threats, propels transformation, and drives growth. As companies pivot toward a digital business model, exponentially more data is generated and shared among organisations, partners and customers. We play an integral role in helping our clients ensure they are protected by developing transformation strategies focused on security, efficiently integrate and manage new or existing technology systems to deliver continuous operational improvements and increase their cybersecurity investment, and detect, respond, and remediate threats.

COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.
What you'll create and do
As a Manager, you’ll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to: Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work.
A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences, developing and coaching diverse teams, and ensuring diverse perspectives are heard.
Project management and delivery, as required by the scope of specific client engagements, which includes Assessment/Strategy through to the Design, Implementation and Optimization of privacy, data trust and data protection programs, solutions and products.
Engagement management, including project planning, budget and resource management.
Business development activities throughout the entire opportunity lifecycle, including lead generation, opportunity tracking, pre-sales presentations, technical demos, client & engagement risk assessments, bid management, proposal writing, and contract management.
Building and developing an engagement plan, defining needed resources and creating the related budget/fee structure.
Practice development, including work on delivery methodology, training, and sales and marketing materials.
Personal professional development as a Privacy and Data Protection subject-matter specialist, including continuous vendor and industry training, attending conferences, and specific products and solutions self-study.
Multitasking on multiple projects and tasks with contending priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Working with other Cybersecurity & Privacy teams on non privacy and data protection projects as required.
Coach and train new and/or more junior team members to become an integral part of the Privacy and Data Protection team, Cybersecurity & Privacy Consulting practice and PwC family.
What you'll bring to this role
An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work.
A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives.
Solid mix of business and technical capabilities, and the ability to communicate complex technical privacy or data protection issues to senior clients within the context of their business.
Proven experience with privacy frameworks and compliance requirements.
Ability to be recognized as the subject matter specialist in privacy and data protection.
A demonstrated understanding of privacy and/or data protection requirements (legal, regulatory, industry good practices) and experience in practically implementing these requirements for companies.
A demonstrated understanding of privacy trends and issues including their impact to businesses across different industry sectors.
Experience developing and implementing privacy and data protection related programs and controls (e.g. privacy strategies, governance, policies, procedures, processes, training, metrics, and reporting).
Expertise conducting privacy impact assessments, readiness assessments, and/or risk assessments for programs, projects, or initiatives.
Demonstrates experience designing, deploying, integrating and managing privacy, data management and/or data protection technology (on-premises and/or in the cloud) and help build trust in use of data (e.g. data mapping, notice/consent management, data subject rights management, secure data deletion).
Strong analytical and problem solving capabilities including the ability to understand and analyze client data issues amidst the privacy legal/regulatory landscape and provide innovative and practical recommendations and solutions.
Prior Big 4 experience or other consulting experience is a plus.
Technical designations: privacy, security and/or project management related technical designations are a plus, such as CIPP, CISSP or PMP.
Why you’ll love working for PwC
At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

job_description:
Job Summary

Reporting to the VP Modeling, Data Science Operations Manager will be responsible to help automate and scale the various stages in the Model Lifecycle. The role will also act as a subject matter expert in model deployments and direct liaison between the business functions and the IT department.

Responsibilities

Develop, lead, and maintain deployment ready Machine Learning model pipelines and pipeline data pipelines in Python & R
Lead the Data Engineering practice for the modeling lifecycle including data and model governance in a test and learn environment
Support activities related to model redevelopment, model calibration, model validation and model risk dashboards in adherence to the industry standards and best practices.
Responsible for seeking opportunities for automation across business operations related to the model outputs and loss projects feeding financial reporting and risk management to improve the efficiencies.
Responsible for building and supporting the Company’s reporting capabilities for key financial, loss, and forecasting requirements.
Develop and lead concept testing and prototype developments related to finance, actuarial and risk management reports/data requirements.
Liaise with key stakeholders to understand their reporting and data requirements.

Skills and Qualifications

University degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Information Systems.
Expert in using Python and Spark libraries (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-learn, Spark ML, etc)
Hands-on experience in various stages of the Model Lifecycle (Feature Engineering, Feature Selection, Hyperparameter tuning, Model Evaluation, etc)
Knowledge of tools such as Feature Store, AutoML, etc
Solid working knowledge of productionizing ML/DL models
Strong organizational skills with ability to manage multiple priorities in a rapidly changing environment.
Display a sense of urgency, ensuring timely and high-quality deliverables to stakeholders.
Ability to work cross-functionally within a matrix organization.
Strong written and verbal communication and facilitation skills with the ability to translate and explain highly technical information for a non-technical audience.
Demonstrated willingness to learn and adopt new tools/techniques, and open to share the knowledge with others.
Good communication and relationship building skills.

Sagen is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive work culture that closely matches the diversity of our customers. We encourage applications from all backgrounds and abilities to ensure we get the best, most creative and diverse talent across our business.

As an Employer Partner of the Canadian Center for Diversity and Inclusion and a member of the Black North Initiative, Sagen encourages you to apply and join a fantastic organization.

As the world's leading provider of cloud-based software and technology solutions delivered by managed service providers (MSPs), Datto believes there is no limit to what small and medium businesses can achieve with the right technology. Datto offers Unified Continuity, Networking, and Business Management solutions and has created a one-of-a-kind ecosystem of MSP partners. These partners provide Datto solutions to over one million businesses across the globe. Since its founding in 2007, Datto continues to win awards each year for its rapid growth, product excellence, superior technical support, and for fostering an outstanding workplace. With headquarters in Norwalk, Connecticut, Datto has global offices in the United Kingdom, Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, Canada, Australia, China, and Singapore. Learn more at datto.com.

We are looking for a hands on manager to lead our Data Engineering team.

A Look Inside the Job:

Work on a fast-paced, cutting edge data warehouse stack using Snowflake database on AWS and airflow to bring disparate data sets from across the enterprise for rich analytics and machine learning
Build and manage a Data Engineering team, including performance management, goal setting, career coaching, etc.
Establish operational objectives and work plans and delegates assignments to the team
Collaborate with business and technology stakeholders to ensure successful data warehouse development and utilization
Create and lead best practices in design, execution, process and delivery
Demonstrate management & leadership dimension; work with & through others, as part of a global team, to meet group objectives & deadlines. Display excellent interpersonal, communication & leadership skills

About You:

Experience leading a data engineering team
Experience using big data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, HBase, Spark, EMR, etc.)
Experience with Airflow, Python, Spark, DBT, Terraform, Snowflake, Git, CI/CD, AWS (EMR, EC2, S3, etc.)
Deep technical skills, including architecture/design, data modeling, and developing services
Creative critical thinker and problem solver with meticulous attention to detail
Ability to function in a fast-paced environment and have the flexibility to change course based on business needs or environmental conditions
Experience designing, building, and maintaining data processing systems
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively advocate technical solutions to engineering teams and business audiences
Benefits:
At Datto, we're committed to cultivating a healthy, positive and growth enabling environment. We are proud of our wide ranging benefits package which is available to all full-time employees, including:
Comprehensive health-care benefits
Flexible paid time off policy
Generous paid paternal leave
"Datto University" virtual on-boarding program
Access to more than 5,000 courses via LinkedIn Learning
Education reimbursement
Employee Assistance Program
Headspace App
Charity match program
A dynamic and socially active work culture, including Employee Resource Groups
Networking and career development opportunities
And more!
Note: We are looking only for candidates willing to join us directly as W2 employees (No 3rd party candidates)

By submitting an application, you acknowledge we will process your data in order to consider you for the position you apply for and for other open positions within our company for which you may be suited. We collect and store your data in accordance with our Recruiting Privacy Practices.

Datto is an equal opportunity employer.

General Profile

1. Manage professionals of customer & business support/production teams
2. Lead others to execute business and operating plans; is accountable for the performance and results
3. Is accountable for leading engagement, initiatives as directed and maintenance of engagement of team members within their business unit
4. Executes business plans and contributes to the development of team and area strategy
5. Decisions are guided by policies, methods, standard and business plans
6. Is accountable for demonstrating corporate values and for being a role model to guide team member demonstration

Technology Function Role

1. Create processes to build and maintain organizational metadata, support institutional data governance by managing the setup, usage, business processes, and building a support model for data governance processes and knowledge management
2. Provide leadership on governance best practices for data creation and partner with business owners enable ongoing KPI, metric, and performance management for Moneris.
3. Lead the architecture and design of Moneris Data Governance tooling and supporting processes to ensure alignment with current and future data management goals and strategy.
4. Ensure data standards are developed, implemented, and followed to protect data assets.
5. Build overall data quality by creating quality measures, and guiding the institution of controls and thresholds for monitoring processes.
6. Typically recognized as a technical expert within a job discipline and requires and broad knowledge of other job disciplines
7. Typically manages a specialized team and is accountable for all program/process delivery within areas managed – contributes to setting of standards and operating strategy within the context of a field of specialty using depth of experience and expertise
8. Accountable for team results, set priorities and allocates resources to align with business plan objectives
9. Handles and resolves escalated issues that are technically complex
10. Provide strategic guidance with respect to MDM best practices. Contributing to the analysis of master data requirements, data integration, and performing complex data mapping activities

Qualifications

1. Bachelor's degree required, or equivalent work experience. Master's degree considered an asset
2. Minimum 5 years of experience working in data governance or equivalent
3. 5+ years data analytics experience
4. Demonstrated expertise in data management and using that skill to deliver enterprise solutions that are focused on self-service and ease of access.
5. Ability to blend technical abilities with communications to persuade business leaders and team members of the advantages of a given approach and explain concepts in simple terms.
6. Ability to motivate and drive technical experts towards common goals and facilitate the building of strategies informed by feedback from various stakeholder groups.
To reduce the risk of COVID-19 transmission and to facilitate a safe return to the office for all employees, clients and vendors, Moneris has developed a vaccination standard that requires all employees and contract resources to be fully vaccinated in order to attend company premises, company events or conduct business travel on behalf of Moneris (and provide proof). Bona fide exemptions may be requested in accordance with legally protected grounds.
Note: We welcome and encourage applications from Indigenous people, people of colour, people with disabilities, people of all genders, sexual orientation and intersectional identities.

The accurate and timely calculation of performance data is an integral part of Guardian’s relationship with itsclients. Accurate performance numbers are required to ensure trust and reassurance. The Manager,Performance Analytics is responsible for the leading the performance measurement team, providing qualityservice to both institutional (GCLP) and private (GCA) clients. In this role, a qualified candidate will facilitatethe delivery of accurate performance reports including NAV-based fund performance, risk adjusted returns,blended benchmark returns and performance composites which comply with GIPS®.ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Leading the team in preparing quarterly risk management reports and ad hoc reports;Ensuring performance calculations and reporting of composites adhere to the Global IndustryPerformance Standards (GIPS®), with the goal of having those composites certified every year;Facilitating the distribution of account performance data to the appropriate internal and external users;Ensuring the calculation and presentation of performance results are prepared in an accurate and timelymanner;Reviewing and verifying all client returns with benchmarks and documenting significant variances frompreliminary to final reports for distribution to internal users;Establishing controls to ensure performance data is synchronized to the portfolio management system and,where possible, to external providers of performance data to our clients prior to the release of performancereturns;Reviewing and analysing all client returns for preparation of special reports, studies and questionnaires;Working closely with GCLP’s Client Service and Marketing Departments to fulfill their specific needs;Providing and maintaining timely and accurate reporting of GCLP assets under management and return datafor use in client reporting, press releases, and consultant surveys;Maintaining details on assets under management data (funds/client accounts/corporate, etc.);Providing training, support, and guidance to analysts in the Performance Analytics Team; andWorking with the Senior Vice-President, Operations and Administration to help establish goals anddevelopment priorities for the Performance Team.QUALIFICATIONS: Post-secondary education in a related field of studyCFA designationMinimum of 5 years of experience, preferably in the calculation of performance returnsExperience effectively managing a teamExperience using SS&C products especially Pacer, Sylvan and SylvanPADExcellent organizational and interpersonal skills and a strong team playerDemonstrated ability to work with all levels of staff and with other departmentsPage 1* of 2*Ability to set effective priorities and meet deadlinesCOMPENSATION: Commensurate with experience_If you are interested in applying for this position, please forward a cover letter and resume in confidence to careers@guardiancapital.com._Guardian Capital is committed to accessibility in employment and to ensuring equal access to employment opportunities for candidates, including personswith disabilities. If you are selected for an interview and you require accommodation due to disability during the recruitment process,_please notify the hiring manager upon scheduling your interview._We thank all applicants for their interest but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Page 2 ofJob Type: Full-time

You are as unique as your background, experience and point of view. Here, you’ll be encouraged, empowered and challenged to be your best self. You'll work with dynamic colleagues - experts in their fields - who are eager to share their knowledge with you. Your leaders will inspire and help you reach your potential and soar to new heights. Every day, you'll have new and exciting opportunities to make life brighter for our Clients - who are at the heart of everything we do. Discover how you can make a difference in the lives of individuals, families and communities around the world.
Job Description:
Reporting to the Director of Research Analytics and Reporting (Global Marketing), the Manager will be directly involved in the integration and analysis of Voice of the Client data to expand Sun Life’s Client Experience (CX) measurement globally. The role will execute on work across the enterprise (Canada, US and Asia) to integrate and analyze Client feedback sources to provide a comprehensive Voice of the Client lens to the organization.
What will you do?
Analyze and integrate Voice of the Client data across multiple business lines in Canada, US and Asia while working with senior team leaders to identify insights in support of the development and execution of Sun Life’s client experience strategy
Help drive a comprehensive Client-centric strategy by proactively delivering insights across the organization that reinforce overall drivers of Client experience and by providing tangible recommendations for CX improvement
Work with key stakeholders to integrate attitudinal and behavioural data to tell a rich Client experience story across all CX research engagements.
What do you need to succeed ?
Proficient at using Client Experience Measurement platform(s) (e.g. Qualtrics, Medallia) to setup, program, field and analyze results from Client satisfaction studies
Experienced at using Tableau as a data visualization tool to report on survey research results (experience using Tableau Server an asset)
Demonstrated expert level knowledge in all facets of Market Research with a particular focus on quantitative research methodologies (prior experience conducting research for Financial Services organizations an asset)
Robust data analytic skillset with direct experience conducting, interpreting and visualizing advanced analytical analysis
Strong proficiency with statistical analysis software (SPSS/R) and the Microsoft Office suite (notably Excel and PowerPoint)
Strong project management skills with the ability to balance multiple projects simultaneously
Capable of managing multiple market research projects through every stage of the project lifecycle from needs identification to reporting
Exceptional communication and writing skills
Comfortable working in a matrix-style organization with multiple stakeholders across the globe, often times jumping on early morning (8am) or late-night calls (8pm) to support our partners in Asia
What will be nice to have?
High level of initiative to prioritize work amidst competing demands and to take projects from the briefing phase to the delivery of final reports/presentations with supervision from senior team leaders
High degree of self-awareness and understands his/her impact on others
An effective listener who seeks to understand first and offers positive/flexible solutions to problems
A team player who works well with cross-functional teams across the enterprise
Energetic, self-starter who enjoys sharing insights in creative and engaging ways
The successful candidate will hold a Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Market Research, Statistics, Consumer Behavior or equivalent
5+ years of relevant experience with preference given to those with both client and vendor experience
What's in it for you ?
Being a member of the Sun Life family, a group of people united by our Purpose: to help Clients and Employees achieve lifetime financial security and live healthier lives
A friendly, collaborative and inclusive culture
Joining a reputable organization with over 150 years of history
The Base Pay range is for the primary location for which the job is posted. It may vary depending on the work location of the successful candidate or other factors. In addition to Base Pay, eligible Sun Life employees participate in various incentive plans, payment under which is discretionary and subject to individual and company performance. Certain sales focused roles have sales incentive plans based on individual or group sales results.
Diversity and inclusion have always been at the core of our values at Sun Life. A diverse workforce with wide perspectives and creative ideas benefits our clients, the communities where we operate and all of us as colleagues. We welcome applications from qualified individuals from all backgrounds.
Persons with disabilities who need accommodation in the application process or those needing job postings in an alternative format may e-mail a request to thebrightside@sunlife.com.
At Sun Life we strive to create a flexible work environment where our employees are empowered to do their best work. Several flexible work options are available and can be discussed throughout the selection process depending on the role requirements and individual needs.
We thank all applicants for showing an interest in this position. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

68,400/68 400 - 111,700/111 700
Job Category:
Advanced Analytics
