At CN, we work together to move our company—and North America—forward. Be part of our Information & Technology (I&T) team, a critical piece of the engine that keeps us in motion. From enterprise architecture to operational technology, our teams use the agile methodology to automate and digitize our railroad ensuring our operations run optimally and safely and our employees can focus on value-added tasks. You will be able to develop your skills and career in our close-knit, safety-focused culture working together as ONE TEAM. The careers we offer are meaningful because the work we do matters. Join us!
Job Summary
The Manager Data Engineering manages a multidisciplinary team of data engineers, data scientists and operational performance specialists. The Manager Data Engineering works with Senior Managers and Directors to help create and drive the strategy, vision, and direction of their team, improving capabilities, processes, methods, tools and setting best practices.
The Manager Data Engineering is responsible for building, managing, and optimizing data pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers. He/She develops best practices and optimizes data pipelines to deliver products and services aligned with business expectations. The incumbent plays a pivotal role in operationalizing data and analytics initiatives, defining and building CN’s data integration and DaaS platform roadmap. The Manager System Engineering is responsible for managing the delivery of technology projects, people and financial resources.
Main Responsibilities
Leading Others Manage employee performance by ensuring employees who are not meeting expectations are identified and supported through the performance improvement process Create and enable a positive and engaging work environment by ensuring individual strengths are uncovered and leveraged through frequent and focused conversations - collaborate, coach and build connections with employees Participate in succession planning by contributing to the yearly talent review cycle and identifying employees with the potential to move up the management and expertise paths Support employee development by having regular career conversations with all employees (documented and tracked) and supporting them in reaching their career goals Ensure knowledge is preserved through cross-training for key skill sets in the team (knowledge transfer) Partner with HR to bring new talent to the organization by determining which skills and roles will be required in the future and by making thoughtful hiring decisions Support recruitment activities; including sourcing and screening candidates, conducting interviews, selection process, onboarding activities, and training coordination when required Provide a positive and welcoming onboarding experience to all new employees by ensuring they have access to the tools and resources needed to fulfill the requirements of their job Recognize employee milestones (service awards, retirements, etc.) as well as significant contributions and enhanced responsibilities Focus on communications and foster collaboration by regularly providing updates to teams about ongoing initiatives and encouraging teams to work together to accomplish common goals and learning
Governance Ensure delivery processes are respected Ensure consistent implementation of the development practices and standards across all projects where involved Continuous alignment with key stakeholder and clients (Project Managers, Product Managers and Solution Managers) Ensure proper reporting mechanism is put in place to provide clear visibility on development progress of projects and enhancements Ensure quality controls with benchmarks are enforced and respected Ensure optimal data delivery architecture and processes are consistent throughout ongoing projects
Data Engineering Delivery Build, manage, and optimize pipelines, moving them effectively into production for key data and analytics consumers
 Manage financials pertaining to pipeline and projects under your supervision Prioritize workload based on identified value and technical constraints Interact with key stakeholders to understand on-going initiatives and upcoming ones Formally allocates personnel from his/her team to the initiatives that have been prioritized Use Agile methodologies to streamline project delivery aligned with goals, timelines, and budget Build monitoring and debugging tools to analyze data pipelines Optimize CN’s data architecture to support the next generation of products and data initiatives Build data and domain event models, implement business rules, and engineer scalable data pipelines Ensure compliance with data governance and security requirements while creating, improving and operationalizing integrated and reusable data pipelines Enable faster data access, integrate data reuse, and improve time-to-solution for data and analytics initiatives Integrate analytics and data science results with business processes Promote effective data management practices
 Ensure Agile development practises for code reviews and testing to develop and deliver data pipelines are respected Ensure test plans and scripts for various data quality processes are completed Work with stakeholders to resolve any development issues in order to ensure project deadlines, budgets and quality standards are met Track progress and reduce the risks associated with lack of adherence to regulations and standards Stay current on major disruptive technology and non-technology trends that affect the Business; provide practical advice and leading practices to overcome any expected challenges
 Communicate status and escalating issues of activities Participate in project team meetings and program status
Requirements
Education/Certification/Designation
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Software Engineering, Data Management, Data Analytics, Information Systems or equivalent degree or experience.
Skills/Knowledge Strong written and oral communication, prioritization, organizational, analytical and time management skills Sound judgment and ability to work effectively with users, management and staff Highly motivated, self-starter with creative problem solving skills Ability to multitask and meet aggressive deadlines efficiently and effectively Extraordinary attention to detail and accuracy Demonstrate ability to learn and understand business processes quickly Ability to work independently and successfully execute projects Ability to consider financial and process impact of decisions Ability to organize, motivate, and focus a team of highly skilled members. Facilitate the resolution of technical disagreement. Demonstrates commitment to high standards of ethics, regulatory compliance, customer service, and business integrity Strong data analytics and development skills Demonstrated creativity skills Expertise in a combination of Scala, Java or Python Expertise with Big Data architecture and distributed computing processes and platforms such as Spark, Kafka, Databricks etc. Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks Knowledge of software engineering best practices such as code reviews, testing frameworks, maintainability and readability
Experience
 Minimum 10-15 years overall work experience Minimum 5 years experience demonstrating leadership qualities and/or overseeing deliverables
 Minimum 5 years of experience in a data engineering role, working in different data management disciplines including data integration, modelling, optimization and quality Experience working in cross-functional teams and collaborating with business stakeholders in support of a departmental or multi-departmental data management and analytics initiative Experience with Big Data technologies
 Experience with Cloud and non-Cloud Experience with Cloud platforms such as Azure, Google Platform or Databricks Experience with traditional data warehousing and ETL tools

Working Conditions This role may require occasional business travel in accordance with CN policy for meetings
About CN
CN is a world-class transportation leader and trade-enabler. Essential to the economy, to the customers, and to the communities it serves, CN safely transports more than 300 million tons of natural resources, manufactured products, and finished goods throughout North America every year. As the only railroad connecting Canada’s Eastern and Western coasts with the Southern tip of the U.S. through a 19,500 mile rail network, CN and its affiliates have been contributing to community prosperity and sustainable trade since 1919. CN is committed to programs supporting social responsibility and environmental stewardship. At CN, we work as ONE TEAM, focused on safety, sustainability and our customers, providing operational and supply chain excellence to deliver results.

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Join us in cultivating a collaborative workplace driven by unique perspectives. We’re proud PwC advances a culture that helps everyone to thrive. It's one of the reasons we're recognized as a "Top Company" to work for in Canada. As you ignite a meaningful career and build a network that’ll last for life, you'll work with people from diverse backgrounds and industries to help solve important problems, empowered by technology to turn today's ideas into tomorrow's solutions. We cultivate an environment in which our differences are embraced and our people feel comfortable bringing their whole selves to work. An empowering and diverse environment starts with you. Are you ready to get started?
A career within Cybersecurity and Privacy services, will provide you with the opportunity to help our clients implement an effective cybersecurity programme that protects against threats, propels transformation, and drives growth. As companies pivot toward a digital business model, exponentially more data is generated and shared among organisations, partners and customers. We play an integral role in helping our clients ensure they are protected by developing transformation strategies focused on security, efficiently integrate and manage new or existing technology systems to deliver continuous operational improvements and increase their cybersecurity investment, and detect, respond, and remediate threats.
Important points to consider
COVID-19 Vaccination Policy: Putting the safety of our people and clients first as we look to a hybrid future: The health, well-being and safety of our colleagues, clients, and communities is our number one priority. Vaccinations have proven to reduce the risk of COVID-19. Effective Friday, October 1, 2021, PwC Canada requires all partners, staff, contractors and visitors to be fully-vaccinated when entering a PwC location, subject to applicable legal exemptions. At PwC, the future ways of work will be a hybrid of in-person and virtual, allowing choice and flexibility to explore new ways of working and collaborating. Read this press release for further details.
This position may require some travel.
Availability to be on-call rotation.
What you'll create and do
As a Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Manage and operate security devices for DLP solutions as the SME, working with DLP products such as Microsoft Data protection suite etc.
Implements change request (CR) that includes patching and upgrades.
Do further troubleshoot and resolves device issues when escalated by device operation analysts and ensure incident identification, assessment, reporting, communication, mitigation and monitoring.
Assists Client Care to get metrics data during reporting period and create reports and dashboards and on device platforms for device operations.
Maintains SOP, playbook and other documentations up-to-date.
Support the sales function by attending client meetings and responding to proposals.
Contribute to the Intellectual Property of the firm by driving the development of toolkits, methodologies, accelerators and training.
Device Management Lifecycle: Device change management – assist transition management of current technologies to future state/ Device configuration management/ Incident management – assist with investigation and reporting/ Ongoing system administration/ System monitoring and operation to ensure overall device performance/ Ensuring high availability and business continuity for client systems/ Recommend configuration enhancement/ Implement configurations/ Capacity management.
Revise and develop processes to strengthen the current Security Operations Framework, Review policies and highlight the challenges in managing SLAs.
Project delivery, as required by the scope of specific client engagements, which includes Assessment/Strategy through to the Design, Implementation and Optimisation of data protection, data privacy principles and regulatory environment solutions and products.
Engagement management, including project planning, budget management, and resource management.
Business development activities throughout the entire opportunity lifecycle, including lead generation, opportunity tracking, pre-sales presentations, technical demos, client & engagement risk assessments, bid management, proposal writing, and contract management.
Practice development, including work on delivery methodology, training, and sales and marketing materials.
Personal professional development as a Data Protection subject-matter specialist, including continuous vendor and industry trainings, attending conferences, specific products and solutions self-study.
Coach and train new and/or more junior team members to become an integral part of the Data Protection team, Cybersecurity & Privacy Consulting practice and PwC family.
What you'll bring to this role
An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work
A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives
Solid mix of business and technical capabilities, and the ability to communicate complex technical and risk management issues to senior executives within the context of their business.
Ability to identify opportunities with clients and propose solutions that meet the client’s needs.
Clear, articulate and confident written and verbal communication skills along with strong presentation and report writing skills.
Ability to develop and manage senior-level relationships and ability to handle high pressure situations with key stakeholders internally and externally.
Strong project management, facilitation and delivery skills with the ability to manage a number of projects, budgets, and resourcing plans to meet deadlines and manage stakeholder expectations.
Proficient in Incident Management and Change Management.
Experience in security device management and hands on experience with two or more DLP platforms.
Knowledge of various operating system flavors including but not limited to Windows and Linux.
Technical designations such as PMP, CISSP, CISA, CISM, OSCP, CEH, ECSA, GPEN, GWAPT and industry certifications from DLP vendors will be considered an asset.
Ability to be recognized as the subject matter specialist in data protection when our client requires
Demonstrates experience providing technical guidance for designing, testing, and implementing data protection solutions (e.g., encryption/tokenization and DLP).
Ability to architect, implement and integrate solutions that provide various data protection capabilities for enterprises.
Demonstrates proven, thorough knowledge of data protection solutions (e.g., encryption / tokenization and data loss prevention) and the capability to interact with end users to understand and document business and functional requirements, architect a solution, and drive technical tasks across the full software development life cycle.
Why you’ll love working for PwC
At PwC, we support you through a range of financial and non-financial rewards and benefits. Discover a life that works for you with our diverse, inclusive and flexible culture. To learn how you can grow and shine in your career at PwC, please visit: https://www.pwc.com/ca/whypwc

Get to know us
Check out our careers blog to hear what our people have to say and discover a place where you can bring your passions and whole self to work. https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers/blog.html
Applying at PwC
At PwC, we embrace new technology where you will learn to innovate and deliver differently. For Administrative, Specialist, Associate, Senior Associate, and Manager roles you may have the opportunity to participate in an on-demand video interview. To learn more about our innovative cloud-based online application interview process click here: https://www.pwc.com/ca/applytopwc
We take your privacy seriously. To protect your personal information, please submit your application directly through PwC Canada Careers: https://www.pwc.com/ca/en/careers.html

Help the customer and systems team test the Workday solution.
Support knowledge transfer and educating customers on the Workday solution.
Support data gathering workshops and manage PwC project data teams.
Develop new skills outside of comfort zone.
Act to resolve issues which prevent the team working effectively.
Analyse complex ideas or proposals from multiple sources of information and learn to build a range of meaningful recommendations.
Address sub-standard work or work that does not meet firm's/client's expectations.
Use data and insights to inform conclusions and support decision-making.

An interest in upskilling for a digital world and technology trends, an openness to learning new tools and adapting how you work.
A demonstrated commitment to valuing differences and working alongside diverse people and perspectives.
A Finance/HR or Technology background.
Exceptional written and verbal communication capabilities.

Experience using ETL tools like PowerBI, Alteryx, SQL or equivalent.
Excellent Excel skills.
Superior detail orientation, organization, and analytical skills.

Overview:

You’ve got big plans. We have opportunities to match, and we’re committed to empowering you to become a better you, no matter what you do.
When you join KPMG you’ll be one of over 227,000 professionals providing audit, tax, advisory and business enablement services across 146 countries.
With the support to do things differently, grow personally and professionally and bring your whole self to work, there’s no limit to the impact you can make. Let’s do this.
The opportunity
KPMG Canada’s Risk Consulting practice applies exponential thinking and emerging technologies to solve today’s challenges. Join a diverse team that is always curious and learning, thinking independently and working collaboratively, has a passion to solve difficult problems for our clients, and has fun doing it.
We have an exciting opportunity for a Manager, Data Analytics to join our team! This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you:
Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills
Have a permanent “figure it out” mindset
What you will do:

You’ll have the opportunity to work across geographies and industries to take on challenging and groundbreaking projects. From analyzing and assessing business processes to improving client performance, you’ll be building strong relationships with our people and developing professional skills that will help set you up for success.
Support our Risk Consulting teams (Governance, Risk & Compliance Services, Technology Risk Consulting, Cyber, Forensics, Financial Risk Management) and work in collaboration with other KPMG service lines (Lighthouse, Deal Advisory, Management Consulting, Audit, Tax) in a cross-functional role to identify, develop and deploy a variety of analytic solutions.
Work closely with clients, regulators, and other stakeholders to understand key business issues.
Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights. Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured).
Lead teams to gather and analyze business requirements, perform relevant analyses, and interpret results to develop impactful recommendations and solutions.
Develop analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.
Design and conduct training and information sessions with KPMG practitioners from across the firm.
Draft detailed professional reports and other client deliverables, such as interactive dashboards, findings and recommendations, summaries of analytical results and insights, etc.
Establish credibility and develop relationships with current and prospective clients.
Provide support/assistance for identification of business opportunities, development of proposals, and prospective client presentations. Assist in shaping our service offerings and go-to-market market strategy.
What you bring to this role:
Post-Secondary education equivalent to a university degree in Business or numerate or analytical disciplines such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics.
5+ years of work experience in a related field. Experience in professional services and Risk Management is an asset.
Strong analytical skills with financial awareness and business acumen.
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tack structured and unstructured data processing problems across a diverse range of industries.
Passion for supporting professional development of the team through the role of a Performance Manager. Mentoring and coaching team members to achieve their goals through professional and personal development.
Experience with data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills in a variety of databases and tools (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, Alteryx, Power Query, Hadoop, Neo4j, etc.), handling very large volumes of data.
Strong experience with visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, other.
Experience building analyses, machine learning, artificial intelligence models and task automations using standard statistical packages or languages (R, Python, Panda, NumPy, MATLAB, Power Pivot, etc.)
Understanding of Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Warehousing and Data Modeling.
Experience or knowledge in one major cloud service: MS Azure (preferred), AWS and/or GCP.
Experience with large scale and or distributed processing methodologies such as Storm, Spark and many others is an asset.
Keys to Your Success
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Curiosity, healthy skepticism, and creativity.
Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
A knack at telling a story with purpose. Knowledge of how specific visual components drive usability and understanding of data discovery and highlighting insights.
Highly motivated to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment
Strong facilitation and collaboration abilities. Committed, able to work independently with minimal supervision and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.
Skilled in building a network and working relationships internally and externally.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Willingness and ability to travel internationally, as required.
Learn more about where a career at KPMG can take you.
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
KPMG is committed to the health and safety of our people, clients and communities. With this commitment in mind, KPMG complies with all public health mandates (provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and has implemented various safety measures, including a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. KPMG's COVID 19 Vaccination Policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated if they wish to or are required to attend a KPMG office and/or other congregate settings in the course of their duties (such as client sites or third-party venues).
As this role requires occasional or consistent attendance at a KPMG office and/or congregate setting, the successful candidate must be fully vaccinated (i.e. have received all doses that are recommended by Health Canada, including any boosters) and must provide KPMG with proof of vaccination. KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.
KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice.
For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.
If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact us at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778.

The Thomson Reuters Manager, Big Data Engineering position is accountable for the overall initiation, transition and on-going maintenance and support of Big Data services to the business. The Service Owner is accountable for the overall service which is delivered through a combination of internal TR employees and external service providers (SP).
In this role you will manage the day-to-day operations of the Big Data engineering and support teams. Additionally, you will work directly with our Big Data Cloud Architect to deliver a set of Big Data services to Thomson Reuters product teams. While this is primarily a team management role, the ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate strong technical aptitude and interest in learning new technologies. While we have historically maintained a strong on-premises presence, The Big Data team is primarily focused on Cloud technology going forward.
About the Role
In this opportunity as, Manager, Big Data Engineering, you will:
Leadership, Process and Communication
Account for the Big Data services to the business users
Work with various external vendors to progress our technology and service requirements
Ensure that the on-going service delivery and support meet or exceed IHN service objectives
Work with internal stakeholders in the organization to understand and translate customer requirements into service changes or improvements and ensure overall service meets those requirements
Ensure consistent and appropriate communication with customer(s) for service-related enquiries and issues
Serve as a point of escalation (notification) for major incidents relating to the service
Account for ensuring all service management functions including service transition, lifecycle management, change management, capacity planning and incident/problem management adhere to TR standards
Conduct annual performance reviews of internal staff
Conduct regular service performance reviews with SP; Identify and address performance issues with SPs
Strategy and Technology
Drive the team’s development and engineering initiatives as the Agile Scrum Master, conducting regular task assignment and review, identifying obstacles, and remediating blockers
Facilitate and manage the team’s engineering backlog in tandem with the Big Data Cloud Architect
Approve new initiatives or changes to existing IT service through governance, to include changes to the service catalog
Conduct regular planning meetings with relevant stakeholders for roadmap and new technology development
Design and maintain Big Data governance processes including standards management, team operating procedures, and cost optimization
Identify opportunities for service improvements, communicate standards and change to internal business users
About You
You’re a fit for the role of, Manager, Big Data Engineering, if you have:
Education and Experience
Bachelor of Computer Science or related field; or equivalent level of experience
6+ years progressive technology experience, including at least 2 years of experience leading teams.
Cloud or Big Data development or administration experience (strongly prefer candidates with either)G
General systems administration experience
Bonus:
Experience with Graph, Relational, or Object databases
Experience with Search, Cache, and Messaging systems
Knowledge and Skills
Proven in-depth experience with IT and leading a team of direct reports
Experience with the management of major 3rd party vendors and outsourcing contracts
Demonstrated experience developing and managing internal and external business relationships
Relationship focused – ability to forge excellent relationships with TR and SP team members at all levels
Strong written and oral communications skills
Analytical, root-cause and solution focused
Strong organizational skills
What’s in it For You?
You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your
personal and professional growth through:
Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote throughout 2021. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
#LI-SMT2
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. At a time when objectivity, accuracy, fairness and transparency are under attack, we consider it our duty to pursue them. Sound exciting? Join us and help shape the industries that move society forward.
Accessibility
As a global business, we rely on diversity of culture and thought to deliver on our goals. To ensure we can do that, we seek talented, qualified employees in all our operations around the world regardless of race, color, sex/gender, including pregnancy, gender identity and expression, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, marital status, citizen status, veteran status, or any other protected classification under applicable law. Thomson Reuters is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer providing a drug-free workplace.
We also make reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and for sincerely held religious beliefs in accordance with applicable law.
Protect yourself from fraudulent job postings click here to know more.
More information about Thomson Reuters can be found on thomsonreuters.com.

We have an exciting opportunity for a Manager, Data Analytics to join our team! This role will be a rewarding experience for you if you:
Thrive on challenges and work best in a fast-paced environment where each day is different
Work well in a project team environment and have strong collaboration and interpersonal skills
Have a permanent “figure it out” mindset
What you will do:

You’ll have the opportunity to work across geographies and industries to take on challenging and groundbreaking projects. From analyzing and assessing business processes to improving client performance, you’ll be building strong relationships with our people and developing professional skills that will help set you up for success.
Support our Risk Consulting teams (Governance, Risk & Compliance Services, Technology Risk Consulting, Cyber, Forensics, Financial Risk Management) and work in collaboration with other KPMG service lines (Lighthouse, Deal Advisory, Management Consulting, Audit, Tax) in a cross-functional role to identify, develop and deploy a variety of analytic solutions.
Work closely with clients, regulators, and other stakeholders to understand key business issues.
Utilize advanced analytical techniques to solve challenging business problems. Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights. Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured).
Lead teams to gather and analyze business requirements, perform relevant analyses, and interpret results to develop impactful recommendations and solutions.
Develop analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.
Design and conduct training and information sessions with KPMG practitioners from across the firm.
Draft detailed professional reports and other client deliverables, such as interactive dashboards, findings and recommendations, summaries of analytical results and insights, etc.
Establish credibility and develop relationships with current and prospective clients.
Provide support/assistance for identification of business opportunities, development of proposals, and prospective client presentations. Assist in shaping our service offerings and go-to-market market strategy.
What you bring to this role:
Post-Secondary education equivalent to a university degree in Business or numerate or analytical disciplines such as Data Analytics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics.
5+ years of work experience in a related field. Experience in professional services and Risk Management is an asset.
Strong analytical skills with financial awareness and business acumen.
Experience working in a multi-disciplinary team to tack structured and unstructured data processing problems across a diverse range of industries.
Passion for supporting professional development of the team through the role of a Performance Manager. Mentoring and coaching team members to achieve their goals through professional and personal development.
Experience with data extraction, analysis, cleansing, quality and manipulation skills in a variety of databases and tools (e.g., SQL, NoSQL, Alteryx, Power Query, Hadoop, Neo4j, etc.), handling very large volumes of data.
Strong experience with visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, other.
Experience building analyses, machine learning, artificial intelligence models and task automations using standard statistical packages or languages (R, Python, Panda, NumPy, MATLAB, Power Pivot, etc.)
Understanding of Master Data Management, Data Governance, Data Warehousing and Data Modeling.
Experience or knowledge in one major cloud service: MS Azure (preferred), AWS and/or GCP.
Experience with large scale and or distributed processing methodologies such as Storm, Spark and many others is an asset.
Keys to Your Success
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
Curiosity, healthy skepticism, and creativity.
Ability to understand and explain business value of data and analytics concepts to non-technical team members.
A knack at telling a story with purpose. Knowledge of how specific visual components drive usability and understanding of data discovery and highlighting insights.
Highly motivated to learn and succeed in a fast-paced environment
Strong facilitation and collaboration abilities. Committed, able to work independently with minimal supervision and flexible to cope with changing priorities and strict deadlines.
Skilled in building a network and working relationships internally and externally.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Willingness and ability to travel internationally, as required.
Learn more about where a career at KPMG can take you.
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters

KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.

The Thomson Reuters Manager, Big Data Engineering position is accountable for the overall initiation, transition and on-going maintenance and support of Big Data services to the business. The Service Owner is accountable for the overall service which is delivered through a combination of internal TR employees and external service providers (SP).
In this role you will manage the day-to-day operations of the Big Data engineering and support teams. Additionally, you will work directly with our Big Data Cloud Architect to deliver a set of Big Data services to Thomson Reuters product teams. While this is primarily a team management role, the ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate strong technical aptitude and interest in learning new technologies. While we have historically maintained a strong on-premises presence, The Big Data team is primarily focused on Cloud technology going forward.
About the Role
In this opportunity as, Manager, Big Data Engineering, you will:
Leadership, Process and Communication
Account for the Big Data services to the business users
Work with various external vendors to progress our technology and service requirements
Ensure that the on-going service delivery and support meet or exceed IHN service objectives
Work with internal stakeholders in the organization to understand and translate customer requirements into service changes or improvements and ensure overall service meets those requirements
Ensure consistent and appropriate communication with customer(s) for service-related enquiries and issues
Serve as a point of escalation (notification) for major incidents relating to the service
Account for ensuring all service management functions including service transition, lifecycle management, change management, capacity planning and incident/problem management adhere to TR standards
Conduct annual performance reviews of internal staff
Conduct regular service performance reviews with SP; Identify and address performance issues with SPs
Strategy and Technology
Drive the team’s development and engineering initiatives as the Agile Scrum Master, conducting regular task assignment and review, identifying obstacles, and remediating blockers
Facilitate and manage the team’s engineering backlog in tandem with the Big Data Cloud Architect
Approve new initiatives or changes to existing IT service through governance, to include changes to the service catalog
Conduct regular planning meetings with relevant stakeholders for roadmap and new technology development
Design and maintain Big Data governance processes including standards management, team operating procedures, and cost optimization
Identify opportunities for service improvements, communicate standards and change to internal business users
About You
You’re a fit for the role of, Manager, Big Data Engineering, if you have:
Education and Experience
Bachelor of Computer Science or related field; or equivalent level of experience
6+ years progressive technology experience, including at least 2 years of experience leading teams.
Cloud or Big Data development or administration experience (strongly prefer candidates with either)G
General systems administration experience
Bonus:
Experience with Graph, Relational, or Object databases
Experience with Search, Cache, and Messaging systems
Knowledge and Skills
Proven in-depth experience with IT and leading a team of direct reports
Experience with the management of major 3rd party vendors and outsourcing contracts
Demonstrated experience developing and managing internal and external business relationships
Relationship focused – ability to forge excellent relationships with TR and SP team members at all levels
Strong written and oral communications skills
Analytical, root-cause and solution focused
Strong organizational skills
What’s in it For You?
You will join our inclusive culture of world-class talent, where we are committed to your
personal and professional growth through:
Hybrid Work Model: Currently, as part of our COVID-19 response, our employees are working remotely and following local COVID-19 bylaws and guidelines with the majority of our offices planning to remain remote throughout 2021. Upon return, we will embrace a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work.
Culture: Globally recognized and award-winning reputation for equality, diversity and inclusion, flexibility, work-life balance, and more.
Wellbeing: Comprehensive benefit plans; company-wide Mental Health Day Off; Headspace app subscription; retirement, savings, tuition reimbursement, and employee incentive programs; resources for mental, physical, and financial wellbeing.
Learning & Development: LinkedIn Learning access; internal Talent Marketplace with opportunities to work on projects cross-company; Ten Thousand Coffees Thomson Reuters café networking.
Social Impact: Eight employee-driven Business Resource Groups; two paid volunteer days annually; Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) initiatives for local and global impact.
#LI-SMT2
Do you want to be part of a team helping re-invent the way knowledge professionals work? How about a team that works every day to create a more transparent, just and inclusive future? At Thomson Reuters, we’ve been doing just that for almost 160 years. Our industry-leading products and services include highly specialized information-enabled software and tools for legal, tax, accounting and compliance professionals combined with the world’s most global news services – Reuters. We help these professionals do their jobs better, creating more time for them to focus on the things that matter most: advising, advocating, negotiating, governing and informing.
We are powered by the talents of 25,000 employees across more than 75 countries, where everyone has a chance to contribute and grow professionally in flexible work environments that celebrate diversity and inclusion. About Restaurant Brands International:

Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with more than $35 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 28,000 restaurants in more than 100 countries. RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands – TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES® and FIREHOUSE SUBS®. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.
Position Overview:

The RBI Business Analytics team is the hub for providing data driven insights to support our business development teams. As the Manager, you will be part of a small team that is responsible for ad hoc analysis, planning, budgeting and reporting across the Burger King, Tim Hortons and Popeyes brands. By leveraging exposure to RBI's broader finance and business development organizations across all business units and geographies, you will create and present relevant results to the senior management team. You are also responsible for providing data driven insights to key stakeholders that will help drive the business.

Roles and Responsibilities:

Creation and optimization of advanced analytics tools and regular reporting of insights derived from them to internal and external audiences, including senior leadership
Uncover long-term opportunities based on research and analysis of our store performance to create actionable strategic insights
Drive companywide efficiencies through standardization of systems, processes and analytics frameworks
Major stakeholder in companywide development execution system rollout implementing process improvements and new analytical frameworks
Build strong working relationships and influence cross-functional teams, including but not limited to; Regional Development Teams, IT, FP&A, Global Business Services (GBS)
Develops and delivers presentations both internally and externally to executive level leadership

Required Skills:
Bachelors or Master's degree in the fields of Business, Economics, Data Science or equivalent field required
5+ years relevant work experience, 2+ year's experience working in analytics, project management and/or FP&A experience preferred
Strong understanding of the fundamentals of statistical modelling, data science and analytics
Advanced analytical skillset with ability to transform data into action plans, advanced proficiency excel modeling and super user of data visualization software (Smartsheet, Power BI, VBA, etc.)
Experience collaborating with cross-functional teams (Technology, Finance, Business Development) to drive results/projects demonstrating effective communication, influencing and organizational skills
Start-up mentality with ability to perform under pressure and adapt to a fast-paced environment working with a lean team
Honesty, high integrity, personal accountability, ownership mentality and a passion for the success of the company, the team, and personal career growth


Preferred Skills:
Knowledge in one or more general-purpose programming languages (SQL, Python, Java, etc.)

Restaurant Brands International and all of its affiliated companies (collectively, RBI) are equal opportunity and affirmative action employers that do not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state, provincial or federal laws, rules, or regulations. RBI's policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment. Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities upon request.

Who we are:
Geotab ® is a global leader in IoT and connected transportation and certified “Great Place to Work™.” We are a company of diverse and talented individuals who work together to help businesses grow and succeed, and increase the safety and sustainability of our communities.
Geotab is advancing security, connecting commercial vehicles to the internet and providing web-based analytics to help customers better manage their fleets. Geotab’s open platform and Geotab Marketplace ®, offering hundreds of third-party solution options, allows both small and large businesses to automate operations by integrating vehicle data with their other data assets. Processing billions of data points a day, Geotab leverages data analytics and machine learning to improve productivity, optimize fleets through the reduction of fuel consumption, enhance driver safety and achieve strong compliance to regulatory changes.
Our team is growing and we’re looking for people who follow their passion, think differently and want to make an impact. Ours is a fast paced, ever changing environment. Geotabbers accept that challenge and are willing to take on new tasks and activities - ones that may not always be described in the initial job description. Join us for a fulfilling career with opportunities to innovate, great benefits, and our fun and inclusive work culture. Reach your full potential with Geotab. To see what it’s like to be a Geotabber, check out our blog and follow us @InsideGeotab on Instagram, Twitter or Facebook. Join our talent network to learn more about job opportunities and company news.

At Geotab, all staff must be fully vaccinated in order to be eligible to work in our North American offices at this time. Accordingly, any job offer for an onsite position resulting from this posting will be conditional upon the successful candidate providing evidence of full vaccination. Accommodations may be made for those who cannot be vaccinated based on medical or other legally protected grounds.
Geotab policies and requirements are subject to change based on local or federal guidelines.
Who you are:

We are always looking for amazing talent who can contribute to our growth and deliver results! Geotab is seeking a Data Analytics, Team Lead who will be responsible for leading a technical team of data scientists, and data extract, transform and load (ETL) developers in order to provide enriched datasets and gain useful insight out of raw data, plan projects, and build analytical models. If you love technology, and are keen to join an industry leader — we would love to hear from you!
What you’ll do:
As a Data Analytics, Team Lead your key area of responsibility will be Manage a team of data scientists and data ETL developers in the implementation of new statistical or mathematical methodologies for specific models or firmware issues/performance analysis.
To be successful in this role you will be a self-starter with strong written and verbal communication skills, and have the ability to quickly understand complex, technical concepts. In addition, the successful candidate will have strong analytical and project management skills with an ability to identify needs, develop effective solutions, and manage projects through completion. The successful candidate will also be able to manage multiple timelines and contrasting priorities to ensure timely results.
How you’ll make an impact:
Manage a team of data scientists and data ETL developers in the implementation of new statistical or mathematical methodologies for specific models or firmware issues/performance analysis.
Interact with Geotab’s big data infrastructure using cloud-based data warehouses (i.e. Google BigQuery) and various programming languages (i.e. SQL, Python).
Research and develop statistical and machine learning models for data analysis.
Mine and analyze company data, especially raw device data to drive optimization and improvement of product development, and business strategies.
Collaborate with firmware teams and stakeholders from other departments to identify requirements and define metrics of success for the team to work on.
Assist with device troubleshooting and provide meaningful insights using BigQuery data and develop useful data analysis tools to improve efficiencies.
Lead the strategies of the A/B testing for GO product quality and firmware quality for the department.
Test performance of data-driven products, and ensure the quality and integrity of the data products, including tables, dashboards and monitors that the team provided.
Ensure data quality and integrity.
Develop and implement strategies with the team to assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Work with stakeholders throughout Geotab to identify opportunities for leveraging company data to drive business solutions.
Provide expert project leadership and guidance to the team as SME.
Work as a project manager to provide roadmap for products and projects that the team is working on.
Work as a product owner to clarify the requirements from stakeholders continuously and guide the development to the right direction.
Oversee the activities and performance of direct reports.
Provide direction, coaching, and mentorship to the team.
Engage in the development of the team by coaching, providing feedback, identifying areas of growth, and training opportunities.
Collaborate and support employees during the performance management process, meeting KPAs, and career development planning.
Support Geotab global strategic initiatives.
What you’ll bring to this role:
5-8 years experience as a Data Scientist/Analyst or similar role.
Experience in writing SQL queries.
Experience in programming in Python.
Knowledge of data ETL pipeline, data management and visualization techniques.
Affinity for statistical analysis and predictive modeling.
Experience working within a technical or engineering organization, with knowledge of the high-technology industry is an asset.
High accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
Strong project management skills; able to identify needs, develop effective solutions, and manage projects through to completion.
Must stay relevant to technology and have the flexibility to adapt to the growing technology and market demands.
Leadership experience in a team-oriented workplace.
Success with coaching and development of employees.
Hand-on experience in Agile development style.
Strong analytical skills with the ability to problem solve to well-judged decisions.
Strong team-player with the ability to engage with all levels of the organization.
Technical competence using software programs, including but not limited to, Google Suite for business (Sheets, Docs, Slides).
Entrepreneurial mindset and comfortable in a flat organization.
If you don't see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed above, we still encourage you to apply.
Why job seekers choose Geotab:
Work from home and flex work arrangements
Baby bonus & parental leave top up program
Home office reimbursement program
Online learning and networking opportunities
Electric vehicle purchase incentive program
Competitive medical and dental benefits
Retirement savings program

The above are offered to full-time permanent employees only
How we work:
At Geotab, we understand that the world is always changing and that we need to change with it. Geotab has adopted a hybrid model for working, including a flexible work from home program, with the opportunity to work in our safe, clean offices. When working from home, you are required to have a reliable internet connection with at least 50mb DL/10mb UL. Virtual work is supported with cloud-based applications, collaboration tools and asynchronous working. The health and safety of employees are a top priority. We encourage work-life balance and keep the Geotab culture going strong with online social events, chat rooms and gatherings. Join us and help reshape the future of technology!
We believe that ensuring diversity is fundamental to our future growth and progress and is an integral part of our business. We believe that success happens where new ideas can flourish – in an environment that is rich in diversity and a place where people from various backgrounds can work together. We will ensure the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities are taken into account as part of performance management, career development, training and redeployment processes. Responsibilities:
Context
At the heart of EcoStruxure Power and Schneider Electric new equity story, Digital Services has a unique positioning at the core of Schneider Electric digital strategy. Doubling its revenue year on year, Digital Services offers a high-growth environment that requires a unique set of key competences and offers a unique positioning to develop new value spaces and new revenue streams.
Digital Services combines the great working environment of schneider electric with the innovation, opportunities, and dynamic atmosphere of a start-up.
Our organization is a fast-paced working environment with a unique chance to solve customers and operations problems where honest and open feedback is encouraged as new aguile process, governance, organization are being refined.
If you are someone who embraces changes with a positive attitude you will have the opportunity to collaborate with senior management in many levels to shape the future and motivate a talented team of experts. We ambrace great communication and thrives on building and maintaining strong relationships with others.
Job Description
Part of the Digital Services Product Management team, reporting to Product Management VP, the Data Centers Segment Offer Leader has a leading role in accelerating growth through the transformation of our offer portfolio for the Data Centers Segment.
Your mission is to drive the structure and attributes of our Digital Services offers to match the customer expectations and market drivers of the segment he leads.
You will own the 4P’s (product, place, price, promotion) and will work closely with practice leaders (asset management, power management, cybersecurity …), will own to define the right Go-to-Market and Business Models (Managed Services through existing Advisors or through Service Plans, SaaS, Data as Services), ensure the offer readiness and monitor / improve its performance.
As Segment Offer Leader, your main missions are:
Market expertise
Have a deep understanding of the size & dynamics of your end-user segments
Understand the Customer Persona, Customer Needs (pain & pleasure points), and Willingness to Pay
Landscape of existing Schneider solutions and competitive solutions in the market (Siemens, ABB, other Power Quality, Critical Power & Cooling, IT infrastructure moniotring)
Portfolio Management
Define the attributes of “winning” offer portfolio, tailored for your segments, encompassing offers needed, go to market strategy and the right business models for success
Write and accountable for the business casse of the segment offer
Propose when applicable new innovation, technology or commercial parterns for success
Drive the test & validation of the performance of the offer (vs. winning attributes)
Influence the Strategic Road Map of Offers
Funnel the business requirements into the backlogs of one or multiple products, platforms or partners roadmaps
Work with each Product Owners and League leaders for prioritization and refinement of the requirements into respective roadmaps, joining the Agile rituals and governance of the League
Business owner
Monitor the performance of the offer for his segment
Build and follow improvement plan, in coordination with Digital Services commercial teams (category management & segment sales)
Tactically support country and strategic accounts teams in pre-sales
(External) English Qualifications:

Experience & Skills
Strong expertise in the Data Centers, Colo segment, in previous company or within segments teams
Background in offer management or strategic marketing
Energy Management, Services, Software, Cloud and System experience a plus
Comfortable with collaboration up, down and accross
Ability to work across multiple streams of work and time horizons will be a major differentiator
Good communication skills

Join our WINNING team as a Digital Analytics Manager
When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th through Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” is taken to new heights. Even today, while working remotely, our culture is strong and our team is connected!
Do you love empowering product, marketing and engineering teams through data analysis and insights? If so, then CARFAX may be your best career move! The CARFAX Digital Analytics Manager will be leading a team of analysts who consistently deliver actionable insights that drive value for the business. This person is the subject matter expert for Marketing Analytics platforms that help collect, interpret, report, and govern tags for various products that CARFAX has to offer. This person has a proven track record of data story-telling that influences and inspires at all levels of the organization.
As a Digital Analytics Manager, you will:
Manage and build a team of analysts to support internal stakeholders with analysis, insights, reporting and tag/privacy governance
Define, articulate, and execute the data analytics strategy across all marketing and consumer experience channel
Empower marketing and product teams to make better and faster data-driven decisions
Develop regular communication, presentations and reporting on metrics, insights, product performance and ROI analysis
Analyze data from large data sets into clear insights and present information to technical and non-technical audiences
Connect multiple data points in new ways to make sense of complex and ambiguous situations
Assist leadership with data strategy, business planning and presentation development
Stay well-informed of enterprise data, analytics, and the privacy industry to identify opportunities and maintain governance
To be considered for this role, you will need:
10+ years of experience with Marketing Analytics platforms (Adobe Analytics, GA, Adobe Launch, GTM DMP, CDP)
7+ years of experience in an analyst role at a large-scale organization
3+ years of leadership experience, managing and coaching a team of analysts
Experience leading/managing implementations of Martech tools/technologies across large-scale organization
Deep knowledge/experience with data schema, digital analytical tools, and tag management systems
Ability to influence, challenge and collaborate with leaders in Product, UX, Marketing, BI, Engineering
Excellent written and verbal communication with the ability to influence and inspire
Results oriented – strong focus on achieving revenue, conversion, sales, and other marketing goals. Ability to use metrics to manage programs and measure success
Proactive and self-motivated with a strong sense of ownership. Identifies what needs to be done and has a bias toward action.
Proficient at programming in languages like SQL, R and/or Python
Experience building business models and forecasting is a plus

Requisition ID: 139779

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose:
The Manager, Pricing Analytics is accountable for driving strategic analysis to support Pricing, Acquisition and Campaign strategies for the Retail Deposits and Savings portfolios. The incumbent will deliver strategic and tactical knowledge to facilitate the execution of strategies that will enable profitable growth of Deposit customer base, increase customer engagement, and optimize margins of acquisition and engagement campaigns. She/He will work with multiple stakeholders and partners within and outside Scotiabank to develop optimal strategies based on excellent analytical, database marketing, people management, communication, and relationship management skills.
Accountabilities:
 Accountability 1 – Analytics and Business case
Collaborate with Retail Deposits, Channel and Acquisition/Engagement teams to profitably grow customer base. Proactively provide strategic analysis and business casing that will assist the business to optimize new & existing accounts and product mix from various channels, optimize opportunity to acquire non-Scotiabank customersWork closely with marketing team to develop analytical and segmentation strategies that enhance Deposit customer engagement initiatives while optimizing budgets as well as margins.Collaborate with Retail Marketing and Decision Sciences teams to implement and fulfill campaigns while ensuring seamless customer experience.Collaborate with Campaign Design, Products, Decision Sciences and Retail Marketing teams to support optimal acquisition and customer migration initiatives driven through centralized campaign execution engine.Work closely with segmentation/modeling experts within or outside Scotiabank to create new and effective ways of targeting customers to maximize efficiency of acquisition campaign strategies.Continuously acquire and enhance knowledge of business/product strategies, competitive practices, market insights and other policies, technical processes, and advanced analytical tools/methodologies to best provide business solutions to all key constituentsEffectively manage and prioritize multiple business initiatives, projects, and ad-hoc analysis with business stakeholders and/or external partners/consultants.Provide actionable insights and recommendations to incumbent's manager and other stakeholders on an ongoing basis to maximize business results and enable the creation of an ongoing learning loop.Identification of portfolio trends and key statistics using advanced analytics; Effective and timely communication of strategic and operational results to the business teams.Provide business support to all areas of Retail Deposits including Business development, Product, Acquisition and Analytics. Work with Finance and Business Transformation teams to report results to Senior Management as well as provide outlook/projection

Accountability 2 – Pricing Analytics and Reporting
Support the revenue and volume growth for each of the products through providing advanced analytical pricing solutionsinfluence Scotia’s strategic decisions on consumer pricing (rates / fees) and other consumer behavior initiatives.
Education and Experience:
2+ years related experience in Analytics in Financial or related industry2+ years analytical experience required including statistical analysisMust be proficient in using SAS / Python and Hadoop platforms for dataProficient in the use of building complex financial models using python and Hadoop frameworksExcellent verbal and written communication skills essential with clients, vendors, and management analysis and should be able to communicate data story to non-technical audiencesStrong prioritizing, planning, project management, and relationship building skills
Educational Requirements:
Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Engineering or StatisticsMBA (Finance or Marketing)/CFA or Master in Analytics - preferred
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Primary Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada
All Available Locations: Toronto
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems.
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Are you interested in growing your career within the intersections of design, business, and technology? Do you love to solve complex business problems using creative methods? Does the potential between user-centered design and new technologies excite and aspire you to make data-driven design decisions, and above all, to be involved in using data to create meaningful stories that are not only beautiful, but impactful? If that is you, then Omnia AI is where you want to be.
What will your typical day look like?
As a Design Lead, you’ll be leading a team within a fast-paced and highly collaborative environment, working closely with our industry practitioners and leaders from multiple disciplines. As a member of cross-functional AI & Analytics solution delivery teams, you will be responsible for leading and managing the end-to-end design process and resources for a variety of client projects and industries. We’re looking for a well-rounded design leader who is passionate about design process, human-centered approach to how data is consumed by our clients, with a focus on information design, UX/UI design, and data-driven strategic visual communication. You’ll be a driver educating the value of design to our clients and helping us grow our unique design practice for AI & Analytics.
You will:
Lead and execute strategy and solution with – Provide oversight and mentor a core delivery team comprised of different skillsets to execute the end-to-end delivery of key results in alignment with business objectives while managing expected scope and effort within set timelineActively engage with clients and stakeholders – Build rapport and client trust to create a meaningful overall engagement experience and deliver resultsBe the advocate of user experience – Understand that a solution is not just a tool; but part of an interactive process between human users and dataLead and facilitate the design thinking process – Plan, schedule and conduct design workshops to gather user requirements through UX exercises (user flows, personas, story mapping) and owning documentation of process and outcomesBridge multiple perspectives to communicate and rationalize design decisions effectively - Act as design mediator between business needs, user needs and technical feasibility throughout the design thinking processGuide designers to deliver desirable visual concepts – Provide oversight to produce low to high-fidelity wireframes and screen mock-ups for interactive data visualization dashboards, AI and analytics solution applications, applying UI and information design best practicesEffectively manage project scope and resources to meet milestones – Drive defining the end-to-end project objective and goal, validate business and technical requirements to scope level of effort for projectsCollaborate extensively with clients, lead design thinking workshops, orchestrate UX exercises (user flow/workflow, story mapping) and documentation of the process and outcomesReview and provide quality assurance for low through high-fidelity wireframes and screen mock-ups for interactive data visualization dashboards, AI and analytics solution applicationsWork through iterative cycles, incorporate feedback, complete user testing and quality checks, and hand over assets to the development teamLearn and grow your career supported by passionate leaders and teammates
About the team
Omnia AI, Deloitte’s Artificial Intelligence (AI) practice is comprised of a collaborative team of experts who use their hands-on experience with cutting-edge information assets to facilitate successful AI transformations. We develop AI-enabled solutions to address all aspects of a client’s transformative journey with disciplined focus on business outcomes.
Our Visual Analytics & Information Design practice marries data analytics, information design, and visualization, ensuring the clean and effective presentation of information, and involves a multi-disciplinary approach to communication. Driven by user-centered design frameworks, our cross-functional practice encompasses principles from design thinking, graphic design, UI/UX design, communication theory, business strategy, data transformation, data architecture and data science. Solving complex business problem with custom interactive visualizations, we enable users to gain greater insights that will directly support impactful business decision making.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are an experienced, versatile design leader, who:
Has 3+ years of experience in a design leadership role managing designersHas 5+ years of professional experience working as a designer (UX/UI design, visual design, web & digital design, interaction design) at an agency, consultancy or equivalentHas a university degree or post-secondary education in disciplines of design or equivalent professional working experienceHas an online portfolio demonstrating breadth of executed design products outlined with clear objectives, goals, process in arriving at the solution, values, and outcomesIs proficient with tools such as Figma/Sketch (or other prototyping tools), Adobe CC Suite (Illustrator, Photoshop, InDesign, XD), non-traditional design tools such as Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, Word, and collaboration tools such as MiroDemonstrates grit and thrives in challenges, a self-starter and collaborative team player with a proactive work ethicEnjoys and is adept in learning with the flow, is interested in diverse perspectives and approaches, with the ability to quickly dive into a new domain, process, and conceptLoves to think ‘less is more’ and has a passion for delivering simple and effective solutions to complex business problemsIs a persuasive communicator/storyteller and can effectively explain complex concepts to stakeholders at all levelsCan work in dynamic conditions, and transition quickly between collaborative and individual workCan navigate difficult discussions and ambiguity to arrive at design solutionsIs a collaborative orchestrator, facilitates working sessions to bring user-centered design thinking to translate complex business and technical problems into design solutionsCan apply design processes to reconcile business and user problems to generate sensible, enticing visual solutionsCan confidently execute a variety of design outputs such as prototypes, wireframes, user flow, user journey and story mapping, under pressureIs eligible for Enhanced Reliability security clearance with the Government of CanadaHas French language skills (written and spoken) - an asset
Our shared values
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.
Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.
Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.
Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.
Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.
The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You?
At Deloitte we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities! Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates that represents the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes candidates from Indigenous communities in support of living our values and our commitments to our Reconciliation Action Plan . We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation in the recruitment process, or need this job posting in an alternative format. We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
 Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.
