Description
We are the TELUS Data Strategy & Enablement team and our mission is to drive TELUS to become a world-class data insights driven organization, delivering world-class data analytics capabilities built upon unified scalable platforms, advanced AI tooling, high quality data and a data-product/data platform oriented culture.
Our team members are passionate, dynamic, entrepreneurial and highly engaged, driven to achieve great outcomes for our customers, our team members, our communities and our environment. We believe in continuous meaningful transformation integrating dynamic change in our professional lives. Our team members are always learning, experimenting and applying tuition value into everything we do.

Join our team

We are searching for a talented candidate to become our team’s Manager, Data Engineering Platforms. Reporting to the Director – Data Engineering Platforms, the successful candidate will be responsible for leading a team of accomplished data analysts, engineers and architects supporting our data and analytics platform transformation. This role will be an agent of change and support the evolving strategy, data and analytics roadmaps as well as provide overarching direction for our Customer 360 portfolio which enables our business units to have curated and actionable insights enabling TELUS to offer unparalleled customer experiences while also allowing our teams to constantly learn and innovate as we customized and developed new products. Our team is a cloud first team and leverages the latest technologies to fuel our mission and purpose.
Qualifications

At TELUS, we put ‘Customers First’. With a broad set of responsibilities and a high degree of visibility across the TELUS organization, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to:

Lead a team of talented data platform Analysts, Engineers and Architects to drive the modernization of our data platforms
Foster internal and external stakeholder relationships, including managing senior executive participants
Construct comprehensive business cases and financial models leveraging various methods to support strategic projects and decisions with data driven insights
Utilize internal and external data points coupled with market research on marketplace dynamics impacting TELUS and the Data Strategy team to inform opportunities and risks for the team
Create technology roadmaps for business partners, executive management, and external audiences to enhance strategic decision making and support technology investment recommendations
Collaborate with key stakeholders to create, track and evolve the team scorecards and strategic imperatives
Support the annual strategic and financial planning process
Flex your communication, negotiation, and influencing skills, working with a broad set of internal stakeholders, executives and external partners
Mentor, lead, and support a diverse and very talented team

You're the missing piece of the puzzle

You have experience in technical leadership, managing data platforms, business intelligence tools and setting architectural direction
You can communicate clearly and effectively in both technical and business matters able to translate technical considerations into business implications
You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate business requirements into high-level design models
You have hands on knowledge of foundational cloud data architecture of lakes, warehouses, data modeling, and life cycle management
You have demonstrated experience with the governance and oversight of data privacy, security and the ethical use of data in previous roles
You have experience with cloud migration projects, agile methodologies, and DevOps practices
You have impressive people leadership track record with proven ability to recruit, coach, mentor and lead high performing teams in a fast-paced environment
You are a skilled relationship builder and skilled at prioritization, negotiation and influencing
You can pivot between supporting the urgent needs of the business and the long-term roadmap
You have experience working on and supporting large, complex technical projects that involve multiple stakeholders and business units
You have exposure to tools, technologies and programming languages including, but not limited to, Python, Airflow (composer), SQL, Apache Nifi, Hivel, Spark, Dataflow (Apache Beam) and Kafka
You have experience creating a vision for and implementing a culture of change to drive CI/CD, DevOps and other opportunities for operational effectiveness


Great-to-haves:
Bachelor of Computer Science or equivalent
5+ years of progressive and relevant work experience with enterprise data
Experience with the data offerings in the Google Cloud Platform
Excellent communication skills and ability to lead a large team

Our Purpose
At Deloitte, we are driven to inspire and help our people, organization, communities, and country to thrive. Our Purpose is to build a better future by accelerating and expanding access to knowledge. Purpose defines who we are and gives us reason to exist as an organization.
By living our Purpose, we will make an impact that matters.
Learn from deep subject matter experts through mentoring and on the job coaching
Leverage the Deloitte CPA Advantage program, a comprehensive support program for CPA modules and the CFE.
Be encouraged to deepen your technical skills…whatever those may be.
Build your leadership skills at Deloitte University.
Have many careers in one Firm.
Partner with clients to solve their most complex problems
Enjoy flexible, proactive, and practical benefits that foster a culture of well-being and connectedness.
Enjoy My Benefit Dollars - a flexible benefit to support your physical, financial and emotional well-being.
Experience a firm where wellness matters.
Experience MyFlex and an agile work environment where work is what you do not where you do it
Experience MyFlex where reduced hours or seasonal work allows you to meet your personal goals.
Build a network of colleagues for life
Have an impact that matters through pro bono and significant volunteer opportunities.
Be empowered to lead and have impact with clients, our communities and in the office.
Be expected to share your ideas and to make them a reality.
Be part of a firm that leads the way and pushes themselves to look like contemporary Canada.
Grow your network and your knowledge by joining one of our many Employee Resource Groups.
 
Do you thrive on developing creative and innovative insights to solve complex challenges? Want to work on next-generation, cuttingedge products and services that deliver outstanding value and that are global in vision and scope? Work with premier thought leaders in your field? Work for a world-class organization that provides an exceptional career experience with an inclusive and collaborative culture?
What will your typical day look like?
Collaborate with internal clients, project team members, and other Deloitte teams on program planning, program integration, project management, and technical integration activities.
Define implementation priorities, tracking against development schedules and work intake requests, advising on risk mitigations, coordinating with PMO and program oversight teams, and maintaining up-to-date operating models, processes, roles, and responsibilities across multiple clients.
Work in an agile/hybrid environment with customers across Deloitte to define and prioritize business requirements for DFlow products.
Manage projects with high technical complexity, complex customer relationships and/or projects from requirements definition through to delivery
Responsible for executing help desk processes to meet KPIs. May include providing customer support, resolving escalated tickets, and working with clients as needed.
Work with the expanded team to lead and to continuously improve and manage the product lifecycle system including gathering requirements, creating epics, features, and user stories, facilitating, identifying process (outside the technology) to support business objectives, and operations and maintenance activities for example, open, support, and close processes. Other activities as required.
Research emerging and innovative technologies and identify areas where DFlow can innovate to achieve additional features and keep pace with Deloitte’s platforms and technology.
About the team
Deloitte Global Culture:
At Deloitte, we expect results. Incredible—tangible—results. And Deloitte Global professionals play a unique role in delivering those results. We reach across disciplines and borders to serve our global organization. We are the engine of Deloitte. We develop and lead global strategies and provide programs and services that unite our network. In Deloitte Global, everyone has an opportunity to lead. We see the importance of your perspective and your ability to create value. We want you to fit in—with an inclusive culture, focus on work-life fit and well-being, and a supportive, connected environment; but we also want you to stand out—with opportunities to have a strategic impact, innovate, and take the risks necessary to make your mark. Deloitte Global supports our talented professionals in answering the question: What impact will you make?
Global CoRe provides seven fundamental services to Deloitte around the world: knowledge services, creative services, contact center, data management assessment services, data protection, procurement, and real estate. We develop new and innovative ways to improve how these services are delivered across the organization, leveraging our global scope and strength to serve our organization within and across borders.
Enough about us, let’s talk about you
You are someone with:
Minimum of 3 years of relevant experience with SharePoint
Minimum of 2 years of experience with Microsoft 365
Ability to be a self-starter with strong communication and leadership skills and an in-depth hands-on work experience with large-scale implementations of MS products, SharePoint and/or Azure
Experience with MS 365 Collaboration, SharePoint on-prem, SharePoint Online, MS Teams
Experience in working as a certified scrum product owner (CSPO) and maintaining the Product backlog
Business-Technical understanding with ability to communicate technical concepts to a non-technical audience if needed
Desire to take the initiative, move projects/ideas forward with clarity
Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist (MCTS)
Our shared values
While our Purpose guides us and helps explain why we exist, our shared values describe the behaviour we expect from each other at the firm.
They provide common ground to unite us across cultures and geographies. They help us to earn the trust and respect of our stakeholders. We all commit to living by these shared values, to stay true to the principles they represent, and to honour the legacy from which they came. They are what sets us apart and makes us Deloitte.
Every day, we live our Purpose through the following five shared values:
Lead the way: Deloitte is not only leading the profession, but reinventing it for the future. We’re also committed to creating opportunity and leading the way to a more sustainable world.

Serve with integrity: Deloitte has earned the trust of employees, clients, regulators, and the public for 175 years. Upholding that trust is our single most important responsibility.

Take care of each other: We look out for one another and prioritize respect, fairness, development, and well-being.

Foster inclusion: We are at our best when we foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. We know this attracts top talent, enables innovation, and helps us deliver well-rounded client solutions.

Collaborate for measurable impact: We approach our work with a collaborative mind¬set, teaming across businesses, geographies, and skill sets to deliver tangible, measurable, attributable impact.
The next step is yours
Sound like The One Firm. For You?
At Deloitte, we are all about doing business inclusively – that starts with having diverse colleagues of all abilities. Deloitte encourages applications from all qualified candidates who represent the full diversity of communities across Canada. This includes, but is not limited to, people with disabilities, candidates from Indigenous communities, and candidates from the Black community in support of living our values, creating a culture of Diversity Equity and Inclusion and our commitment to our AccessAbility Action Plan, Reconciliation Action Plan and the BlackNorth Initiative.
We encourage you to connect with us at accessiblecareers@deloitte.ca if you require an accommodation for the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials, accessible meeting rooms or other accommodations). We’d love to hear from you!
By applying to this job you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte experience globally.
Deloitte Canada has 30 offices with representation across most of the country. We acknowledge our offices reside on traditional, treaty and unceded territories as part of Turtle Island and is still home to many First Nations, Métis, and Inuit peoples. We are all Treaty people.
job_title: Global Program Manager, DFLow, Deloitte Global CoRe Digital, Data, Analytics & Innov

job_description:
Location:
Toronto, ON, CA Calgary, AB, CA Halifax, Nova Scotia, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Ottawa, ON, CA Winnipeg, MB, CA
Req ID: 22240
Jobs by Category: Digital
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time
Schedule: Regular
Description

Join our team
TELUS Digital is a customer-driven and product-minded team within TELUS, responsible for our company’s digital evolution. We simplify the path to production so teams can focus on what matters most. We value and continuously support organizations across Canada that are empowering people in our local communities with digital knowledge and skills.

The Data Analytics Platform team is responsible for delivering Customer and team member experience impact through Data and Data Analytics insights and for driving commercial outcomes through advanced analytics and predictive models used in personalization and humanization of customer digital journeys.

Learn more about our team at telus.com/digital
Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together


As a Product Manager you will be working on high priority projects/programs of significant size and scope that focus on building and enabling foundational digital capabilities that will be the evolution of Data Analytics and Personalization in TELUS.


You will work in collaboration with multiple cross functional teams to build viable, scalable and re-usable Digital products and foundational capabilities and to drive Business Enablement and Readiness aspects of capability launches.
Here’s how
Collaborate effectively and efficiently across multiple disciplines and organizational boundaries to gather product requirements, priorities and business impact
Own, manage and maintain a product roadmap and business requirements backlog through close engagement and collaboration with cross functional teams
Understand the product’s vision and scope as well as the business outcomes and customer experience we are trying to achieve to ensure that a customer centric approach is considered and the quality of telus.com experience is optimal
Develop, secure, support, implement and articulate a differentiated and effective product strategy
Deliver impactful, concise, and effective communications and presentations to all levels of the business both internally and externally
Work closely with all other members of the team to ensure that the strategy you have set out fits within the larger business Strategy and outcomes
Develop operational model including communication and adoption plan, feedback and incident management processes
Recognize process improvement opportunities, provide recommendations and operationalize new processes that will drive better customer or team member experience
Develop an effective network of business relationships across digital and our stakeholders
Qualifications

You’re the missing piece of the puzzle
You have 5+ year work experience in an analytical or marketing focused role
You are able to coordinate multiple initiatives in the portfolio and work within an environment of rapid change
You are able to communicate the strategic vision for long-term product roadmap of large and complex products
You excel in a business ownership environment
You are a proven communicator and are comfortable presenting to senior leaders
You are curious to develop an understanding for and leverage data-driven insights that result in continuous improvements
You have strong negotiation skills to mitigate potential conflicts of interest that may occur between the different TELUS digital outcome teams, stakeholders and partners
You are able to create and drive business models, leveraging a data-driven approach, to support our strategic priorities
You are accustomed to an extremely fast-paced environment, requiring juggling of multiple deadlines
You are recognized as a strong, collaborative team member

Great-to-haves
Post-secondary education in Marketing or Business
Familiarity with the structure of TELUS products and services, organizational delivery capabilities, and TELUS end-to-end processes
Proven knowledge and understanding of digital industry
Post-secondary degree in business, computer science, or information technology
About TELUS Digital:


We want to work with people who:
Share our passion for all things digital
Thrive in an agile, lean and fast-paced environment
Clearly see things from the perspective of our customers
Are curious, experiment and never stop learning
View collaboration as essential to your work
Utilize the power of data to inform decisions
Embrace diversity and new ideas

What you can expect from us:
An environment where you’re encouraged to share and act on your ideas
Flexible work hours remote or in a central downtown location
During COVID, provide the tools and resources you need to work effectively and comfortably from a remote location
A welcoming, relaxed office with a casual dress code
A culture committed to giving; every year we donate time and resources in our communities
A fun, dynamic team that works and plays every day; great ideas can come as easily teaming up in a virtual escape room or channeling your inner artist over a paint night

Bonus points

Check out https://telus.com/digital/blog to see how we solve challenging problems for millions of customers with innovative tools.
job_title: Senior Product Manager - Digital Data Analytics Platform Team | TELUS Digital

job_description:
Firmex is a global software-as-a-service provider with corporate headquarters in Toronto, Canada. The company’s Firmex VDR product is the world’s most trusted virtual data room, having been used by over 140,000 companies worldwide to share confidential documents for due diligence, litigation and compliance.
Firmex is currently operating 100% remotely during the pandemic. Once it is safe to do so, you will have the flexibility to work in the office or continue to work from home...or a mix of both!
The role is diverse, it combines Data Science, Business Intelligence and Data Engineering. The Data Science/BI Reporting Lead will experiment, design, maintain & create algorithms and models. These algorithms & models will measure/predict customer engagement, M&A deal flow, marketing engagement, etc. You will create dashboards, reports and data visualizations that tell a story and help the business units to make data driven decisions. You will be responsible from a high level perspective for all enterprise data science and reporting. You will also assist our data engineering team on creating data pipelines.
We need a Data Scientist/BI Reporting Lead who wants to:
Work with BI & Analytics, Product, Marketing, Sales and Customer Operations & Growth to identify and answer important questions related to the customer success, product management and marketing of our product.
Collect and document data and business requirements from the different business units.
35% Predictive Models & Advanced Analytics, 45% Business Intelligence Reporting/Visualizations/Data Architecture and 20% Data Engineering.
Create, maintain and improve operational predictive models such as product usage model, M&A deal flow predictor, etc.
Ownership of Tableau BI Environment.
Answer the Product, Sales and Marketing questions by using appropriate statistical techniques & data visualization techniques on available data.
Create visualizations, dashboards and ad-hoc requests using Tableau.
Communicate findings to Managers, Directors and VP in various departments.
Have an ability to collect & extract data from our Data Warehouse (on premise & AWS cloud) and a variety of other Big Data/Cloud based sources for your analysis.
Support the data engineering team by creating data integration processes by extracting data from a variety of cloud based applications.
Mentorship of Data Science and Business intelligence to junior resources.
Required skills and experience of a Data Scientist/BI Reporting Lead:
A Computer Science or Statistics background.
Extensive experience solving analytical problems using quantitative approaches.
Strong business acumen and advanced technical skills. Ability to translate technical processes to business processes and vice versa.
Experience with Data Visualizations tools such as Tableau, Power BI & Looker.
Experience in Machine Learning and Statistics.
Strong knowledge of Python both from a data science (Pandas) and data engineering perspective.
Strong experience with relational databases & SQL.
Strong business acumen and advanced technical skills. Ability to translate technical processes to business processes and vice versa.
A strong passion for empirical research and for answering hard questions with data.
A flexible analytic approach that allows for results at varying levels of precision.
A creative thinker and feedback-driven.
A strong initiative and self-directed.
A strong customer focus and strong customer relationship management skills.
Good organizational, time management and prioritizing skills.
Thrive in a fast paced, high pressure environment.
Knowledge of Data Warehouse & Data Lake database design
Experience with data pipelines using API’s.
Experience with AWS, S3, Redshift, RDS & Airflow or other Cloud service is helpful.
Nice to have experience with agile methodologies and technologies such as Jira, Confluence & Bit Bucket.
Note: This is a summary of the duties that are essential to this role and is not an exhaustive list. Firmex reserves the right to add or amend duties as necessary.
At Firmex, we’re successful because we care about our clients, and our team members share our core values of humour, success, respect and collaboration. We know that success is derived from motivated people who take pride in building a business that makes a difference.
Firmex is an equal-opportunity employer strongly committed to diversity and inclusion within the workplace.

Firmex welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities and can make accommodations on request for candidates throughout all aspects of the hiring process.
If this looks like a great opportunity for you, please apply!

About Klick Health
Meet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we’re still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we’re constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We’re one of the country’s Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!
Position Details
As a Manager of Analytics, you will be responsible for providing rich, data-driven insights and sound measurement strategy for a number of Klick’s healthcare focused clients. You should be a strategically-oriented thinker with the curiosity to keep up in the rapidly evolving analytics industry. This role will require a leader with an appetite for developing and sharing best practices, championing new methods and identifying product development opportunities. All-in-all, the successful candidate will be an extraordinarily well-rounded individual who can work well cross-functionally and has a passion for helping clients and colleagues through a logical, evidence-based thought process.
Main responsibilities to our clients:
Listen to client business challenges and provide thoughtful advice on the techniques with which Analytics can address them
Develop and maintain robust measurement plans and strategy documents, including but not limited to data collection and implementation, A/B testing strategy, and performance indicators/benchmarks
Use all available data to build models that enhance our clients’ understanding of what drives their marketing performance and ROI
Perform deep dive analyses and executive level reports that provide logical improvement recommendations and insightful strategic content
Design integrated marketing dashboards using best-in-class tools and data visualization best practices to efficiently convey business insights
Champion the collection and use of high value data across all components of the digital ecosystems of your clients, including paid search, display, social, CRM, websites and other channels
Be an expert storyteller when communicating insights with a clear “so-what”
Whenever appropriate, travel to client offices to deliver presentations and participate in meetings that are most effective in face-to-face settings
Document scope and estimate effort required for all Analytics deliverables so that we set expectations with all stakeholders up front
Organically grow the scope of business with our clients by providing top-notch service, anticipating their needs and building a reputation as a trusted advisor
Responsibilities with respect to practice development:
Proactively identify opportunities for process development across the Analytics team and champion their adoption on the team and across the Klick organization
Build relationships with the core team assigned to your accounts, including colleagues in our Strategy, Media, User Experience, Tech, Client Service and Project Management teams. These are smart, experienced people with diverse backgrounds and incorporating their perspectives strengthens the work we do for our clients.
Keep up to date and share valuable industry news, best practices and otherwise useful information to ensure the practice remains cutting edge. In doing so, seek out potential new partnerships and vendors to evaluate who may strengthen our knowledge and offerings to healthcare clients.
Mentor team of analysts (reporting directly to you, or not), with an emphasis on goal setting and their own personal development. Provide them with opportunities that grow their capabilities. Help create leaders.
Support and participate in screening and hiring processes; when appropriate, build a case for hiring new members to your team
Develop goals and career progression plans for direct reports; provide regular feedback and become advocates for their career growth
Requirements:
5-7 years’ experience in digital marketing and analytics at a minimum
3 year minimum experience in professional services/consulting environment
Proven ability and desire to mentor others (within both formal and informal reporting relationships)
Applied knowledge of test and experimental design principles
Strong presentation skills – able to confidently and naturally to senior level audiences
Natural curiosity and drive to learn new techniques, processes and other capabilities that are relevant to your role
Excellent interpersonal skills, both written and verbal; ability to gain consensus from multiple parties with sometimes diverse goals
Hands on experience with:
Digital analytics tools: in particular Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics
Analytical programming: SQL / Python / R
Digital paid media channels: Google Adwords, Bing, DoubleClick Campaign Manager
Data visualization software: Tableau, Google Data Studio
What makes Klick different?
You’ll work on numerous multi-million dollar brands—the size and breadth of the accounts here are incomparable to most agencies. We believe in putting our people first, and always make that our priority. This and our other timeless principles have made all the difference in our over two decades of success. By having an entrepreneurial spirit, playing the long game, considering outcomes over optics, and solving challenging problems through our hacker roots, we live our difference in all that we do. You’ll get to experience a high level of trust and be given the freedom to make decisions, judgment calls, and function with autonomy. If you have an idea, run with it! You’ll be encouraged to let your entrepreneurial spirit flourish and you’ll work with incredible teams that you can learn from, contribute to, and who will support you every step of the way!
Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.
We’re also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.

Decision Resources Group (DRG), Part of Clarivate, is seeking a dynamic Engagement Manager, Analytics and Insights to assist our mission critical, Real World Data & Analytics team. The Engagement Manager, Analytics and Insights will work closely with Operations teams to ensure engagement success and satisfaction from our largest and most complex clients.
DRG’s Analytics and Insights team provides custom and semi-custom data and analytical solutions to the largest biopharmaceutical and medical technology companies in the world. We engage our clients in a consultative approach, working in partnership to translate challenges into business questions, which we answer using data-driven methodologies. We seek self-directed, critical, and inquisitive professionals who are capable of proposing, executing, and owning such engagements, and who are excited by applying advanced methods to big data to solve consequential and complex problems.
Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
Independently manage and lead Real World Data-based data analytics projects through execution and delivery with minimal support from their manager; leading client interactions, project success, and client satisfaction for a portfolio of clients
Execute and support on larger, complex engagements in collaboration with senior team members
Create and communicate client-ready deliverables that clearly answer business questions; and ensuring high quality outputs and results that make sense in business and therapy area context
Facilitate workshops with clients to understand needs and how to leverage Real World Data to meet those needs
Support the growth of the Analytics business by driving or contributing to the sale of data, services, and advanced analytics
Collaborate with teams across DRG to leverage Subject Matter Experts and Thought Leadership to promote DRG services
Serve as mentor to junior team members, identifying their areas of growth and providing constructive feedback
Education, Experience, and Competencies Required:
BA/BS in a science, engineering, or business-related field is required; graduate degree preferred
5-8 years of experience in project management, data analysis and/or consulting roles, including experience in client-facing roles of increasing responsibility
Familiarity in healthcare, and specifically life sciences is required
Excellent presentation, verbal, and written communications skills
Structured thinker able to quickly analyze and distill key issues
Passion for solving complex data challenges and ability to communicate them in a concise fashion
Experience working with Real World Data is an asset
It is the policy of Clarivate to provide equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Clarivate will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

The Company
Nelson is Canada’s leading K-12 educational publisher and has served the education community for over a century. The organization exists to reimagine learning solutions that empower student and educator success. Nelson dedicates its business efforts to the creation of world class, innovative solutions that support educators and foster learning experiences to meet the individualized needs of every student. At the core of Nelson’s mission, is a strong belief and firm commitment to equity and access to education for all students.
The Position
Working primarily with user data and platform analytics, the Manager, Data Systems will support the Product team to ensure meaningful, accurate, and current data is captured and reported on. The ideal candidate will be 80% data analyst, and 20% business analyst, bringing critical data to bear on key business issues. Specific responsibilities will include advising on and building datasets and dashboards based on identified business requirements, including platform adoption (features and specific content), overall user experience (by key user segments, e.g., teachers, students, specific provinces and accounts), and supporting the product, sales, and marketing teams in using this data to inform improvements in the platform and ensure customer retention.
Requirements
Overall Responsibilities:
Helping develop dashboards, reports, and custom analyses for all Edwin teams (CX, Sales, Success, Publishing, Marketing, Finance)
Specific Responsibilities
Developing integrations between marketing automation (MailChimp) and user authorized system (Edwin Ops)
Developing custom licensing form(s) to streamline onboarding process for customers and support team
Managing data for “engagement dashboards” for Sales and Success team to monitor account activity, and dashboards for specific user segments
Building and managing dashboards to monitor usage of specific app features, content, and tools by user segment
Building and managing dashboards to monitor performance (eg. customer acquisition & retention funnels)
Day-to-Day Responsibilities:
Managing existing reporting environments and building specifications for further development, including data sources, security, and metadata
Managing confidential user data, including managing internal users and user roles
Providing quality assurance of imported data, working with subject matter experts if necessary
Processing confidential data and information according to guidelines
Supporting initiatives for data integrity and normalization
Assessing and implementing new or upgraded software and assisting with strategic decisions on new systems
Building dashboards for ongoing templated data retrieval by business users
Generating reports from single or multiple systems
Troubleshooting the reporting database environment and reports
Evaluating changes and updates to source platform systems
Training end users on new reports and dashboards
Providing technical expertise in data storage structures, data mining, and data cleansing as needed

Education and Technical Skills
Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university or college in computer science or related field
1-3 years of related work experience as a data analyst or in a related field
Familiarity with multiple database and visualization tools (e.g., Google Analytics & Data Studio, Qlikview, Power BI, MongoDB Atlas)
Ability to work with stakeholders to assess business needs, potential risks, and write requirements for engineering team as need be
Ability to analyze existing tools and databases and provide software solution recommendations
Ability to translate business requirements into non-technical, lay terms
Demonstrated experience in handling large data sets and relational databases
Understanding of addressing and metadata standards
High-level written and verbal communication skills

The Data Platforms Engineering team at Wayfair is responsible for the core technologies that underlie a cutting-edge ecommerce business and exceptional customer experience, from order processing and logistics optimization to machine learning and AI. Our team is looking for smart, passionate, and curious people who are excited to help us scale our distributed storage, data processing, and analytics platforms. With the broad set of technologies we are using and the scale at which our systems operate, you will have the opportunity to grow your skills and be exposed to new people and ideas who work on a diverse set of cutting-edge technologies. If you are the type of person who is fascinated by engineering extremely large deployments of high-volume systems, skilled in designing scalable automation for maintaining them, and are passionate about troubleshooting challenging technical problems involving distributed systems, we should talk.


What You’ll Do


Own one of our core platform teams and architect solutions at scale to empower a global user base of tens of thousands of data consumers and thousands of data scientists, engineers, and analysts.
Build relationships with technical leaders and business decision-makers to develop cross functional technology and improve collaboration, decision-making, and influence decisions.
Own the development and operation of the platform, advocating for best practices to ensure up-time/reliability and exposure/adherence to Service Level Objectives (SLOs)
Build an engaged team and manage the careers of a group of high performing engineers .
Constantly re-evaluate open-source, marketing, and internal solutions to keep current with industry trends and emerging technologies.
Contribute to shared toolings and standards to improve the productivity and quality of the broader data infrastructure org.

What You Have
7+ years of relevant industry experience in DevOps or Data Engineering in a senior or technical lead role
Prior experience leading/managing engineers in an Agile environment
Experience leading teams working with and managing systems and data at scale
Experience designing and deploying applications in Python, Java, or .net with reliable monitoring and logging practices
Experience with deploying and managing containerized applications, such as on Kubernetes or Docker
Experience with using cloud database, storage, and services as part of an application (GCP, AWS, or Azure)

About Wayfair Inc.

Wayfair is one of the world’s largest online destinations for the home. Whether you work in our global headquarters in Boston or Berlin, or in our warehouses or offices throughout the world, we’re reinventing the way people shop for their homes. Through our commitment to industry-leading technology and creative problem-solving, we are confident that Wayfair will be home to the most rewarding work of your career. If you’re looking for rapid growth, constant learning, and dynamic challenges, then you’ll find that amazing career opportunities are knocking.

No matter who you are, Wayfair is a place you can call home. We’re a community of innovators, risk-takers, and trailblazers who celebrate our differences, and know that our unique perspectives make us stronger, smarter, and well-positioned for success. We value and rely on the collective voices of our employees, customers, community, and suppliers to help guide us as we build a better Wayfair – and world – for all. Every voice, every perspective matters. That’s why we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship status, marital status, disability, gender identity, gender expression, veteran status, or genetic information.

In alignment with our Everest Entertainment Corp values, we are committed to cultivating an inclusive work environment for all employees to positively impact our culture every day and we need you as a Datacenter Project Manager (DCPM).Everest Entertainment Corp’s Entertainment Operations (EO) is the engine that powers our VTuber services. As a DCPM, you will perform a key role in delivering the core infrastructure and foundational technologies for Everest Entertainment Corp's online services.With environmental sustainability and optimization at the forefront of our datacenter design and operations, we continue to grow and evolve as we meet the ever-changing business demands that hold Everest Entertainment Corp as a world-class virtual entertainment provider.ResponsibilitiesAs a successful Datacenter Project Manager, your success will be measured by:Learning and living the Everest Entertainment Corp culture and values. Lead through change by bringing clarity, generating energy, and delivering success.Empowering a culture of safety and security in global datacenter operations by complying with EO safety programs and policies and completing compliance knowledge assessments.Developing positive working relationships with internal teams and external stakeholders.As a successful Datacenter Project Manager, your day-to-day work will include:Create and manage end-to-end project plans and ensure on time delivery.Plan, manage, and communicate end-to-end project plans with internal and external stakeholders and teams.Perform day to day project check-in and update to manage project delivery, quality and cost.Identify risks, gaps, and opportunities and communicate to stakeholders and other teams to drive resolution.Gather and provide feedback on lessons learned, best practices, and innovations on process/procedures and tools to improve efficiencies and productivity.Be part of a mobilization team that supports deployments and break/fix activities at datacenter locations experiencing high work volumes.Manage industry compliance requirements across projects and related stakeholders.QualificationsFor this role, you are welcome to apply if you meet the following Required Qualifications:Strong project management, organization and multi-tasking skillsAbility to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a dynamic and high-pressure environment.Experience in a 24x7x365 production environment or related experienceExperience in datacenter processes and tooling or related experienceWhile not required, we also look for the following Preferred Qualifications:Strong business level English language skills, and experience managing international third party vendors and business partners.Technical College degree or certification in Computer Science, Math, Telecommunications, or equivalent work experience.Strong working knowledge of physical IT infrastructures (e.g., Servers, SANs, Networking, etc.)Perform and execute organization’s safety programs and policies, and compliance knowledge assessments.Ability to support frequent standing, walking, lifting, and working at heights.Willingness to work flexible hours, non-business hours, or other scenarios required by the flow of operations.Background Check Requirements:Ability to meet Everest Entertainment Corp, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings:Criminal Record Check: This position will be required to pass a background check before upon hire.Job Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: $50.00-$65.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Bachelor's Degree (preferred)Experience:datacenter processes and tooling: 1 year (preferred)physical IT infrastructures: 1 year (preferred)Project management: 1 year (preferred)

Job Field:
Project Management
Job Type:
Full-time
Building Location:
Length of Assignment:

Who We Are

BGIS is a leading provider of customized facility management and real estate services. With our combined team of over 6,500 globally, we relentlessly focus on enabling innovation through the services we deliver, while actively looking for new opportunities that will enable innovation for our clients’ businesses. Globally, we manage over 320 million square feet of client portfolios across 30,000+ locations in North America, Europe, Middle East, Australia and Asia. Further information is available at www.bgis.com

SUMMARY

The Manager, Data & Analytics Program Mgmt. is accountable to establish and manage the enterprise wide intake and prioritization process for requests related to BI, data and analytics and the successful implementation, adoption and optimization of the BGIS Business Intelligence Dashboards specifically in the context of new client transitions.

A thought leader with advanced people skills complimented by exceptional analytical insights. Collaborating with key stakeholders to roadmap, develop, and implement complex initiatives. An individual who can formulate and facilitate strategies backed by data.

KEY DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

People Leadership

Demonstrates strong, competent leadership for team members to guide them in reaching their full potential and meeting their objectives, which supports achievement of our corporate goals. Specifically, these responsibilities include but not limited to:

Full involvement with recruiting talent.
Provides mentoring, coaching and guidance to all team members.
Objectively recommends compensation adjustments.
Manages all aspects of performance.

Demand Management and Communication

Represent the Corporate BI and Analytics team in the intake process assessment which would include understanding the scope of the solution, alignment with strategic goals and product roadmaps, pricing/cost estimates and to provide regular communication and feedback to clients on the prioritized initiatives.
Building a pipeline of product backlog and initiatives, running an effective triage and prioritization forums with key sponsors.
Collaborate with technology and business teams to ensure there are robust support models in place for delivered solutions.
Establish and manage enterprise data and analytics Intake pipeline and related processes across the enterprise.
Align with multiple business and technical teams on Strategic/Program Roadmap to effectively manage enterprise intake Manage the product development activities; priorities; assisting product owners to manage backlog as required.
Integration of External/Internal best practices where applicable with respect to data and analytics.
Engage BI & Analytics Community to get alignment on priorities (i.e. Coordinating Product review, Intake, and gathering their feedback).

Requirements Gathering

Engage with key Stakeholders to understand business objectives and support these objectives through best use of advanced analytics approaches.
Partner with Stakeholders and internal teams to evaluate initial priority so that critical business items are prioritized and actions in alignment to urgency.
Build and maintain a repository of requirements documents to support Products as they evolve.
Ensure all intake items have sufficient details to hand over to Product team to evaluate next steps.
Accountable for Corporate reports and related communications i.e. Corporate KPI, and Global COO Scorecard. Failure to communicate risks to leadership may lead to failure to resolve and meet client expectation.
Accountable for communication of demand so there are no gaps in understanding account, corporate, and data SLA status to be appropriately addressed.
Responsible to ensure timely reporting and logging of related actions for Executive team to review and reference.
Engage BI & Analytics Community to get alignment on priorities (i.e. Coordinating Product review, Intake, and gathering their feedback).
Lead collaborative sessions with the diverse stakeholders to drive requirements discovery, analytics and reviews.

Program Management

Accountable for Project Management of Products such as client transitions or individual product delivery with appropriate prioritization and communication of risk to relevant teams.
Provide transparent reporting on product pipeline, delivery stages, development updates, team capacity, risks and impacts to stakeholders to facilitate effective decision-making.
Ensure that development projects are delivered on time and within budget by periodically checking the quality of work.
Provide ongoing executive updates, prioritizing initiatives, and escalating roadblocks to executive leadership.

New Business

Actively support Business Development through RFP response, estimates of scope, and client level demos.
Responsible for successful Client Transition Management of Business Intelligence and analytics scope of work.
Prepare and deliver presentations to clients.
Work closely with business leads to ensure that conclusions presented are clearly understood by the client and lead to pragmatic solutions by the account team.

Stakeholder Relationship

High level of collaboration with the stakeholders throughout the enterprise to achieve success.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate and present information to all levels within the organization including executives, tradesmen, management, clients, and external parties.
Demonstrated ability to achieve results through influence as opposed to authority. This is a key requirement to effectively work with many adjacent workstreams.

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Expert level Project Management experience and expertise working in various project methodologies. (5 years +)
Minimum 5 years in data management including enterprise reporting, business intelligence solutions. (5 years +)
Excellent written and oral communication including ability to communicate with users with various technical backgrounds. (5 year)
Ability to co-ordinate with multiple internal groups. (3 years+)
Leadership role managing data analytics, business intelligence projects with business stakeholders. (3 years + leadership)
Data analytics, data infrastructure, business intelligence roles. (7 years +)

Licenses and/or Professional Accreditation

None Required.

Address:
55 Bloor Street West
Job Family Group:
Data Analytics & Reporting
Consults on analytical solutions to understand, analyze, and synthesize requirements, goals and objectives relative to data and business intelligence needs and to enable high-quality, fact-based business decisions to drive better business outcomes. Provides advice on the configuration, functionality, applicability, and usability of data management, data analytics, and data visualization technology solutions. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
Fosters a culture aligned to BMO purpose, values and strategy and role models BMO values and behaviours in all that they do.
Ensures alignment between values and behaviour that fosters diversity and inclusion.
Regularly connects work to BMO’s purpose, sets inspirational goals, defines clear expected outcomes, and ensures clear accountability for follow through.
Builds interdependent teams that collaborate across functional and operating groups to create the highest value for all stakeholders.
Attracts, retains, and enables the career development of top talent.
Improves team performance, recognizes and rewards performance, coaches employees, supports their development, and manages poor performance.
Provides strategic input into business decisions as a trusted advisor
Makes recommendations to senior leaders on strategy and new initiatives, based on an in-depth understanding of the business/group.
Leads the design, development, and implementation of analytic solutions.
Recommends and implements solutions based on analysis of issues and implications for the business
Identifies emerging issues and trends to inform decision-making.
Ensures alignment between stakeholders about business needs and data needs.
Acts as a subject matter expert on relevant regulations and policies.
May network with industry contacts to gain competitive insights and best practices.
Manages resources and leads the execution of strategic initiatives to deliver on business and financial goals.
Acts as the prime subject matter expert for internal/external stakeholders.
Leads the design, implementation and management of new and innovative analytics & reporting solutions.
Leads the design and production of regular/ad-hoc analytics and reporting solutions and cyclical programs; assesses and adapts as needed to ensure quality of execution.
Breaks down strategic problems, and analyses data and information to provide subject matter insights and recommendations.
Structures and assembles data into multi-dimensions with various granularities (e.g., demographics, customers, products, transactions).
Cleanses, manipulates, and transforms data through programming / scripting for model training and validation.
Automates validation tests to improve quality and efficiency of the validation process.
Validates and tests models used in analytics and reporting to assess/address performance and compliance.
Conducts various pre-implementation and post-implementation analyses to estimate/measure business impact caused by model adoption (e.g., revenue increase, cost reduction, corporate brand image).
Promotes reporting automation, self-serve analytics consumption, and the culture of analytics-driven decision making.
Oversees the development and delivery of tools and training, for reporting tools and self-serve analytics used by non-analytical end users.
Monitors and tracks tool performance, user acceptance testing, and addresses any issues.
Develops and manages comprehensive information management systems; designs and/or leads initiatives to improve processes, analysis and reporting.
Integrates information from multiple sources to enable more efficient processes, enhanced analysis and/or streamlined reporting.
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.
Designs and produces regular and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards.
Builds reports and visualizations to effectively communicate data driven insights to users for a variety of audiences e.g. visualization solutions of data into reports, graphics, dashboards to illustrate facts, trends, and insights.
Develops solutions and makes recommendations based on an understanding of the business strategy and stakeholder needs.
Supports development and execution of strategic analytics & reporting initiatives in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
Analyzes data and information to provide subject-matter insights and recommendations.
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Documents and maintain operational procedures and processes relating to analytical and reporting processes.
Builds effective relationships with internal/external stakeholders.
Collaborates with internal and external stakeholders in order to deliver on business objectives.
Operates at a group/enterprise-wide level and serves as a specialist resource to senior leaders and stakeholders.
Applies expertise and thinks creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine.
Implements changes in response to shifting trends.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.
Qualifications:
Typically 7+ years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to Spotfire, Tableau, SQL, SAS, R, Python, MATLAB, SPSS - Expert.
Seasoned professional with a combination of education, experience and industry knowledge.
Verbal & written communication skills - In-depth / Expert.
Analytical and problem solving skills - In-depth / Expert.
Influence skills - In-depth / Expert.
Collaboration & team skills; with a focus on cross-group collaboration - In-depth / Expert.
Able to manage ambiguity.
Data driven decision making - In-depth / Expert.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

At Loblaw Digital, we know that our customers expect the best from us. Whether that means building the best, most innovative online shopping experiences, or designing an app that will impact the lives of people across the country, we’re up for the challenge. Loblaw Digital is the team responsible for building and operating the online businesses of Canada’s largest and most successful retailer. Based in downtown Toronto, we are an entrepreneurial, fast-paced, and collaborative team working towards transforming the way Canadians shop by creating leading eCommerce experiences in the online grocery shopping, beauty, pharmacy, loyalty, and apparel spaces, and we’re only just getting started! To achieve these goals, we are looking for talented and passionate individuals who want to collaborate and solve challenging problems and make significant and lasting impact on Canadians.
You will impact our business by working cross functionally with multiple data sources enabling product, marketing, development, and operations to use data to drive decision making, strategy, and tactics. Data story telling will be paramount as you conduct & frame deep-dive analyses, build dashboards, advise and set KPI’s and be a general data evangelist within the respective Grocery, Beauty, Joe Fresh and, PC Optimum lines of business.
What you'll do
Enable business teams to be data driven and make fact-based decisions while deriving customer insights from digital analytics datasets.
Act as the data evangelist within your stakeholders and tell stories through data that drive strategy and tactics.
Design, build, maintain and validate digital analytics dashboards using data visualization tools (Google Data Studio, Looker, etc.) to systematically analyze customer behavior and traffic trends.
Work very closely with Product, Trading, Experimentation and Marketing teams to define business KPIs, conduct deep-dive analysis, and make recommendations that tie customer online behavior to business objectives.
Package, share and present analytical findings in an articulate and nimble way to simplify complex concepts to small and large business groups.
Help execute and deliver the digital analytics roadmap and demonstrate the value analytics can provide to the organization.
Continuously educate digital analytics end-users and identify opportunities for enhancing digital analytics data, tools and processes to enable them for easy, quick and accurate self-serve reporting.
Act as a digital analytics data SME and consultant across the various business units to solve day to day business problems.
Does this sound like you?
Bachelor degree in Marketing, Business, or similar fields, with a quantitative focus (bonus for advanced degrees).
5+ years of experience in digital analytics/marketing
Solid experience building digital analytics dashboards out of Adobe Analytics (Omniture) and Google Analytics 360 data.
Extensive knowledge of data visualization tools and techniques (Tableau, PowerBI, Looker, etc.).
Demonstrated track record of successful analysis of online customer behavior.
Product, Marketing and Retail background is a bonus.
Powerful business acumen, with ability to put data in the context of a customer problem and know where to look when exposed to large amounts of data.
Comfortable working alongside various functional teams (Business, Product, Tech, etc.), across various lines of business.
Supportive, with a great “enabler” mindset that thrive on the success of partner teams.
Self-starter, with the ability to proactively make relevant recommendations to the business.
How you’ll succeed
At Loblaw Digital, we seek great people to continually strengthen our culture. We believe great people model our values, are authentic, build trust and make connections. We’re able to keep innovating because our colleagues are passionate about their work and excited about the future of eCommerce. You will get to work with some of the best digital minds and will have the support of world class technologies to craft products our customers will love!
Loblaw Digital recognizes Canada's diversity as a source of national pride and strength. We have made it a priority to reflect our nation’s evolving diversity in the products we sell, the people we hire, and the culture we create in our organization. Accommodation is available upon request for applicants with disabilities in the recruitment and assessment process and when hired. In addition, we believe that compliance with laws is about doing the right thing. Upholding the law is part of our Code of Conduct – it reinforces what our customers and stakeholders expect of us.
Covid 19 Vaccination Policy
COVID-19 is a serious condition and has had a devastating impact on Canadians and others across the globe. As a leading Health and Wellness provider for millions of Canadians, our goal is to help all Canadians "Live Life Well". In support of this goal, we have adopted a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy to protect the health and well-being of our employees as we continue our phased approach of office reopening. Employees will be required either to be fully vaccinated or undergo regular COVID-19 Rapid Antigen Screening in order to access the workplace.

The Technology Lead Business Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. The overall objective of this role is to contribute to continuous iterative exploration and investigation of business performance and other measures to gain insight and drive business planning.

Responsibilities:
Develop creative technical solutions to meet business needs and manage complex, high volume applications in partnership with business partners and stakeholders
Manage multiple work stream and applications across multiple locations
Contribute to formulation of strategies/processes for product development, and governance and contribute to defining standards and new automation initiatives
Develop communication to guide, influence and convince others, including colleagues in other areas
Provide advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business and filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex material from multiple sources
Extract complex strategies from the business and translate requirements to executable actions in an Agile methodology, develop use cases.
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Qualifications:
6-10 years of experience in business analysis or systems analysis
Demonstrated expertise in presenting and using planning tools
Proven diplomatic and analytical skills
Proven ability to manage complex and variable issues with substantial potential impact by weighing various action plans and balancing potentially conflicting needs
Working knowledge of EBT, Domicile tax treatments, effective tax rate, statutory tax rate is beneficial
Familiarity of CCAR, RWA & Counterparty Credit Risk useful
Understanding of Managed Segment by BU/Legal Entity
Knowledge of data acquisition and summary reporting
Education:
Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience
Master's degree preferred
